Cuenca is the capital of the Azuay province and is renowned for its beautiful architecture, its beautiful temples, the four rivers that bathe the city, and the able hands of its craftspeople as well as for its warm and kindhearted inhabitants. Patricia lives in the Totoracocha community, is married and has three children, 22, 20, and 18 years of age. Her first two are students at the Instituto Sudamericano and her youngest daughter studies at the Ricardo Márquez Tapia Institute. Her husband is a mechanic and together they watch after the wellbeing of their home. She still does not have a home of her own; she lives with her in-laws. Patricia prepares meals that she home delivers. Besides, she owns a small grocery store in her mother's house in the community of Limón, which is in the eastern part of Ecuador. She travels there on weekends to see how the store is doing and to stock it with merchandise. She has done this for 7 years. She tells us that five years ago she was a member of the bank but had to leave for personal reasons. However, now she is back and very happy because soon she will receive the requested loan with which she will buy kitchen equipment and pots that she needs to set up her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen equipment and pots for the restaurant.

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Isidra R. es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de frutas y bebidas como gaseosas, agua y jugos todo esto comercializado en su pequeño local donde atiende a diario en el departamento de León en la estación de buses donde llegan muchas personas.
La razón por la que ella solicita el crédito es porque requiere de inmediato adquirir las frutas como lo son bananos y también comprar las bebidas como son gaseosas, agua y jugos para continuar comercializándolos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Ms. Isidra R. is a very hard-working lady, dedicated to tending her business, selling fruits and soft drinks such as soda pops, water and juices. All this is marketed in her small business premises where every day she serves her clients. Her business is located in the department of León, in the bus station, to which a lot of people arrive.

The reason why she asks for this loan is because she needs to purchase fruits such as bananas and also to buy drinks such as soda pops, water and juices immediately to continue marketing them in her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and fruits

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: K. Florence est née le 23 Septembre 1975 à Djidja au Bénin. Florence vit depuis environs 6 ans à Akossavié à Hevié (quelques kilomètres de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin). Florence est mariée à NOUMONVI Alexandre, un revendeur, et est mère de quatre enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Florence vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Hevié. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Florence n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins, Florence vend divers produits (lait, conserves, pâtes alimentaires, sucre, savons, riz, maïs, etc.) et aussi des boissons dans sa boutique size à Hevié. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Florence s’approvisionne. Florence sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’agrandir davantage son activité et de répondre à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle. Florence ambitionne ouvrir plus tard, une seconde boutique pour vendre ses articles.
texts.en:
Florence Zazotti was born September 23, 1975 in Djidja, Bénin. Florence has lived in Akossavié a Hevié for about 6 years (some kilometers from Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin). She is married to Alexandre Noumonvi, a reseller, and has four children. All of her children are in school. Florence lives with her children and husband in Hevié. Together, the couple supports the family. Florence did not go to school. To make a living, she sells various products (milk, preserves, pastas, sugar, soap, rice, maize, drinks etc.) in her store in Hevié. She stocks up on supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin.

Florence is asking for her first loan from ALIDé in order to expand her business and respond to the demands of her growing clientele. Florence dreams of some day opening a second store to sell her goods.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of three cartons of milk boxes, two sacks of rice, preserves and two cartons of sugar

loans.name: Adita Alicia

texts.es:
Adita P. de 46 años, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos  esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo es taxista tiene 4 hijos de 28, 24, 20,17 años de edad. 

Adita comenzó entregando comida a domicilio y poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo incrementar el negocio poniéndolo en un local y convirtiéndolo en asadero de pollos. Ahora Adita empieza a  trabaja desde las 06h00 con su esposo y uno de sus hijos. Una de las dificultades que tiene  es la delincuencia varias veces le han querido robar en el local.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos y arroz para agrandar más el negocio. En el futuro quiere mejorar el negocio comprando mesas y silla de mejor calidad y agrandar mas la cocina.
texts.en:
Adita P., 46, lives in a cement house, that has all the basic services, in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her husband is a taxi driver and they have four children, who are 28, 24, 20, and 17-year-old, respectively. Adita began home delivery of prepared meals and, little by little, with effort and dedication, was able to enhance her business. She is now situated in a fixed site and has converted it into a roasted chicken establishment. Now, Adita starts her work day at 6am with her husband and one of her sons. One of the challenges she faces is the level of delinquency in the area; there have been several robbery attempts. She wants to use the funds to buy chickens and rice to enlarge her business. In the future, she would like to further enhance the business by buying tables and chairs in order to improve quality; she also wants to enlarge the kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, Chicken and Meats.

loans.name: Lester Lenin

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote en León, el señor Lester M. se dedica a su actividad de reparación de bicicletas donde varios clientes llevan dichas bicicletas en mal estado y él las repara eficientemente y logra la satisfacción de cada uno de sus clientes.

Es de importancia destacar que el señor M. es muy trabajador y ha llevado el sustento a su familia. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales de trabajo o herramientas para usarlas en el taller de bicicletas y realizar mas profesionalmente el trabajo en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Nagarote in León, Mr. Lester M. owns a bicycle repair business. His many clients bring him their broken bicycles and he efficiently repairs them, earning the satisfaction of every one of his clients. It is important to note that Mr. M. is very hardworking and has been able to provide for his family. The loan he is currently seeking is for the purchase of working materials or tools that he will use in his bicycle workshop to work more professionally out of his store.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of working materials for bicycle repairs

loans.name: Five Sisters Group

texts.en:
Martha D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Five Sisters. She is 50 years old and is a widow.  She has 3 children aged 15-30 years old and their educational levels are 6th grade to high school graduate.  In addition to her children, she also cares for 2 siblings.

Martha and her family live in the New Matadi community, and she works in New Matadi Peace Market which is about 15 minutes from downtown Monrovia.  She was never able to go to school herself due to lack of financial support from her parents.

Martha’s business is the sale of dry fish. She buys fresh fish from fishermen, then dries the fish and sells it. She has been running this business for 32 years and hopes to own a bigger business in the near future.  Martha started selling with a small amount of money from her late husband.  She has been facing problems recently with the high prices of goods and too many vendors with the same business in the New Matadi Peace Market.

She talks to her customers in a friendly manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.  Martha needs this loan to purchase additional fish.  She dreams of giving her children the best support in every positive thing they are involved in.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Martha is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional dry fish.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo A. P., tiene la edad de 39 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos, uno de 11 y otro de 3 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para dar asistencia a su finca, en contratar mano de obra para realizar trabajos en la finca y así lograr que los cultivos produzcan más. La idea es mejorar y aumentar la capacidad de producción y aumentar el área del cultivo.  Don Gerardo cuenta con área de diversos cultivos en producción tal como café, pasto entre otros. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento y lograr una mejor calidad y  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de su cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Gerardo también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Gerardo A. P., 39, is married and lives with his wife and two children, who are 11 and 3 years of age. He needs funds to improve his farm; he needs to hire labor to do some improvements to the farm so that his crops will produce better. The idea is to improve and enlarge production capacity and expand the planting area. Gerardo has several crops in production like, coffee and pasture grass, among others. He wants to provide proper care so that he can get the best possible prices at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms offered. Gerardo has been a farmer for many years. He hopes to improve his family's standard of living and have better economic stability in the future so that he can continue to grow both as a person and as a grower.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay labor costs for farm improvements.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Virginia is the coordinator of her group, Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding El Seibo, one of the poorest regions of the Dominican Republic, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children.

Virginia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado or small corner store by purchasing rice, cooking oil, white sugar, brown sugar, flour, coffee, potatoes, tuna, salsa and sardines to sell in her store. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing shoes for them as well as in her home where she plans to replace the wooden walls with concrete block. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Rice, cooking oil, white sugar, brown sugar, flour,  coffee, potatoes, tuna, salsa and sardines

loans.name: C2142 Umuhoza Group

texts.en:
Liberathe is 52 years old and is married with four children aged between 16 and 24. She also takes care of one dependent. Her husband is a farmer and they both work hard to earn more revenue, even if in their agriculture activities they do not have enough income for their family.

Liberathe is the group representative of a group which is called Umuhoza in the local language. This group contains six members, most of whom sell green bananas.

Liberatha and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses through purchasing more products to sell. With this loan Liberathe and her group will be able to improve their family situations through providing all the basic needs of their families.

loans.use: To purchase more green bananas to sell

loans.name: Martha Lesbia

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Lesbia R. es originaria de la comarca La Palma a unos ocho km del municipio de El Sauce, su negocio consiste en una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ofrece abarrotería en general a los pobladores de dicha comarca, tiene cinco años de tener su propio negocio y dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado tres créditos para invertirlo en la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jabón, aceite y otros, con el objetivo de ampliar su negocio y así generar más ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
La Sra. Martha Lesbia R. es originaria de la comarca La Palma a unos ocho km del municipio de El Sauce, su negocio consiste en una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ofrece abarrotería en general a los pobladores de dicha comarca, tiene cinco años de tener su propio negocio y dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado tres créditos para invertirlo en la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jabón, aceite y otros, con el objetivo de ampliar su negocio y así generar más ingresos a su familia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, golosinas, pan, frijoles, ect.

loans.name: Apiyu

texts.en:
Apiyu M. is currently in the business of selling bread and charcoal at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock onions and bags of beans to sell.  Apiyu is 31 years old. She is married and her husband is a clerk. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock onions and bags of beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay labour costs and buy tools for agricultural activities

loans.name: Luchando Para Vivir 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Lidia is the coordinator of her group Luchando Para Vivir (Fighting to Live), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago an area known for its tobacco production where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a widow with her three children.

Lidia is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza and is excited to increase her income. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling natural medicines by buying more of the necessary ingredients. She will use the profits to improve her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing women's handbags and shoes for resale

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, de 42 años, es un padre de familia muy sincero y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Elena de 38 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Las extensas tierras que posee, lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona, donde cultiva plátano, Kion y café. Sus productos los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, ya que sus cultivos son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho empeño, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que perjudiquen su producción. En el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras y ampliar su siembra. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy alegre y siempre esta muy al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Walter is a 42 year old father who is very sincere and hard-working. He lives in his own house with his wife, Elena, who is 38 years old, and their 3 young children, for whom he desires to provide a better quality of life. He owns a lot of land and has become one of the main producers in his area (cultivating bananas, ginger, and coffee). He transports his products to the city of Pichanaki to sell them to pre-arranged buyers since his produce is of very high quality. His favorite part of his job is harvesting his crops and he works very hard at it. He has been doing this activity for 10 years and believes that the hardest part is protecting his fields from the plagues that can harm crops. In the future he desires to buy more land and expand his fields. This is his third loan with MFP and he is prepared to make punctual payments. He has already started saving his money for this purpose. His community bank group considers him a very happy man who is always up to date with the news of those who attend their meetings. With the 2,500 nuevos soles he is requesting, he will purchase more fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn V. is from the city of Rizal Santiago. She is 55 years old. Evelyn is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from vending meat, fish and other basic needs. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jeremiah Saiyalel

texts.en:
Jeremiah Sayialel K. is 32 years old. He is married to Nalinkunkera K. and he is the father of two children. Jeremiah is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last three years.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend the twenty thousand to prepare land for planting more maize; maize has proved to be doing very well due to fertile lands in the area. With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his maize production and also start planting other farm produce like beans and potatoes. 

His future dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer owning farm machinery. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: prepare land for planting more maize

loans.name: Nerry

texts.en:
Nerry F. is 51 years old, married and has three children. She and her husband work hard to meet their expenses and  run three businesses: a tailor shop, a clothing store and an internet cafe. Nerry is very busy obtaining clothing to sell, and making sure that her computers are in working order.

Nerry has applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 to repair some of her computers, buy ink for her printers and restock her clothing store. She hopes that the loan will help her continue to run a stable business.  

Nerry is a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT), where she has received and repaid several loans, and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.* She hopes that she will continue to be able to pay for her children's education while covering her costs.

* All CCT community partners and clients are members of fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is made up of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 32 years old and married with two children, ages 1 year and 6 months.  He runs a retail shop in the Mukuru Kwa Njenga slums selling items including soda, sugar, and maize flour.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES through Omori Group in Faulu, Kenya.  He will use the loan to buy a weighing machine and a refrigerator. He hopes to start a transport business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a weighing machine and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya, has been farming for 26 years and has one permanent employee and four casual laborers. Her mixed farm produces milk, which she sells through Kenya Cooperative Creameries, and coffee, which she sells through the Coffee Board of Kenya. She also earns income from her posho mill and through the sale of bananas to the local market.

Joyce has requested this loan of 63,600KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says this loan will help increase her income and enable her to educate her son to the university level. She currently has two dairy cows producing six liters of milk daily but hopes her milk output will increase to over 30 liters daily in the near future. Joyce says the future is bright with Juhudi loans as she will be able to do farming as a business and create wealth for her family.

Joyce is 52 years old. She is married with four children, three adults and one 16-year-old who attends school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es:
La  señora Nataly D. tiene 25 años de edad y vive en la casa de una familiar en el barrio Villa Fatima de la ciudad de Tarija. Nataly no es casada pero tiene un hijo. Nataly se dedica a trabajar como operadora de radio en un sindicato de taxistas desde hace más de 2 años.                       
                                                                                                                  Nataly quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarle una mejor vida a su familia pero ella nos cuenta que tiene un terreno que es de propiedad de su padre y tiene la necesidad de comprar plantines de uva para poder cosechar y vender la misma. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de dichos plantines para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.  
                                                                                                                  Nataly  nos cuenta que quiere darle a su hijo toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Nataly is 25 years old and lives in the home of a family member in the barrio of Villa Fatima in the city of Tarija.  She is not married but she has a son. Nataly has worked for more than 2 years as a radio operator for a taxi drivers union.

Nataly wants to improve her income in order to offer her family a better life, and she tells us that she has a piece of land that belongs to her father and she needs to buy plantings of grapes to be able to harvest and sell them.  For that reason, this loan will be destined to purchase these plantings so that in this way, she can increase her income.

Nataly also says that she wants to offer her son all the comfort she can. That's why her plan for the next loan she requests will be to improve the condition of the house where she lives.

loans.use: BUYING PLANTINGS OF GRAPES TO HARVEST AND SELL

loans.name: Such

texts.en:
Such K., 61, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. K. is a farmer, earning an income of about $1 per day. Her husband buys firewood to resell, earning an income of $10 per day to help cover the family's expenses. 

K. has to spend $40 on food, $6 on electricity and water supplies, and $72 on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of $700 to repair the car in order to transport firewood to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair a car in order to transport firewood to sell

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
El señor Elías tiene 48 años de edad el vive en Viloma una comunidad de la provincia de Sipe Sipe a unos veinte kilómetros de la ciudad de Cochabamba él se encuentra casado con la señora Hilda con la cual tiene seis hijos, dos de ellos ya son independientes  Elías trabaja como albañil en la zona en la que vive y también recibe contratos de otras provincias del departamento de la ciudad.
Elías  vivía en la ciudad de Santa Cruz  hace como cinco años atrás el tuvo que venir a Cochabamba porque tuvo un problema con la cuñada ya que por culpa de esa persona  Elías perdió su casa y todas sus pertenencias en un remate por el banco, el se volvió a levantar y junto a su familia tomaron un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezaron de cero, ahora él y su esposa tienen una casita y terrenos en los cuales van sembrando maíz y la producción sacan cada seis meses esa es una de las maneras en la que obtienen sus ingresos y de la misma manera el trabaja como albañil realizando trabajos de construcción y su esposa trabaja en un vivero cuidando las flores que se producen en la zona en distintas temporadas del año, además cuenta con sembradíos de papa y maíz, con todas esta actividades logra sustentar a su familia. 

 El préstamo que solicita Elías es para comprar una acción de agua para poder  realizar sus regadíos todo el año para sus cultivos ya sea de papa o maíz y de esa manera podrán tener más ingresos y poder ayudar a sus hijos a terminar el colegio.

Elías sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos ya que el no pudo terminar el colegio ni hacer una carrera, pero él quiere que sus hijos si puedan realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Sr. Elias is 48 years old and lives in Viloma, a community in Sipe Sipe Province that is located 20 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. He is married to Sra. Hilda and they have six children, of whom two are already independent. Elias works as a mason in the area where he lives, but he also receives contracts from other provinces within the department as well as from the city.

Elias lived in the city of Santa Cruz five years ago before returning to Cochabamba because of a problem with his sister-in-law. Through the fault of this person, Elias lost his house and all of his belongings were auctioned off by the bank. He and his family picked themselves up and moved in a new direction so that they could start over. Elias and his wife now have a cottage and land for growing corn, which is harvested every six months and provides an additional source of income. While Elias is working as a mason on different construction jobs, his wife works at a plant nursery caring for flowers that are grown in the area for specific times of the year. They also grow potatoes and corn to help support their family.

The loan Elias is requesting will be used to purchase water so that he can irrigate his crops of potatoes and corn throughout the year. This will help him earn more income so that his children can finish their high school studies.

In the future, Elias dreams of seeing his children finish high school since he was not able to earn a degree. He wants them to pursue a degree so that they can help people in the area.

loans.use: Acquire water to irrigate his crops

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is 36 year old Alpha K..  He is married and has 4 children ages 3, 5, 8 and 12 years old. In 1995, Alpha K. established his building materials business, selling paints, brushes, nails, cohesive liquids (glues), etc.  He began his business because he believes business can make self reliance. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 SLL every month from this business.

He needs a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.  Alpha K. has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more of his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 380,000 SLL. In the future, Alpha K. plans to educate his children and build a house.

He is a serious and determined business man, and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: Maria Belen

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal Las Perlas de Manantay, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos menores.
La señora María se dedica a la venta de comida al paso, esta actividad la realiza en la afueras de su propia casa, negocio que genera ingresos y le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, además que puede atender a sus hijos durante la mañana y parte de la tarde.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 comprará 3 mesas y 12 sillas de plásticos, 3 manteles, 2 galones de aceite, un escurridor, servilletas, 1 docena de vasos, 2 kilos de chuño, 1  doc. De tenedores, 2 cajitas de mondadientes.
La señora María está muy contenta porque su negocio ha sido el comienzo de su pequeño proyecto y desea, más adelante, poder tener uno mucho más implementado, pero poco apoco lo va ha lograr, agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo económico.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Las Perlas de Manantay communal bank, in the Ucayali Department. She is 39 years old, and married, with 5 young children.

Maria works selling fast food, which she does just outside of her home. This business generates income and allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. She is also able to tend to her children in the mornings and part of the afternoons.

With this loan she will purchase 3 tables and 12 plastic chairs, 3 tablecloths, 2 gallons of oil, a dish rack, napkins, 1 dozen glasses, 2 kilos of flour, 1 dozen forks, and 2 boxes of toothpicks. 

Maria is very happy because this business is the beginning of her small project. She hopes in the future to have even more, but she is getting there little by little, and appreciates the financial support of Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase 3 tables, 12 plastic chairs, 3 tablecloths, 2 gallons of oil, a dish rack, napkins, a dozen glasses, 2 kilos of flour, a dozen forks, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Rocio

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERESA DE JESUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rocio; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, chompas, polos, casacas y blusas, ella vende en forma independiente y ella también trabaja en la municipalidad en el área de mantenimiento, la socia quiere tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen Rocio is a member of the 'Teresa de Jesús' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Carmen Rocio is 37 years old.  She lives with her partner and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes.  Carmen Rocio sells pants, sweaters, polo shirts, jackets and blouses.  She sells independently and also works for the city as a maintenance worker.  She would like to have a store in which she can sell her clothes.  She is requesting a loan to buy clothes wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy clothes wholesale

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Tnaot Nhi village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Son S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Son S. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. She has some problems because her rice field is infertile. So to improve production, Mrs. Son S. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy fishing supplies because her husband, Mr. Tet Son, is a fisherman who is able to earn some money to support his family. Through this activity, they support four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, but the others are studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
El señor Raúl H. ya ha tenido un crédito con Kiva el cual pago puntual mente y pudo realizare la mejora. 
Esta solicitando otro préstamo ya que el cuarto que construyo le esta haciendo falta las ventanas y puertas para que este ya casi terminado. Ya que es la recamara de sus hijos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una maquiladora en el departamento de producción.
Desea que sus hijos tenga ya su propio es pació en la casa, es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación para este crédito.
texts.en:
Mr Raúl H. has already had a loan with Kiva, which he paid very punctually and used successfully to make the improvement.
He is requesting another loan since the room that he built needs windows and doors; it is almost finished. It is his children's room.
He plans to repay the loan with part of the income that he earns from his work in a factory in the production department.
He wants his children to have their own space in the house, so he is requesting your cooperation in this loan.

loans.use: to put up the doors and windows

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Don Julio César C. S. es trabajador de una empresa de Acueductos y alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de Ayudante Fontanero, desde hace 6 años.

Es soltero, de 27 años de edad, con 3 personas a su cargo de los cuales 2 son menores en edad escolar, vive en la ciudad de Managua en la Villa Pedro Joaquín Chamorro, desde hace 27 años.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL, está agradecido y espera no quedar mal, para poder seguir solicitando créditos y de esta forma ir construyendo de forma progresiva su casa.
texts.en:
Julio César C. S. has worked for an aquaduct and sewer business as a plumber's assistant for six years.

He is single, 27 years old, with three dependents. Two of them are young, school-age. He has lived in the city of Managua in the Villa Pedro Joaquin Chamorro for 27 years.

This is his first loan with Kiva partner CEPRODEL. He is grateful and doesn't want to do anything wrong so that he can continue applying for loans from this organization and progressively building his home.

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Leopold

texts.en: N. Leopold, 42 years old, is a happily married man with 4 children. His source of livelihood is a banana sales business in Nyabitete food market-Rukungiri. The business is lucrative since bananas are a staple food, especially in western Uganda. Leopold combines this business with coffee sales and it is actually the profits from the coffee sales that enabled him to start his current business, which he finds more worthwhile due to the large number of people who purchase bananas weekly and especially on market days. Leopold says this business brings in 190,000 UGX as profit. He is requesting this loan to pay for more space at the market so that he can expand his business operations.

loans.use: to rent more space to expand his business

loans.name: Jose Adolfo

texts.es:
JOSE ADOLFO G., ES DE MANAGUA, TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE PLASTICOS, MELANINA Y HIERRO, TIENE MAS DE 2 AÑOS DE TENER EL NEGOCIO.
ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE CUATRO HIJOS, PERO SOLO UNA DEPENDE DE EL Y ESTA SE ENCUENTRA EN LA UNIVERSIDAD.
DON JOSE ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA  INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: PERLINES Y ZINC PARA REPARAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE  HABITACION.
JOSE DICE QUE GRACIAS AL FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL VA A PODER REPARAR SU CASA DE HABITACION Y AHORA SU FAMILIA CONTARA CON MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
JOSE ADOLFO G. is from Managua.  He sells plastic, melamine and iron; he’s been in business for over two years.

He is the father of four children but only one is still dependent on him; she goes to the university.

José visits Ceprodel’s offices to request a loan to invest in building materials and supplies like: purlines and zinc metal sheeting to repair his roof.

José says that thanks to Ceprodel loans he has been able to repair his house and now his family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase goods for his general store

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas was born in 1964 and has nine children. Three of them are laborers, five are attending in the public local schoO., and the youngest one is 5 years old.
 
Mrs. Meas and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow rice and different vegetables to make their living. 

Now they want to grow rice in the dry season, but they do not have enough money to support that. Thus, in order to support this farming, Mrs. Meas would like to ask for a loan. 

Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to support a dry season rice crop

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Lucia está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas son la joven Neysi Rebeca C. Vallecillo tiene una pequeña librería y comercializa ropa nueva y usada. Esta joven de 25 años inicio con la ayuda de la Asociación de Promotores de la Cultura donde estudio operador en computación y como forma de apoyarlos les dio un financiamiento para que iniciaran su negocio.

Es entonces que C. instala su pequeña librería a finales del 2005 y luego para aumentarlo empezó a prestar con lo cual luego de un tiempo invierte en otro negocio que es en ropa y cosméticos. Ella con el préstamo comprara pacas de ropa y cosméticos ya que en esta época son los productos que tienen mayor demanda.

Sus compañeras son Idalia U. quien vende frescos, gaseosas, comida y cosméticos; Karla C. de 21 años la cual para poder costear sus estudios y lograr ser una enfermera empezó hace dos años y medio a vender nacatamales, platillo típico que se consume generalmente los fines de semana y Heysell Carolina C. vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
Rebeca C. Vallecillo has a small bookstore and also sells new and used clothing.  This 25 year old woman began with the help of “Asociación de Promotores de la Cultura,” where she studied computing and received a loan to start a business.

It was then, at the end of 2005, that C. started her small bookstore and later, in order to grow it, she began borrowing and invested the money in her clothing and cosmetic business.  She will use the money from this loan to buy packs of clothing and cosmetics, as this is her busy season and these products are in high demand.

Her fellow members are Idalia U. who sells soft drinks, food, and cosmetics; Karla C., age 21, who began selling nacatamales, a typical dish normally enjoyed on the weekends, 2 ½ years ago in order to pay for her tuition for nursing school; and Heysell Carolina C. who sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es: Marciano, de 20 años, es un joven muy entusiasta, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Irene de 18 años madre gestante y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Teniendo todavía una vida por delante, Marciano sabe que tiene que poner todas sus fuerzas, para lograr ganarse la vida con su labor y sacar adelante a su familia. Él se dedica a la siembra de cacao, café y plátano, productos que llegada la época de cosecha, lleva posteriormente a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, donde sus compradores conocedores de la calidad de sus cultivos, los compran rápidamente. Marciano en épocas de cosecha contrata jornaleros para el avance de su trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plaga de insectos que afectan sus plantaciones. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el lugar donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante desea comprar más hectáreas de terreno para aumentar sus cultivos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará semillas de cacao para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Marciano, age 20, is a very enthusiastic young man.  He lives in his own house with his life partner, Irene.  She is 18 years old and expecting a baby.  What he wishes for the most is to excel in life.  Still having life in front of him, Marciano knows that he has to use all of his efforts to manage to make a living and to get his family ahead.

He grows cacao, coffee, and bananas.  After the harvest, he takes these products to sell in the city of San Francisco.  That is where his buyers know about the quality of his crops, and they buy his crops quickly.

During the harvest season Marciano hires day workers to move forward with his work.  What he likes most about his work is taking care of his crops so that they are not infested with insects.  He has been doing this business activity for two years.  He feels that the most difficult part in taking his crops to the place where he sells them.  The sacks he takes are very heavy.

In the future he wishes to buy more hectares of land to increase his crops. 

This is his third loan with MFP.  He knows that he needs to make his payments on time if he wants to have access to future loans.  He is a very participatory member of his communal bank.  He will use the requested loan to buy cacao seeds in order to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: Maria Juana C.: D. 37 años tiene 1 hijo,ella se dedica a la venta D. medicina natural y crianza D. animales, ella nos cuenta que lleva ya varios años D. dedicarse a esta actividad y esta muy contenta porque poco a poco se ha hido superando ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. producto en medicina natural ella nos dice que nececita mas capital para trabajar y tambien D. la misma manera poder estar bien economicamente,en sus ratos libres ella se dedica a mantener animales ya que cuenta con gallinas y chompipez ella nos dice que los compra pequeños y cuando ya estan grandes los venD. es asi como poco a poco ella ba saliendo adelante.
texts.en: Maria Juana C. is 37 years old and has one child. She works selling natural medicine and raising animals, and she tells us that she has happily spent several years working in these areas, because she has been able to improve herself little bu little. She is applying for this loan to purchase natural medicine products, because she needs more capital to work efficiently. During her free moments, Maria works taking care of her animals -- she has chickens and turkeys, which she buys as hatchlings and sells when they are grown. Little by little, she is able to get out ahead.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, 34 years of age, is married to a farmer. The couple is blessed with three children. She's been engaged in a retail store for almost three years. She's asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional grocery items to sell such as coffee, detergent bar, sugar, milk, canned goods and breads. She earns PHP 7,000 monthly in this retailing business. In the future, she would like to continue obtaining loans from Kiva lenders to eventually realize her ultimate business dream of starting another larger business.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell such as coffee, detergent bar, sugar, milk, canned goods and breads

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya comes from the small village of Sujuna in Samtredia District. She is 36 years old and works as a doctor’s assistant in a local hospital. Maya is married and lives with her husband, Guram, her elderly father, five-year-old daughter and four-year-old son. The children go to kindergarten.
Along with Maya’s salary (300 Laris per month), the family’s other source of income is an agricultural business, which is led by Guram. The family owns a dairy farm with five milk cows and four calves. Milk is used for cheese production, which is sold by Guram on the local open market – approximately 100kg per month. Along with the dairy, Guram and Maya grow maize on two hectares of the family-owned land. Eighty per cent of the harvested corn is used in the farm for feeding the livestock and the remaining twenty per cent is sold on the local open market.
With thirty per cent of the requested credit, Maya and Guram will purchase fertilizers, which will increase the productivity of the land and thus the amount of harvested corn by twenty to thirty per cent. More corn will be sold on the market and the income of the family will increase. The rest of the funds will be used for bathroom renovation. Maya plans to use her increased income to renovate her house as it is already old and needs some repairs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for maize growing and materials for bathroom renovation.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, who is 38 years old, married to Naomi and the father of two children, has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years. Introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, he is requesting his fourth loan, his previous ones having been repaid well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Stephen hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, American rice, sugar, beef, oil, cheese, chicken and instant coffee

loans.name: Amuloma Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Amuloma” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 3,200,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand their respective businesses.  

The leader of this group is Mariatu. Mariatu is 30 years old and was born in Yeileh, a village in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Mariatu sells palm oil and has 15 years of experience in this business. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to resell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is from the municipality of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is 42 years old, married with 2 grown children. She owns and operates a retail store to make a living. The business is now five years old. Every month, Elvie gets a total of PHP 3,000.00 from the store operations. 
In 2006, she became a GDMPC member. This time, Elvie is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from the cooperative to purchase grocery items to sell in the store. Elvie hopes to sustain her livelihood and expand the selling area for more cash inflows.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
Abdurahim is 31 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper; Abdurahim's business is the main source of income for his family. For the past eight years, Abdurahim has been providing transportation services. He also has a cattle-breeding business. Abdurahim wants all of his children to be well-educated, which is one reason why he works so hard. As a result of his hard work, the business generates an income that allows him to support his large family. In order to provide better service for his clients, Abdurahim needs to make major repairs to his truck. He also wants to buy more cattle. He believes that these things will make his business more profitable. For this reason, he is requesting 3,000 USD.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his truck and to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Joany Arlez

texts.es:
A sus 43 años de edad Joany se considera un microempresario luchador que ha trabajado para sacar sus 4 hijos adelante, ya que sus condiciones económicas no han sido las mejores, es un soñador que vive con la ilusión de brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro. Anteriormente era un comerciante en su pueblo natal, pero quiso emprender un nuevo camino con su familia y llegó a Itagüí, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia donde tiene una tienda que les ha dado el sustento familiar durante 6 años.

Joany sueña con poder incrementar las utilidades y sabe que para ello debe tener mayor capital de trabajo para comprar el surtido en grandes cantidades y así obtener un descuento en la compra y ganancias en la venta, pero el actualmente no cuenta con este capital, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a ir cumpliendo paso a paso sus sueños de darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 43 years of age, Joany is considered to be a determined small businessman who has worked to see his four children get ahead. Even though his financial conditions have not been the best, he dreams of providing his family a better future. Joany previously was a merchant in his hometown, but he wanted to travel down a new path with his family so they moved to Itagüí, a town in the Department of Antioquia. He has managed a store for the past six years in order to sustain his family.

Joany dreams of increasing his profits. He knows that he must have more operating capital so that he can restock in larger quantities and obtain the necessary discounts that will help him earn more from his sales. Since he does not have the capital at the moment, he is requesting a loan that will help him take the next step toward his dream of providing his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with eight children; three attend school and five have already graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her major dream is to expand her business.

With a Kshs 35,000 loan, she wants to purchase cereals, oil and potatoes.  Amina decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, oil and potatoes.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is married to a businessman. She has 7 children who are between 6 months and 18 years old. Four of them attend school. Olive is aged 38. She sells vegetables and has spent 5 years in this business. Olive is requesting this loan to buy more vegetables for sale. She will make savings and pay school fees from the profits that she hopes to make from the business. She would like to have a expanded her business to the scale of 10 million RWF of capital.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria de 62 años es divorciada y tiene una hija que depende económicamente de ella  y que actualmente cursa la educación básica.  Ana cuenta con un  pequeño negocio que en el cual los productos que vende son:  Botanas,  productos enlatados, refrescos, dulces, pan, detergentes y mas, este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos para Ana y su hija tanto para cubrir sus necesidades básicas de alimentación, vestido, techo, educación como para tener una mejor calidad de vida. La hija de la Sra. Ana ya requiere su propio espacio en su hogar ya que el negocio se encuentra dentro de la casa ella quiere que su mamá le construya un cuarto para ella sola pensando en el cual pueda tener su privacidad y Ana quiere hacerle realidad su sueño y es por ello que solicita este préstamo para iniciar la construcción del cuarto de su hija, para ello necesita comprar cemento, arena, varillas y pagar al albañil.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 62 years old and divorced.  She has a daughter that is financially dependent on her and is currently finishing her education.  Ana has a small business where she sells snacks, canned goods, soft drinks, sweets, bread, detergent, etc.  This business is her only source of income for her and her daughter.  It covers their basic necessities such as food, clothing, a roof over their heads, and education so they can have a better quality of life.  

Señora Ana's daughter needs her own space since the business is located in their house.  She wants her mother to build a room for her so she can have privacy.  Ana wants to make her dream a reality and for this reason, she is requesting a loan to start the construction of her daughter's bedroom.  For this she needs to buy cement, sand, and rods, and to pay a mason.

loans.use: purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jacinta Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Con Futuro del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica al negocio de alquiler de cuartos, todo este tiempo fue invirtiendo sus préstamos y ganancias en arreglos de su casa para poner habitaciones en alquiler, tiene 9 cuartos alquilados. 
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 bolsas de cemento, 2 metros de ripio, pago de mano de obra del albañil.
Le falta poner piso a dos cuartos mas y quedaran listos para alquilarlos y así obtener mayores ingresos, su esposo tiene una mecánica y comparten los gastos, los ingresos que genera el alquiler los utiliza para hacer continuar con las mejoras en su casa.
Solo espera tener un préstamo mas grade para poder ampliar su casa y tener más cuartos, porque en el lugar que vive es muy solicitado por estar cerca del mercado.
texts.en:
Sra. Jacinta, 59, is a member of the Mujeres Con Futuro community bank in Calleria, a district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali.  She is married and has three children.  
She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 10 years, using loans from the bank support her room-rental business.  She has used the loans over the years, along with her own earnings, to improve the business and she now has 9 rooms for rent.  She will use this loan, for S/.1,500.00 new soles to pay for: 5 bags of cement, 2 [cubic?] meters of gravel and relevant labor expenses.  
Sra. Jacinta needs to lay floors for two more rooms so that she can rent them and increase her revenues from the business.  Her husband is a mechanic and they share household expenses.  She will use the extra income from the new rooms to continue improving the business.  She wants ever-bigger loans so that she can continue to expand.  The house is near the market and there is a lot of demand for her rooms.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, etc. for improvements to her house.

loans.name: Salawata Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Salawata SHG Group in Western Kenya! George is the facilitator of the Salawata SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

George takes care of six children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order grow enough to feed his family and have additional maize profits to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, George had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest five bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, George will pay for major expenses such as school fees and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of Salawata SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marvel

texts.es: Marvel, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, con deseos de superación, es conviviente con Bernardo, vive en compañía de su pareja y sus cuatro hijos de 24, 21 19 y 14 años de edad, habitando cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Marvel es el alquiler de juegos de videos, para lo cual instaló en su casa un pequeño local contando con todos los permisos y licencias de ley, donde solo se permite el ingreso de mayores de edad. Tiene 18 años realizando esta actividad, logrando con el tiempo hacerlo crecer. Por otro lado tiene una tienda donde vende golosina, en ella sus hijos lo apoyan en la atención al publico. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el buen ambiente que se tiene, y el atender a sus clientes muy amablemente. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta es el desorden que por momentos se ocasiona cuando se llena su local, además de los ingresos económicos que le permiten solventar los gastos de su hogar. Por otro lado tiene planes de cambiar su negocio y abrir una librería y bazar en su propia casa. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de nuevos controles para su videos juegos, y golosinas al por mayor y en variedad para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Marvel, age 49, is a hardworking and dynamic woman who has the desire to succeed. She is in a common-law relationship with Bernardo. Marvel and her partner live comfortably with their four children (ages 24, 21, 19, and 14) in their own home. She rents out video games and has a small arcade in her home that has all of the legal permits and licenses, which only allow adults to enter her business. Marvel has been in business for 18 years and has been able to grow her venture. She also has a store where she sells candy, which is a place where children are allowed. Marvel enjoys her business because it is a good environment for her. She provides friendly service to her customers. On the other hand, she dislikes having to deal with the occasional moments of disorder that occur when there are too many people on her premises. The income she earns enables her to cover the household expenses. She has plans to change businesses and open a bookstore or a bazaar in her home.

This will be her third loan with the MFP organization. Marvel hopes that this small loan will help her accomplish her goals. The amount of 2500 PEN that she requested will be invested in the purchase of new video game controllers and bulk amounts of various candies to restock her business.

loans.use: to buy video game controllers and bulk amounts of various candies.

loans.name: Marveth

texts.en:
Marveth is 39 years old and married to a farmer. To make a living, they plant and harvest rice to sell. They have been involved in this kind of business for eight years. They own a two-hectare rice field. The couple have three children that attend to school. According to her, they should also double their efforts in order to meet all their needs, especially as prices of basic commodities and tuition fees are nowadays increasing. 

As of now, Marveth needs to ensure proper growth of her crop but she has an insufficient fund. She is now asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and five bags of insecticides used in farming.

Marveth would like to improve their farming practices so that in the future, she can also achieve her goal of making her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and five bags of insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Alfonsina

texts.es:
La señora Alfonsina  es una señora trabajadora, humilde, se dedica  a la venta  chiles secos y semillas de chile para  la siembra.
Es viuda ella nos cuenta que a pesar de ser viuda  a podido sacar su negocio a delante y ayudar  sus hijos cuando  la necesitan.
También se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como son: tortas, enchiladas, picaditas, entomatadas, tacos dorados y caldo de pollo.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la comprar de: chiles, cebollas, jitomate, aceite, verduras, carnes frías  y manteca.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en: Alfonsina is a hard-working, humble woman who makes a living selling dried chiles and chile seeds to plant. She is a widow, though she tells us that despite this setback she has been able to make headway with her business and help her children when they need it. She also makes a living selling typical Mexican snacks like tortas, enchiladas, tacos, chicken soup and other items. She is requesting the loan to purchase chiles, onions, tomatoes, oil, vegetables, meats and lard. She is thankful for the support being provided to help her keep making headway and succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase chiles, onions, tomatoes, oil, vegetables, meats and lard.

loans.name: Damaris Del Pilar

texts.es:
Damaris, vive con su esposo y su hija en casa familiar, ella en su casa tiene su negocio de productos de primera necesidad como: maíz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y por la tardes se dedica a vender pupusas dos días por semana los negocios lo inicio por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de mantener a su familia.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar la materia prima para las pupusas y para la tienda como: quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, aceite, azúcar y agregar otros productos como: gaseosas, gatorade, jugos de esa manara podrá obtener mejores ingresos y podrá darles lo necesario a su familia.
El sueño de Damaris es mantener estable su negocio crecer en clientes y siempre obtener préstamos con nuestra institución crediticia para a si mantener su buen recot y darles lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Damaris lives with her husband and daughter in their home. She runs her business selling basic necessities such as corn, beans, sugar, and oil from her home. During the afternoons she sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas] two days a week. She started her business on her own initiative out of a need to provide for her family.
She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for the pupusas as well as items for her store. These include quesillo [cream cheese-stuffed tortillas], chicharrón [pork skins], corn, oil, and sugar as well as soda pop, Gatorade, and juice. In this way she will be able to earn more revenue and be able to provide for her family’s needs.
Damaris’ dream is to stabilize her business, increase her customer base, and continue to receive loans through the credit institution so as to be able to maintain her business and provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase soda pop, Gatorade, juice, quesillo [cream-cheese stuffed tortillas],chicharrón [pork skins], corn, and oil.

loans.name: Gans

texts.es: Gans de 18 años de edad, convive con Elitza de 17 años; habitan en su propio lecho construido a base de material rustico madera y techo de calamina. Los campos de cultivo que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Gans, son el principal sustento que tiene toda su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que su notoriedad de cosechar cacao, café y frutos de maní son de muy buena calidad y por lo cual sus productos son vendidos a buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos, ya que esto puede afectar sus ingresos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los pesados sacos de sus productos desde la chacra hasta los tendales. posteriormente comprará mas espacios de terreno, porque tiene pensado sembrar más plantas de café. Este es el crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesto a devolver puntualmente los pagos programados. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en: Gans, who is 18 years old, lives with Elitza, who is 17 years old.  They live in their own home that's built on a foundation of rustic wood and has a corrugated iron roof.  The crop fields that Gans has obtained with a lot of effort are the main sustenance that the whole family has.  His products are in high demand in the city of San Francisco.  This is because his cocoa, coffee, and peanut crops are well-known for being of very good quality, and his products are sold at very good prices.  What he likes the most about his work is caring for his crops from the pests that can afflict them, since this can affect his income.  He has been doing this activity for 10 years, and he thinks that the most difficult thing is transporting the heavy sacks of his products from the small farm to the drying areas.  Later, he will buy more plots of land, because he has thoughts of planting more coffee plants.  This is his first credit with MFP.  He feels very happy to know that he will have financial support, since this way he will feel sure about buying what he asks for.  He is ready to pay the scheduled payments punctually.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles, he will buy sacks of manure to fertilize his lands.

loans.use: buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is an ambitious smallholder farmer and looks to a future when she is the leading supplier of milk in her area. She's working 10 to 12 hours a day to fulfill her dream. Nancy lives with her husband and says that they only want to have more children when they are sure that they can raise them without worrying about where their next meal will come from or that the children would be forced to leave school because they can't provide for them. Nancy owns a small plot of inherited land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for more than five years. She grows a variety of crops and keeps dairy cows and poultry. The income she makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet her family's expenses. She needs to improve her income level, and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Nancy passionately loves dairy farming and, as she likes to put it, “dairy farming is close to my heart.” She plans to buy not just an ordinary cow but a quality breed of cow that will produce between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and will also go towards the education of her children. She will also benefit from cow manure, which will be used to increase the fertility level of her farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan she will also be able to build a biogas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change her life and improve her living conditions.
Nancy needs a little help so that she can improve her milk selling business and can accomplish her dreams, loan now.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 37 years old IDP and father of 2 children. He is from the occupied Jabrayil region of Azerbaijan. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He is Homeless and staying in a worker\\\'s hostel in Sumqayit city. Saleh opened his business in 2000. He started selling a small variety of vegetables in front of his hostel. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet family\\\'s food and important consemption needs.
In 2004 Saleh borrowed $500 from Normicro and expanded his business considerable reaching in income. He opened fruit counter in the central market of Sumgayit city.
Now, he want to borrow $800 loan to open a vegetable section of his counter and purchase digital scales, though this, improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase digital scales and expand his business

loans.name: Santos Mercedes

texts.en: My name is Santos Mercedes, and I work making piñatas and selling birthday party items. My clients keep coming back for the beautiful piñatas and good prices. Currently, I need to prepare for the Children’s Day celebrations by making piñatas beforehand and working to be able to sell them without any delays.

loans.use: Purchase of colorful paper, glue, wire, newspaper, etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: According to Mrs. Lucy O., she started this business 14 years ago, and her family has benefited from it greatly.  Although she is 54 years old, her business acumen paves the way for her.  She is requesting a loan of $650 for the growth of her business.

loans.use: To buy more plywood to sell.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat has been in business for a relatively short period of time, 2 years. She needed to start trading in the market because she did not have a permanent job or source of income. Muhabbat is 39 years old and married, her husband is in Russia earning money.

Muhabbat sells children’s clothing, her business is small but earns a profit. She travels to wholesale markets herself to purchase inventory. She recently got a loan from MLF MicroInvest and used it to expand her product line. Muhabbat plans to use the new loan to purchase school uniforms.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Мухаббат начала заниматься бизнесом сравнительно недавно. Ее стаж всего 2 года. Выйти на базар торговать она была вынуждена, так как постоянной работы и источника дохода для нее не было. Мухаббат 39 лет, она замужем, ее муж находится в России на заработках. Она продает детские вещи, бизнес небольшой, но позволяет получить прибыль. За товаром она ездит сама на оптовые рынки. В Микроинвест она получила займ недавно и потратила его на расширение ассортимента. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ и планирует закупить школьную форму.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms for sale

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio César is a 26 years old enthusiastic entrepreneur who comes from a modest family of the city of Cuzco. Don Julio César has been working since he was 16 and never had an opportunity to study because of lack of funding.

He is presently living in the city of Juliaca and is offering urban transportation. Originally he drove a small tricycle which he conditioned and improved to transport comfortably 3 individuals, nevertheless the income was insufficient to cover his personal expenses. After having worked very hard for some time, Julio César had saved enough money to buy a motorized vehicle which he also uses for transportation service. He is still working from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. seven days a week to increase his savings and be able to buy another motorized vehicle for rent in order to increase his income.

He is applying for a loan of $425 in order to buy spare parts and fix his vehicle which is his only source of income at the present. The loan will be repaid in 6 months. Your support will really benefit Julio César.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Julio César es un joven de 26 años de edad, emprendedor y con muchas ganas de prosperar en la vida, proviene de una familia muy humilde de un distrito de la ciudad de Cuzco, por sus bajos recursos económicos se puso a trabajar desde los 16 años y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudias, actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca y en principio brindaba servicios de movilidad urbana en un pequeño triciclo el cuál acondicionó y mejoró con el deseo de transportar cómodamente a 3 personas. sin embargo el ingreso que obtenía aún era insuficiente para cubrir sus gastos personales.Poco tiempo después de esforzarse y trabajar muy arduamente hasta altas horas de la noche pudo ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un vehículo motorizado en los que también presta servicios de movilidad. Julio ahora inicia su labor a las 6.00 de la mañanay la culmina a las 9.00 de la noche todos los días de la semana, con el fin de seguir ahorrando y poder comprar otra moto para ponerlo en alquiler y generar más ingresos económicos.Ahora él solicita un préstamo de 425 dólares que utilizará para refaccionar su única herramienta de trabajo y se compromete a devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses. Tu ayuda realmente le será muy beneficiosa

loans.use: Solicita el préstamo para  refaccionar su única herramienta de trabajo con el fin  de  ofrecer un mejor servicio  a la población

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Tâm became a member of TYM fund in 1999. Her first loan was only 50 USD which was invested in livestock. She had a small piece of land. Her family's living condition was quite difficult. Then an opportunity was presented to her. The "People Committee" of her village (UBND xã ) had implemented a program to encourage farming. They would exchange farm land for unexploited one. Ms Tâm and her husband decided to make an exchange for an acre of land for fish farming. She was one of the first to exploit farming. She had some successes and some failures but she did not get discouraged. She was determined to reach her goal. With dedication and determination, she had been able to turn her farming business into a profitable one. Today she owns 1 acre for fish farming, a paddle of 200 egg laying ducks, 150 chicks. She had also invested in pig raising, she has 3 sows and 3 herds of piglets. The production from her family's farm is quite impressive (2 tons of pork, 1 ton of fish, 200 egg laying ducks). On average, her family makes about 450 USD/ month. She's requesting a loan of 950 USD to invest more in her farming (buy chicken feed, mash and fishes).

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1999, ban đầu chị Nguyễn Thị Tâm chỉ vay 50 USD đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ, cuộc sống gia đình cũng quẩn quanh vài sào ruộng nên còn gặp nhiều khó khăn.
