Roberto se dedica ala crianza de ganado ovino y vacuno, teniendo actualmente 30 ovejas y 02 vacunos. También es agricultor, tiene 1.0 hectáreas de terreno agrícola en la cual ha sembrando maíz y mango. 

Roberto esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para que el pueda comprar fertilizantes y agroquímicos para su sembrío de maíz, así como también alimento balanceado para sus animales.

Roberto es un cliente conocido para Edpyme Alternativa, y siempre ha demostrado su responsabilidad y puntualidad.
texts.en:
Roberto is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his partner and his two youngest children,  His house is located in Caserío Guaraguaos in the district of Tambogrande, which is 40 minutes from the city of Piura.  He lives in a rural part of this district and has only electricity at his home.

Roberto raises cattle and sheep; he has 30 sheep and two cows at the moment.  He is also a farmer.  He has 1.0 hectares of agricultural land, on which he cultivates corn and mangoes.

Roberto is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer and agrochemicals for his corn crop, as well as to purchase balanced feed for his animals.

Roberto is a well-known client of Edpyme Alternativa, and has always been responsible and punctual in his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agrochemicals for corn cultivation.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 41 years old and married. He has a retail shop where he sells different goods such as sugar, cooking ingredients, canned goods, soft drinks, milk, shampoo, detergent soap, bar soap, oils, baked breads and other kinds of goods needed in his daily activities. Danilo has had this business for two years and he is grateful because of the improvement he noticed from his business alone. Aside from his general store, he also manages his van for hire. The couple has been blessed with two children and they are generally school-aged. So, Danilo is working hard to sustain the needs of his family and business. Due to the high cost of basic commodities, he would like to have his stocks at his store so that his customers will not always go to market to buy their basic needs. With his goal to buy more stocks of groceries, he is encouraged to take a loan from the microfinance institution.

Danilo is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional groceries such as sugar, oil, biscuits, soft drinks, baked breads and instant noodles; some of the loan will be used to maintain the van. Each month, Danilo earns about PHP 20,000 from his businesses.

In the future,Danilo hopes to expand his store through selling additional groceries needed within the village. He hopes that he will be able to avail his requested loan and fulfill his goals in life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, biscuits, soft drinks, baked breads and instant noodles and to maintain his van.

loans.name: Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Zena, who is in her late 20s, is married with three daughters. Two of them attend school. Zena has been selling mobile telephones and phone accessories since 2003. She works from 7am to 9pm daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more mobile phones and phone accessories to sell. Her dream is to one day open another shop of the same business.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mapinduzi", which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones and phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a farmer in Nkubu,Central Kenya. He is married with five children, two of whom are still schooling. He has been in farming for the last 30 years producing potatoes, maize and beans. He gets additional income from working as a preacher.

Julius has requested a loan of 47,250 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will improve his income and go into paying for the education of his last two children. He plans to purchase a chuff cutter and build a dairy unit in future. 

Julius says poor rainfall and the high cost of pesticides are the major challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat is a 31-year-old young woman, married with two daughters and two sons. Hayat and her family live in Biet Hanoun in Gaza Strip. Hayat's husband owns a carpentry business and needs $700 to purchase wood in bulk. He uses the wood for furniture making due to the increasing demand as summer is the season of weddings and people furnishing their future homes. Hayat took out the loan from FATEN and paid for the wood her husband needed. This loan will help Hayat's husband, who is photographed in the picture here, double his production and make a better income during the summer. Hayat is a conservative woman as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants.

loans.use: to purchase wood in bulk

loans.name: Sara Biviana

texts.es: Sara Biviana tiene 54 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ropa. Actualmente tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que le solicitan variedad de productos, ella es una persona muy carismática y que disfruta de su actividad económica. Desde joven se ha dedicado al comercio ya que ha tenido que luchar para mantener a sus 7 hijos que actualmente ninguno depende de ella es una persona muy trabajadora y ha sabido administrar su negocio muy bien. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes y otros.
texts.en: Sara Biviana is 54 years old and buys and sells clothing and has a large number of customers who solicit a large variety of products.  She is a very charismatic person who enjoys her work and has been a merchant since she was young and has had to make an effort to support her seven children.  Now none of them are dependent on her.  She is a hard working person and has managed her business well.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits, and other things.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Tiessiri V Group

texts.fr:
TIESSIRI V  est un regroupement de 10 de femmes toute  mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MINATA, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 15 000F CFA environs par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI V ambitionnent renforcer leurs capacités financières  d’où leurs productivités dans leur partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
TIESSIRI V is a group composed of ten married women who average 29 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Koula, a village in the Rural Commune of Banco, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their businesses better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown are rice and peanuts. The group members are now on their first collaboration with the institution. 

With this initial loan, MINATA, who is the first person sitting from the left in the photo, intends to buy inputs and assorted equipment and to pay the cost of plowing and weeding for maintaining about 0.25 hectare of peanuts. After the harvest, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco, and N’Golobougou. The customer base is composed of women and men. 

The group members plan on making an average profit of about 15,000 francs CFA per planting. They have the ambition of bolstering their financial capacity and thus their productivity through their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, and assorted equipment

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es: El señor Alejo es carpintero y su esposa lo ayuda en el trabajo. El crédito lo requiere para adquirir madera y venestas (madera delgada) para terminar un contrato que consiguió. Su trabajo de carpintería le ayuda a conseguir los ingresos que la familia necesita mensualmente. Vive en casa de su hija ubicado en la zona de franz Tamayo en  La Paz. Es casado y tiene una  hija. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente ya que le ayudaron para comprar herramientas que necesita en su negocio. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito pasa a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Alejo is a Carpenter and his wife helps him with his work.  He needs the loan to buy lumber and "venesta" (thin wood) to finish a contract he got.   His carpentry work helps him earn income that the family needs monthly.  He lives in his daughter’s house located in La Paz’s Franz Tamayo zone.  He’s married and has one daughter.  The client is very satisfied with the loans he’s been granted previously because they helped him to buy tools he needs for his business.  This is the second time his loan has gone through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy lumber and "venesta" (thin wood).

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is 35 years-old .  She is married and has one child, aged ten.  In 2005, she established  her grocery shop business.  Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Kiva partner Patan BPW and used her most recent loan  to increase store inventory.  In the future, Sabita plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support.

As a borrower extra training is needed in order to improve living standards. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa D. Jesús vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en una zona muy sencilla del país, ella posee una venta D. ropa D. forma ambulante, venD. variedad D. ropa para dama, caballero, niños y niñas, toda D. muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues es muy buena vendedora y la ropa es muy bonita, siempre se levanta desD. muy temprano a comerciar el producto para ganarse el pan D. cada día, es una mujer muy emprendedora con grandes metas para el futuro, para ella la posibilidad D. alcanzar esas metas es lo que hace su vida más interesante; le ha solicitado a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más ropa faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisas, trajes entre otros pues ha aumentado la demanda y no quiere decepcionar a los clientes al no contar con algunas prendas solicitadas. Teresa D. Jesús tiene la esperanza que así logrará darle a su familia seguridad económica.
texts.en: Teresa D. Jesús lives with her partner and children in a very easy-going area of the country. She sells clothes as a street vendor. She sells a variety of clothes for women, men, boys and girls, all of a very good quality and at accessible prices. She has attracted a lot of customers as she is a very good salesperson and the clothes are very pretty. She always gets up very early to market her product and earn her daily bread. She is a very enterprising woman who has big goals for her future. For her, it is the possibility of achieving these goals that make life more interesting. She has asked INTEGRAL for a loan which will allow her to buy more clothes such as skirts, trousers, blouses, shirts and suits among others as demand has increased and she does not want to disappoint her customers by not having some of the items requested. Teresa D. Jesús hopes that in this way she will achieve financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy skirts, trousers, blouses, shirts and suits.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is Hussein. He is from Iraq. He is 50 years old and the married and father for two children, both of whom work. Hussein lives with his wife, children, and another family member. Since 2006, Hussein has owned a bakery where he produces and sells flour-based oven-baked food such as bread, cakes, pastries, and pies. He has more than five years experience in this field and has a good reputation. Hussein's bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

Hussein is requesting a 2,400 USD loan to purchase a large dough machine and an electric diesel generator. His aim is to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a dough machine and a generator

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos, lámparas, focos, y otros artículos que ofrece en el negocio, el desea que con este apoyo pueda fortalecer el negocio en mercadería, ofreciendo a los clientes lo mejor y satisfaciendo las necesidades de ellos. Este es su segundo prestamo, el anterior le ayudo para comprar tambien mercaderia, esta inversion le funciono para mantener a la clientela y poder vender todos los articulos adquiridos, en vista de ello volvera a comprar mercaderia a traves de este prestamo, dandole más vida al negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel is requesting a new loan to buy small electrical appliances, lamps, flashlights and other products that he sells in his business.  He hopes that, with this support, he will be able to strengthen his business with merchandise, offering his customers the best and satisfying their needs.

This is Miguel's second loan.  His previous loan was also used to buy merchandise.  That investment helped him keep his customers and he was able to sell all the goods he bought.  As a result, he will once again buy merchandise with this loan, thereby breathing more life into his business.

loans.use: to buy small electrical appliances, lamps and flashlights

loans.name: Light Group

texts.en:
Patricia is 51 years old and lives in Zvishavane. She is a widow and has 7 children aged between 17 and 34. Two of her children are attending school.

Patricia owns a general dealer store in Zvishavane and has 2 employees. She buys her stock twice every month and her challenges are shortages from her employees which reduce her profitability.

She is applying for US$400 to replenish her stocks. With more income, Patricia will be in a position to send her children to universities.

In the future, she plans to have a butchery and bottlestore in Zvishavane.

loans.use: To buy groceries and clothes for sale

loans.name: Smith Julieth

texts.es:
Julieth vive en el municipio de Caldas en el departamento de Antioquia, con su pareja y tienen 1 hijo de dos años de edad. Julieth es una joven emprendedora, la cual desde hace 5 meses decidió que aparte de ser ama de casa, quería colaborar con la economía del hogar y se dedico a vender mercancía en especial Ropa y accesorios.

Julieth sueña con montar su propio almacén de Variedades en el municipio de Carepa y pese a las dificultades para conseguir la mercancía, ya que les toca viajar hasta Medellín a conseguirla, ella lucha por adquirir el capital para hacer su sueño realidad. Actualmente solicitó un préstamo para comprar más productos, antes de que llegue la temporada navideña, ya que en esta época se dificulta mas el viaje hasta Medellín y las cosas allí son mas costosas por temporada, además de esto, Julieth asegura que las ventas en su municipio serán mayores y mejoran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Julieth lives in the town of Caldas, Antioquia Department, with her spouse; they have a one-year-old son.  Julieth is a young entrepreneur who decided five months ago that besides being a housewife she wanted to contribute to the household economy and decided to start selling merchandise, especially clothes and accessories.

Julieth dreams with opening her own variety store in the town of Carepa and despite the difficulty in getting merchandise that she has to go all the way to Medellín to get she struggles to acquire the capital she needs to make her dream come true.

At present, she requested a loan to buy more products before the Christmas season arrives because during that time the trip to Medellín is even more difficult and things there are more expensive because of  the season.  In addition, Julieth is sure that sales in her town will be larger and her income will improve.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years. He is 54 years old and married to Njoki. He was introduced to KADET by an existing client and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop. In the future, Benard hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale and make more income.

loans.use: to add more stock

loans.name: Wekhakila Group

texts.en:
Amos is the facilitator of the Wekhakila group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Amos takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and to eradicate poverty. In the recent 2011 season, Amos had an excellent maize yield harvesting six bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Amos was only able to harvest two bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Amos and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Amos will save for the future and repair his house. In 2012, the members of Wekhakila group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Amos is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 54 años D. edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa Propia la cual está ubicada en el Caserío la Coruña Distrito D. TambogranD., perteneciente a la Región Piura a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque. Norma vive en la parte rural  D. este distrito pero aún no cuenta con  servicios básicos.

Norma se dedica a la crianza D. ganado porcino y aves D. corral, los cuales cría y engorda para que una vez con peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en mercado local a sus vecinos y comerciantes que llegan al lugar. Su esposo lo apoya en las actividades que realiza.  Los ingresos que perciben les permite para solventar sus gastos personales y los D. su familia.

Norma desea comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, con lo que podrá mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old, she is in a live-in relationship and has two children.  She lives in her own home, which is located in the La Coruña hamlet in the district of Tambogrande.  This is part of the Piura region, and is four hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque department.  Norma lives in the rural part of this district, and still does not have electricity or running water.

Norma works raising pigs and farmyard poultry.  She raises and fattens them until they reach an ideal weight and size to sell at the local market to her neighbors and the retailers who come there.  Her husband helps her in this work.  The income they receive allows them to cover their personal expenses and those of their family.

Norma wants to purchase balanced feed for her livestock; this investment will allow her to continue to grow her business.  It is so that she can achieve her goal, that she has seen fit to obtain a loan of 1,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, with which she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en:
Hoy, age 36, is married and has three dependent children. Two of them work for others for a fee while the last one is still in school. To earn a living, she has been farming on her farm twice per year and she supplements her income by growing and selling vegetables and grass once per month. She has been in this business for more than eight years. She earns less than five U.S. dollars per day. 

Hoy is the second cycled client who successfully paid back her loan to VisionFund. After the loan, she has regular income and can set aside some money. Seeing her business is growing, she is now requesting another loan. She will use most of the loan to buy a motorbike to transport grass for sale, and also to buy rice seeds for her farm. 

With this loan she hopes to increase her business and earn a larger income to build on some savings, to make her living conditions even better, and also to keep her kid in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farm and a motorbike to transport grass for sale

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.en:
Uldarico is from Balide Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 47 years old. Uldarico is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Uldarico owns and operates a business venture serving a variety of meals to customers in the local community. Uldarico has been in his business for over four years and earns approximately 12,100 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Uldarico joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Uldarico is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food ingredients to expand his product offerings. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients to expand his product offerings.

loans.name: Jessica Lisbeth

texts.es:
Jessica, vive con su familia, sus padres y hermanos, ella no tiene hijos, se dedica a atender una refresquería, este negocio lo comenzó por el apoyo de su madre, no tiene un horario fijo, y sus vecinos y amigos son clientes frecuentes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de sodas, jugos, frutas para refrescos naturales, esta compra le permitirá crecer y tener abastecido de las bebidas refrescantes para los clientes.
El objetivo de Jessica es que su negocio sea prospero, tener la clientela satisfecha y vivir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Jessica lives with her family, her parents and her brothers. She does not have children. She is dedicated to attending to a refreshment store. She began this business with the support of her mother. She does not have a fixed schedule and her neighbors and friends are frequent customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sodas, juices and fruits for natural refreshments. This purchase will allow her to grow and to be stocked with freshing drinks for her customers.

Jessica's objectives are that her business be prosperous, to have satisfied customers and to live supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, juices, and fruit for natural refreshments.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
To earn a living, Roselyn has a grocery store business. Roselyn is married with two school-age children. She is 32 years old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor, Siquijor. Roselyn has had her business for five years. Each month, Roselyn earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock for the grocery store. 

Roselyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year. In the future, Roselyn hopes to expand her business and have a savings deposit for her children's future education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Unity Group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) (1,000,000 SLL each). With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their individual businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Nancy. Nancy is 32 years old. She was born in Kenema where she currently resides with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively. For many years now, Nancy has been selling clothes. With this loan, she will buy dozens of units of clothing to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of units of clothing to add to her business

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en: Imtiaz  is 30 years old, married woman; shown in the photo with her husband. She is a mother of 3 children.  Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested for a Murabaha loan of 35000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Imtiaz  has gained great confidence in the business as she has learnt how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.en:
Jose Eduardo is a married man living in Merida, Yucatan. He has been working with a well-known auto company but his income is not enough to cover the basic household costs, which is why he decided to start his own car washing and lube business. He at first started with a small vaccuum cleaner and a grease gun, and with a few loans he has already developed and grown his small business. With constant effort for his struggles Jose has been able to reach his goals and he has given his wife and his unborn children a better quality of life.

Jose needs a loan of $475 for the purchase of raw materials purchased wholesale, such as, car deodorizers, liquid soaps and cleaners, etc. He plans to repay the loan within 6 to 12 months. Help Jose secure the future of his family. They will thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

José Eduardo es casado y vive en Mérida Yucatán, hace algunos años trabajó para una conocida agencia de autos en el país, sin embargo el salario que recibía no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de su casa, es por ello que decidió iniciar su propio negocio de lavado y engrasado de autos. En un principio comenzó con una pequeña aspiradora y una pistola de presión, con algunos créditos que ya ha recibido logró hacer crecer su negocio. La lucha constante y el esfuerzo ha sido lo que ha permitido a José lograr sus metas y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y así también asegurar el porvenir de sus futuros hijos.

José requiere e un préstamo de $475 DLLS para poder comprar insumos de calidad y a mayoreo, tales como; aromatizantes, limpiadores líquidos para pulir, etc. El planea cubrir el monto total del crédito en un periodo de 6 a 12 meses. Ayuda a asegurar el futuro de la familia de José, ellos te estarán agradecidos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 41 year old mother four, some of whom are in still in school.  After her secondary education, she went to work since she was unable to finance her tertiary education. Presently, she retails ladies' wear and footwear in her community. Sarah is a graduate of the KRABAN 'TEACH' learning sessions.  She intends to use the KIVA loan to secure a premises to display and sell her goods. She has already acquired a piece of land for that purpose using her meager resources.

loans.use: To acquire premises for a retail shop

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia I. is 36 years old. She is a specialist in sales of foodstuffs, a business she learnted from her mother. She has proved her credit worthiness for the past two (2) years she has been benefiting from LAPO loan. She needs the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use:
To buy drinks to sell and 
 ingredients for pepper soup

loans.name: Jose Feliciano

texts.es:
I petitioned social security for a house and they granted me one but now I would like to install security measures to prevent people from robbing it and above for my family's safety. I am asking for a loan of $800.00 to install security measures in my house.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

“Solicite una casa de interés social y me la acaban de entregar solo que me gustaría poner protecciones para evitar que alguien pueda entrar a robar pero más que nada por la seguridad de mi familia” Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para poner protecciones en mi vivienda.

loans.use: To install security measures

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is 46 years old and has been married for 27 years to María Benita. They have 3 children: a 26 year-old son who is a lawyer, a daughter that is finishing up her last year in accounting school, and a young boy who is still in grade school.

When he was young, Mario traveled to the city of Asunción (the capital of Paraguay) to study to become a veterinarian. He worked for many years as an assistant in a veterinary clinic and at the same time studied at the university. After sacrificing some years, he earned his veterinary license and returned to his home town, Carapeguá. He began to work independently at the local ranches with livestock farmers.

After a while, thanks to the ranches that would buy his veterinary products and healthy foods, he began a small business along those lines that would actually transform itself into one of the busiest agro-veterinary enterprises of the city.

Mario requests a loan for the purchase of healthy foods and veterinary products for the animals (medicines, vaccines, etc.)

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Mario tiene 46 años de edad, está casado hace 27 años con María Benita y tienen 3 hijos, uno de 26 años que se recibió de abogado, una hija que está cursando actualmente el último año de la carrera de Contabilidad y el menor está todavía en la escuela.

Cuando joven, Mario, viajo a la ciudad de Asunción (capital de Paraguay) para estudiar veterinaria. Trabajo varios años como ayudante en una veterinaria y al mismo tiempo iba a la universidad. Luego de unos años de sacrificio, logró recibirse de Veterinario y volvió a su ciudad de origen, Carapeguá. Empezó a trabajar en las estancias de la zona con los ganaderos en forma independiente.

Luego de un tiempo, gracias a que las estancias le solicitaban los productos veterinarios y balanceados para los animales, el comenzó a instalar un pequeño negocio en ese rubro, convirtiéndose actualmente en una de las agro-veterinarias más concurridas de la ciudad.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de balanceados y productos veterinarios para los animales (medicamentos, vacunas, etc.).

loans.use: Agroveterinary business

loans.name: Chinkiri

texts.en:
Mr. M. Chinkiri was married in 1990 and has 5 children, one daughter and four sons. He is in the business of driving a remork (a motor taxi with a carriage at the back) since 1990. He carries workers from the village to the garment factory site in Kandal Steung district and transports goods to the market. His wife is in the business of hair dressing at home.

He is requesting a loan of $200 from MAXIMA for the first time. He will use this loan to change his remork carriage.

loans.use: Changing a remork carriage

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is a lady of 37 years and is married with four children. She has maintained her kava garden for a long time, which is the only source of income she can earn to help out with her family's needs.

This business is very important, and kava is one of the most valuable assets in Samoan culture. It is used for kava ceremonies during the village council or even a welcoming ceremony, and it’s seldom seen on Samoan farms.

She applied for this loan to buy chemicals needed for the kava plantation, but the rest is for repairing their house. Her business is very helpful to pay for her family's needs, but especially for her kids.

loans.use: To buy supplies and chemicals for her kava plantation as well as for home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for business expansion

loans.name: Kilwoowa West D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Halima N.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. Halima is 35 years old and a widow. She has 2 children aged 16 and 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Halima makes approximately UGX 15000 in profit and with the extra profit from her loan she hopes to be able to buy more cloth material. Halima has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Halima is joined in her small group by Florence K., Zubeda M., Rehema N., and Rovisa N.. Florence K. has a business in charcoal sales and wants to add to her charcoal business. Zubeda M. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to increase capital stock. Rehema N. operates a business of charcoal selling and wants to boost business. Rovisa N. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To uplift tailoring business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
When Ana became pregnant with her daughter nine years ago, she had to leave her studies in Trujillo and go to Lima in search of a better future for her and her baby. She studied psychology at a national university for five years. Happily, she was able to live with relatives during that time and they helped her take care of her daughter. When she finished her studies, she wasn't able to get a degree because the university asked for a lot of additional requirements to graduate, requirements that came to more than 8,000 soles, more than she could afford.

Consequently, five years ago, she decided to open a small business selling cosmetics, jewelry and children's toys. She confesses that she ws very ashamed at the beginning because she never imagined being in that position. Her daughter gave her the strength to go on. Little by little, the business grew and, today, she can support her daughter herself, as she's never had help from the child's father.

In the future, Ana is thinking about buying her own stall in the market because the one she has is leased.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Cuando Ana quedó embarazada de su hija hace nueve años tuvo que dejar sus estudios en Trujillo y venir a Lima en busca de un futuro mejor para ella y su hija. Estudió durante cinco años en una universidad nacional la carrera de psicología. Felizmente en aquel tiempo unos familiares la hospedaron en su casa y le ayudaban con el cuidado de su hija. Al terminar su carrera ella no pudo ejercerla ya que la universidad le pedía muchos requisitos para poder graduarse, requisitos que ella no pudo costearse ya que sobrepasaban los ocho mil soles.

Fue así que hace cinco años decidió abrir un pequeño puesto en el mercado vendiendo cosméticos, joyería y juguetes para niños. Ella confiesa que al inicio lo hizo con mucha vergüenza, pues nunca se imaginó estar en esa posición. Su hija le daba fuerzas para continuar. Poco a poco fue creciendo y hoy, ella sola puede mantener a su hija, ya que nunca tuvo la ayuda del padre.

En un futuro Ana piensa comprar su propio local en el mercado, ya que el actual es alquilado.

loans.use: Buy a stall.

loans.name: Dorti

texts.es:
Dorti belongs to the communal bank Santa Rosa de Lima, located in the neighborhood of San Juan Bautista Mz. b Lt. 28, in the Callería District in the region of Ucayali. She is 36 years old and is a mother of 3 children. Her husband works operating their small boat. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles from the Manuela Ramos organization she decided to invest in a boat to use to provide transporation service.

Currently, she has finished paying for her boat in which, together with her husband, they work providing transportation services to different neighborhoods in the city.

With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy fuel, oil and spare parts for her boat.

Dorti feels more independent and fulfilled with the support that the Manuela Ramos organization offers with its loans.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dorti pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima, ubicado en el Asentamiento. Humano. San Juan Bautista Mz. b Lt. 28, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es motorista. Dorti con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un bote para servicio colectivo.

En la actualidad termino de pagar su bote que junto a su esposo trabajan haciendo colectivo a los diferentes caseríos de nuestra ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará petróleo, aceite y repuestos para su bote.

Dorti se siente mas independiente y realizada por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos con sus préstamos.

loans.use: Buying fuel, oil and spare parts for her boat

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is a young mother who very much wants to put her children on the path to a better life. With her mother-in-law's encouragement, she decided to sell chickens in the rural towns most remote from the city. She quickly made an important contact and she now buys her little chicks at a lower price. This loan will allow her to expand her chicken coop so that she can house more chickens and ultimately increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Francisca, es una joven madre de familia muy deseosa de conducir a sus hijos por el camino del progreso. Animada por su suegra decidió vender pollos por los pueblos rurales más alejados de su ciudad. En poco tiempo de trabajo ha podido realizar un importante contacto y ahora compra sus pequeños pollitos a menor precio. Su solicitud de un préstamo atiende a la necesidad de ampliar su espacio de crianza para albergar a mayor cantidad de pollos y acrecentar sus ganacias.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para implementar su pequeño espacio de crianza.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru:
Adolat is a woman of 52 years of age, married and has six children. Her family makes national Tajik patties at home. All her children are independent and family oriented. Adolat lives with her husband separate from all her sons. Together with her husband they sell food products. Adolat wants to get a loan to increase the variety of the type of bread she makes and has turned to MicroInvest for help.

Translated from Russain by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Адолат женщина в возросте 52 года замужем имеет 6 детей,на дому их семья печёт национальные лепёшки.Все дети у нее самостоятельные, семейные, Адолат живёт с мужем отдельно от своих сыновей.Муж и она занимаются тоговлей продуктами питания,сама Адолат хочет получив займ увеличить свой ассортимент хлебных изделий.Для чего она обратилась в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Sales of national bread

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos started his business from the necessity of having reliable income for the welfare of his family since he could no longer work because some time ago he lost an eye in an accident. He wanted to move forward as a person and to earn income to support his family.

He began selling products in high demand and, little by little he added more merchandise until today he has a well supplied little store selling everything.

He needs a loan of $400 US, which will be repaid in 6 months, to invest in more merchandise and new products, since he needs to have the store well supplied for the season.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con ingresos para el bienestar de su familia debido a que el ya no pudo trabajar por que hace tiempo se lastimo un ojo en un accidente. El deseaba salir adelante como persona y la obtener ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Comenzó vendiendo los productos más consumidos y poco a poco fue metiendo más mercancía que al día de hoy ya tiene una tiendita bastante surtida vendiendo de todo.

El necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para la inversión de más mercancía y productos nuevos ya que necesita tener bien surtida la tienda para la temporada.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his store, to meet the demands of the peak summer season.

loans.name: Thi Ha's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi H. (ID Number 10080005), born in 1984, would like to borrow 2,204,000VND to rear pigs. Mrs. H. is a seamstress. Everyday both her husband and she go to work. Her husband works as a construction worker while she works as a seamstress for a clothing firm, earning stable income. Her family's average monthly income is about 3,000,000VND (about 200USD). Besides the main income from work, she also rear pigs to earn additional income. Her family's monthly income is only just enough to pay for living expenses so she does not have enough capital to do business. Therefore, she ventures into raising livestock and is voted to be the group leader. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. V. Thi Thuy Hao (ID Number 10080018), born in 1980, would like to borrow 2,204,000VND to breed chicken.
  • Mrs. T. Le Quyen (ID Number 10080019), born in 1982, would like to borrow 2,436,000VND to invest in her clothes shop.
  • Mrs. H. Thi Ai (ID Number 10080021), born in 1970, would like to borrow 2,204,000VND to start a tailoring business.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Phuong (ID Number 10080020), would like to borrow 2,204,000VND to sell vegetables.
  • The total amount requested is 700.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Nguyễn Thị Hà, sinh năm 1984 (Ms 10080005), mức vay: 2.204.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Hà là thợ may. Hàng ngày hai vợ chồng chị đều đi làm, chồng chị làm thợ xây, bản thân chị làm may tại xưởng may công nghiệp có thu nhập ổn định. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ / tháng. Ngoài thu nhập từ tiền công đi làm, chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn để tăng thu nhập. Lương của hai vợ chồng chị chỉ đủ trang trả sinh hoạt hàng ngày nên chị thiếu vốn làm ăn. Chính vì thế chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi và chị được bầu làm nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn. Trong nhóm chị gồm có: Vương Thị Thúy Hảo, sinh năm 1980 (Ms 10080018), mức vay: 2.204.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Trần Lệ Quyên, sinh năm 1982 (Ms 10080019), mức vay: 2.436.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở rộng hàng may mặc. Hà Thị Ái, sinh năm 1970 (Ms 10080021), mức vay: 2.204.000 vnđ để làm nghề may mặc. Nguyễn Thị Phượng (Ms 10080020), mức vay: 2.204.000 vnđ để đi chợ rau.

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 30 years old. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 1998. Everyday she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Mwajuma has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania (Kiva's Field Partner) to expand her business. Mwajuma now requests a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan C. vive en la calle Santa Ana  de la zona Eliodoro Camacho  en la ciudad de El Alto. Juan es  soltero y el domicilio es de su propiedad.

Juan trabaja como albañil en diferentes sectores de la urbe alteña, los trabajos en los que se desempeña son variados (algunas veces hace carpintería, otras prepara cemento, coloca ladrillos, etc), su experiencia le ha permitido aprender de todo un poco, por eso es contratado regularmente.

El crédito lo destinará  para adquirir material de construccion (ladrillo, cemento, arena, etc) para ampliar una habitación en su domicilio. 
 
Este es su  segundo  crédito con Impro, los antecedentes del crédito anterior permiten un respaldo total a Juan
texts.en:
Juan C. lives on Santa Ana street in the Eliodoro Camacho zone in the city of El Alto. Juan is single and he owns his home.

Juan works as a mason in different sectors of the city. The jobs that he performs are various (sometimes carpentry, other times cement, bricklaying, etc.) His experience has allowed him to learn a little about a lot and, as a result, he is contracted regularly. The loan is intended to acquire construction materials (bricks, cement, sand, etc.) in order to expand a room in his home.

This is the second loan with Impro. The previous loans provided complete backing to Juan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Qullu

texts.en:
Qullu A. is a 49 year old man who owns his own food store.  He is married and has 2 sons who are both schoolchildren.  

He started his business in 2000 when he realized that there was only bread to feed his sons.  So, he borrowed money from his neighbor and started his business.  Now he sells various food stuffs such as tea, mayonnaise, sweets, etc. 

Qullu has applied for a $1,200 loan to purchase more inventory to stock his shop and increase his income.  You can be a helping hand for Qullu's business development.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Ie

texts.en:
Mrs. Ie K. lives in Preak Louk Village in Kandal Province, where she and her husband, Mr. Chorn Sorn, own a piece of land upon which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Their current rice revenue is not sufficient to support their household, so Ie is requesting a loan to rent a plot of land for rice cultivation and to purchase rice seed to support the field. She hopes to thereby increase their income and improve their standard of living.

Ie is 43 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To rent a plot of land to cultivate rice and to buy rice seed.

loans.name: Abdul Zahid

texts.en:
A. Zahid lives in district 8 of Kabul Afghanistan.  He is a married father of 2 children.  He is an educated man, and a very talented doctor.  

He has a drug store where he works part time.  Sometimes, customers ask him about the medicines, but he doesn’t have them in stock because he is unable to complete his stock.  When he found AFSG, he was really very happy and now wants to take out a loan.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans for the term of 12 months to import more medicines and start working very hard.  It is one of his greatest wishes and he is sure that after this loan he will achieve this wish.

Doctor Zahid is happy.  He wants to say that if we have such great programs in Afghanistan, he is sure that every worker will be able to use it and make a better future for themselves.  He is happy with this loan process

loans.use: To import more medicines and start working hard

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim E. grows yam and catches fish to earn a living. She is able to earn US$2 a day. She lives in Kampong Cham and she has been operating her business for about 4 years. Her husband, Ry Thorn, is a recycler and earns US$4 a day. The couple has six children, three of who are students and the rest are too young to attend school. Mrs. Sim E. would like to use this loan to hire farm workers to harvest and plow her land.

loans.use: Hire workers to plow and grow yams.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda tiene 43 años de edad, cumple la doble función de padre y madre para sus 2 hijas, actualmente viven en una casa alquilada. Ella  viene laborando en el hospital de la ciudad de Tarma en el área de enfermería hace ya 23 años, en esta profesión se siente muy productiva y como tiene muchas amistades, aprovecha para realizar su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, de tres líneas diferentes, todas relacionadas con el rubro de los cosméticos y perfumes, Ella comenta que cada pedido que eleva a estas compañías de belleza es de 900 a 1000 soles por mes, por cada uno de estos pedidos, gana el 20 por ciento, ganancias que son utilizadas para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y para sus gastos personales, ella está muy contenta con su trabajo adicional de promotora en productos de belleza, ya que le permite acumular ganancias, para la comodidad de su hogar. Lleva en esta actividad más de 5 años, y le viene siendo muy rentable, por ello trata de aprovechar al máximo sus horas libres, realizando sus cobranzas y de paso mostrando sus catálogos para los próximos pedidos. Esmeralda es una mujer muy activa, pese a sus dos trabajos se organiza para asistir a todas las reuniones y actividades que se programan dentro de su banco comunal, ella es la presidenta y la han vuelto a elegir en el cargo, siendo este su octavo préstamo, ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que solicita es para la adquisición de cosméticos, además está muy agradecida con las personas que hacen posible este préstamo ya que le permite seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Esmerelda is 43 years old and fulfils the double function of mother and father to her two daughters. They currently live in a rented house. She has worked as a nurse in the hospital in the city of Tarma for the past 23 years, and feels very productive in this profession. She has made the most of her many friendships to start her business selling beauty products from three different brands, all related to cosmetics and perfume. She says that each order she makes to these beauty companies is between 900 and 1000 soles per month, and for each one of these orders she earns 20 percent. She uses her earnings to continue investing in the business and for her personal expenses. She is very happy with her additional job promoting beauty products, as it allows her to increase her income and make her household more comfortable. She has worked in this field for 5 years, and it has been very profitable for her. She tries to make the most of her free time, doing her accounts and showing her catalogues for the next round of orders. Esmerelda is a very active woman, and in addition to her two jobs she attends all of the meetings and activities that are programmed within her community bank. She is the president of the community bank, and has been selected again to hold this position. This will be her eighth loan, and has demonstrated that she makes her repayments punctually. She will use the loan to buy more cosmetics. She is very grateful to the people who make this loan possible, as the loan allows her to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sadriniso

texts.ru: Садринисо очень добросовестная и пунктуальная женщина, которая кредитуется в Микроинвест уже 6 год.Она каждый свой кредит использует для пополнения сезонного ассортимента.Следующий кредит хочет использовать для закупа весеннего ассортиментов детских тапочек.Муж на заработках в России.Садринисо живёт вместе с младшим сыном и невесткой,часть дохода она тратит на проживание семьи, и конечно же на расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sadriniso is a conscientious and diligent woman who has been a client of Microinvest for six years. She uses each loan received to fill her seasonal inventory. The next loan will be used to buy the spring inventory of children's sandals. Her husband is working in Russia. Sadriniso lives with her youngest son and his wife. Her income is used to support the family, and of course to expand the business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's shoes and socks

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 32 años, está casada con Pedro de 40, viven en su casa propia con sus 5 hijos; Wilmer de 18, Luis de 16, Pedro de 14, Jhosep de 12 y Edson de 3. Se dedica al bordado de vestidos en su casa, su negocio consiste en adornar con mostacillas, lentejuelas y pedrería los vestidos que le entrega una amiga suya que los compra al por mayor, pagándole una cierta cantidad de dinero por cada vestido. A su vez Liliana al no abastecerse con tantos vestidos, recurre a sus amigas dejándoles cierta cantidad para que la ayuden con la decoración dándoles un porcentaje de su paga. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede explotar toda su creatividad en ello, además los ingresos son al momento, pero aún así quisiera tener algo más estable que pueda administrar desde su casa, es así que ha pensado en poner una tienda de abarrotes, esto le permitiría estar más tiempo con su familia y generar más ingresos. Liliana se encuentra en su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual y responsable en los pagos, además está muy contenta con su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más cantidad de materiales para la decoración de vestidos y así poder generar los suficientes ingresos para poder implementar su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Liliana is 32 years old and married to Pedro, who is 40. They live in their own home with their five children: Wilmer, 18, Luis, 16, Pedro, 14, Jhosep, 12, and Edson, 3. She works embroidering dresses in her home. Her business consists of decorating dresses that her friend buys in bulk. She decorates with beads, sequins, and stones. She is then paid a set amount of money for each dress. So that she does not have work pile up, Liliana has her friends help with some of the work so they can decorate dresses and then she pays them a percentage of her pay. She likes her job very much since she can employ all of her creativity, and also because the earnings are immediate. Even so, she would like to have something more stable that she could run from her home, and so she has thought about installing a small grocery store. This would allow her to spend more time with her family and generate more income. Liliana is now in her third loan with Microfinanzas Prismo, having been very punctual and responsible with the payments. She is also very happy with her community bank. With the money she is requesting she will buy more dress decorating materials to be able to earn enough to start her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Hawa C.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Hawa M. from Mbeya. She is single with two children, aged 3 and 6. Hawa has been running a "Duka" business since 2003. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the town where she sells common household and grocery items.

Hawa works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Hawa currently earns about 130 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 625 USD in order to purchase more goods in bulk. Hawa thanks you for your support.

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods in bulk

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas.
Maria es soltera y tiene 40 años, Maria tiene un puesto en un pequeño mercado en donde vende especerías (condimentos para comida) que ella misma prepara en su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aji colorado, ajos.
Los sueños de Maria son mejorar su negocio y tener un puesto estable.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Golondrinas (“Swallows”) Communal Bank. Maria is 40 years old and single. She has a stall in a small market where she sells spices and condiments, which she prepares in her home. Maria needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of red peppers and garlic. Maria’s dream is to improve her business and to have a permanent stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing red peppers and garlic.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy I. is 34 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She sells clothes and tailoring materials.She is also a tailor. She is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Rosefe

texts.en:
Rosefe E. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39 years old. Rosefe is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosefe owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Rosefe has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Rosefe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosefe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Rosefe is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosefe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of children and for the needs of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nakanjako Margaret‘S Group

texts.en:
Margaret sells food in Kasubi Market--one of Kampala's suburbs. She sells to an average of 50 people a day and sells to all kinds of people. Margaret buys raw ingredients from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala, and uses public transport to get to and from shopping. Besides frying food, she operates a ladies salon also in Kasubi. She has been in business for the last nine years. She works seven days a week. Her main challenge is the rainy season which disrupts her as she works in an open place.

Margaret is the leader of the five members of this group. Margaret lives and works in a semi urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She is 37 years old and married with four children, ages 2 to 12 years. Three of her children go to school. She lives in a rented two-room house with six people (Margaret takes care of additional family members). There is electricity but no piped water in her home. The family gets two meals a day. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food for the family.

Margaret has been with MCDT for over eight months and is on her second loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cooking oil and wheat flour. Margaret wants to see her business grow bigger and would like to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells salt in bulk taking delivery of stock from Kumasi, which is a nearby city. She says the price of salt has increased quickly, making it difficult to buy more bags. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of four children. All of her children are in senior high and junior high schools. She is requesting this loan to buy more salt from the market of Kumasi. It is her dream to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of salt

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita Sareñogan is from the village of Canicapan. She is 51 years old. Perlita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Perlita operates a business venture in retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately Php2,000.00 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Perlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita is requesting a loan amounting to 3,000 PHP, which she will use to invest in expanding her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Perlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a good and responsible mother to her children. She loves her family and will sacrifice everything for them.  She has operated a general store business since she was 21 years old.  She is now 33 years old and married to Rolly, who has been engaged in a furniture business for eight years. They now have two children. They reside in Branagy San Ignacio, Ilagan, Isabela. She knows that her business is of great help in sending her children to school and providing the needs of her family.  

Flordeliza is hoping that someday, through her business, she can continue to provide the educational needs of her children.  For her to fulfil her dreams, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 8,000.00 that she will use for the development of her store.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Kereta

texts.en:
"Kereta L. (0) is a 52 years-year-old woman living in the town of Taufusi-S.  She is married and has 2 children adult -aged children.  To make a living, Kereta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling animal feed & farm-related products in the local community.  Kereta has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 500 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2002, Kereta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Kereta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 tala WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.  Kereta is now requesting a new loan of 1500 tala WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Kereta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Nyabusozi Twekambe Kahibire Balibina Group

texts.en: K. Balibina is a business woman of fifty years old, single parent of five children and looking after four siblings of which three are going to school. She has been a farmer for over twenty years. She is using the loan to maintain the plantations by purchasing fertilizers, pay wages to the people helping her in the plantation etc. she is a hardworking and active woman. Her dream is to educate her children

loans.use: To maintain the plantations by purchasing fertilizers, pay wages to the people helping her in the plantation etc.

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sarorn S. lives in Samroung village in Takeo province. She is a Pro Houk seller in the local market. She also owns a poultry business and now she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks and duck food for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Hum Mao, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sarorn S. is 35 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and duck food for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To protect her house and improve security at her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called banku (cooked corn dough). Elizabeth prepares the food at home and sells by the roadside in the mornings. She buys goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for some time now and wants a loan to procure bags of maize, etc.

Elizabeth is a 40-year-old divorced mother of one daughter who is in an apprenticeship. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town; however, the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su abuela y sus primos en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Sus padres se separaron hace 10 años, actualmente su madre radica en Argentina y su padre vive en la ciudad de Huaraz.

Jorge había empezado a estudiar la carrera técnica de Administración en un instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo, pero por motivos económicos tuvo que dejarla hace año y medio y con el apoyo de su abuela pudo comprar una mototaxi de segunda mano con la que se está ganando la vida. Trabaja desde muy temprano hasta muy avanzada la tarde. Esta actividad es la única que le genera ingresos, los cuales utiliza en sus gastos personales y apoyando al sostenimiento de su familia.

Debido al uso otorgado y a la antigüedad del vehículo éste ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas y Jorge no tiene el dinero suficiente para repararlas. Por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Jorge desea terminar su carrera e instalar un taller de reparación de motos con el cual pueda seguir saliendo adelante y apoyando a los suyos. El es un joven empeñoso, responsable y muy inteligente.
texts.en:
Jorge, 23, is single and lives with his grandmother and cousins in the city of Lambayeque, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. His parents separated 10 years ago; his mother lives in Argentina and his father lives in the city of Huaraz. Jorge had started to study business administration in an institute in Chiclayo but, due to lack of funds, had to abandon his studies a year and a half ago. With is grandmother's help he was able to buy a second-hand mototaxi with which he is earning his livelihood. He works from very early in the morning until well into evening. This is his only source of income which he uses to defray personal expenses and to help support the family. Because of the heavy usage and the age of the vehicle, it has begun to have mechanical difficulties but Jorge lacks the funds to make repairs. For this reason, he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 1000 new sol loan, which he will use to service and repair his vehicle. Jorge wants to finish his studies and set up a vehicle repair shop so that he can continue to get ahead in life and support his loved ones. He is a very intelligent, responsible and astute young man.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of millet for beverage production

loans.name: Gonzalo Mercedes

texts.en:
Gonzalo is 51 years old. He is married and his three children are in school: two are in high school and the oldest is in the last year of University.

28 years ago, Gonzalo learned how to weld from a family member and began to work with them. Little by little he saved up and started buying tools. Eventually he was able to open his own shop. Gonzalo has received three loans with Fundación León 2000 that he has used to buy tools for his workshop. Gonzalo is going to use this loan to buy materials like iron and welding rods. His goal is to expand his workshop and buy another piece of land so that he can have a separate space for his business and his home. Gonzalo reports that he has a conflict with the electric company that he has been dealing with.

loans.use: To buy materials like iron and welding rods

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprised of 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Elsa is married and a mother of seven children.  One of her sons is studying in Lima to become a police officer and is expected to graduate in June.

Elsa sells anticuchos (meat skewers – a popular evening snack in Peru) in the market in Patria. Her husband runs a meat distribution business.  With the loan she is requesting, Elsa will be able to buy an icebox so that she can buy meat at greater quantities and thereby lower her operating costs.  The icebox would also help her husband’s business.  She also plans to use some of the loan to help support her son until he graduates from the police academy.  

Elsa appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

Elsa is pictured with her granddaughter.

loans.use: Buy an icebox and support her son’s education

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime Antonio tiene 29 años, es padre de familia tiene un hijo de 3 años de  edad. La actividad económica a la que se dedica  es la compra y venta de CD y lotería, por lo que es un hombre muy responsable que trabaja para su familia y que no le falte el pan de cada día. El se levanta muy temprano para ir a trabajar ya que tiene que buscar todos los productos necesarios para su negocio. El está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materiales necesarios en su actividad. su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Jaime Antonio, 29, is the father of a 3-year-old son. Jaime Antonio sells CDs and lottery tickets. He is a very responsible man who works so that his family will not lack anything. He rises very early to go to work because he has to seek out all the products he needs for his business. He is asking for funding to buy the necessary supplies for his work. His wish is to continue to move forward with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lottery tickets and CDs.

loans.name: :  Julio Ariel

texts.es:
Julio T. Martínez, Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Candelaria de Managua.
 El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y uno de ellos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: 5 pliegos de zinc para el techo de su casa de habitación, ya que las que tenía estaban en mal estado.
Julio dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel  a hora cuenta de seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julio T. Martínez works as a hygiene inspector in Managua’s Candelaria Market. He takes care of two children, one of which is of school age. He is married and has had loans with CEPRODEL for one year. In this period of time, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, he has invested a loan in the improvement of the house in which he lives.

The loan applied for is to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as 5 sheets of zinc for the roof of his house, which is in a bad state. Julio said that, thanks to financing granted by CEPRODEL, he now tells his children that they have better security and living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and enlargement of a house

loans.name: Arnoldo

texts.es:
Arnoldo D. N., tiene la edad de 42 años, está en unión libre, y tiene 5 hijos que es su mayor prioridad. Tienen 15,12,9,6 y 3 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para cría.Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Arnoldo trabaja con el ganado desde hace varios años. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Arnoldo D. N., 42, is in a common-law relationship and has 5 children, who are his greatest priority. They are 15, 12, 9, 6, and 3 years of age. He needs funds to buy cattle. The idea is to have cattle to raise. He wants to provide the cattle with the proper care and maintenance so that the best possible income will be produced at the time of their sale. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms offered. Arnoldo has raised cattle for many years. He hopes to provide his family with improved quality of life and economic stability in the future and to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice, soap, cooking oil and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 34 years old and is married with four children aged between 2 and 9 years. Her husband is an agriculture manager and they both work hard for their family.

Dorcas owns a small shop which sells different kinds of products such as rice, salt, sugar and another foodstuffs which are needed in her village. Her business is well-known and is profitable. The hours of her business are from six in the morning to seven in the evening, every day except Sunday.

Dorcas is seasoned in this business, the reason why is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing new foodstuffs to sell. With this loan, Dorcas will be able to be sustainable in her business which, in turn, will help her to save money for her future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reyna Isabel P. G., tiene 40 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es madre soltera, de 3 hijos mayores que le ayudan a las tareas del hogar y su negocio.

Ella tiene una venta de comida típica nicaragüense, y dentro de sus necesidades más apremiantes esta la construcción de su vivienda, le ha ido muy bien en su negocio de venta de comida, tras varios problemas económico-sociales que la han agobiado, por que ha sido una mujer sola que dentro de  sus limitaciones económicas ha ofrecido a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias de vida,  ella ahora solicita de un préstamo para la reinversión a su negocio debido a que planea aumentar la producción, debido que ha observado un aumento en las ventas y planea abastecer esa oferta de trabajo para incrementar sus ingresos mensuales y poder proyectarse a la construcción de su hogar, para convidarle a sus hijos un hogar digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel P. G., age 40, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is a single mother of three grown children. They help her with the household chores and her business. She sells typical Nicaraguan food. Among her more urgent needs is the construction of her house. She has been doing very well in her business of selling food after some socio-economic problems that have weighed her down.
