She is a woman alone who within her economic limitations has given her children the necessities of life. She is now asking for a loan to reinvest in her business. She plans to increase production because she has seen an increase in sales. She plans to stock up to increase her monthly earnings and be able to get into the construction of her house. She wants to give her children a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food and fixed assests to reinvest in her food stand

loans.name: Đỗ's Group

texts.en:
Hà Đỗ Thị is a 26 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh.  Hà is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Kiva partner SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách nhóm 05.

Hà is married and has two school-aged children.  Hà works in someone else's business venture in the services sector providing general services to local community members.  Hà has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide the service.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide the service.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by her from SEDA.  Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Trương Thị V. is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.

2.  Nguyễn Thị M. is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Nguyễn Thị M. is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  Trương Thị Tỵ is a 50 year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hà Đỗ Thị (20203050025) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách nhóm 05 (5).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần thiết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Trương Thị V. (0) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh H.ng thủ công mỹ nghệ.

2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (0) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Nguyễn Thị M. (0) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4.  Trương Thị Tỵ (0) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh H.ng thủ công mỹ nghệ.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely A. is from the village of Bago, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 40 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a business of selling fish. She has been engaged in her business for twelve years and earns approximately $188 a month from this activity. 

In 2009, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to buy a space for her fish vending. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy space/lot for her fish vending.

loans.name: Hibaler

texts.en: Hibaler Ma. A. is from the town of Banga. She is 41 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Hibaler owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-two years now. In 2009, Hibaler joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Hibaler is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to open a sari-sari (variety) store. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz es una mujer muy emprendedora ella tiene 37 años de edad y vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia. Desde ya varios años se dedica a la venta de pan, rutina diaria que Mariluz comienza desde muy temprano en la mañana cuando debe ir a adquirir los panes para posteriormente venderlos por unidad, de esa manera pueda obtener ganancias. Ella se siente contenta con su trabajo pues le da los ingresos necesarios para poder sacar a su familia adelante, además de esta actividad ella también se dedica al tejido de prendas y confección de colchas, con lo cual obtiene un ingreso extra. En un futuro desea seguir trabajando para poner un negocio más estable como una bodega o algo relacionado para así obtener mejores ventas. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar mayor cantidad de pan para así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a very hard working woman who is 37 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own house. For several years she has worked selling bread, a daily routine that Mariluz begins in early morning when she must go to acquire the breads in order to sell them later individually, and in this way she is able to earn an income. She is content with her work since it provides the income necessary to be able to help her family get ahead. In addition, she also works making clothing and weaving items, to provide extra income. In the future she wants to keep working to create a more stable business like a store or something similar to increase her sales. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She has always been characterized as being very punctual with all her repayments. With the loan she is requesting she wants to buy a greater quantity of bread in order to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread in quantity in order to resell at retail

loans.name: Klever Fernando

texts.es:
Klever de 29 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes). El tiene una tienda de víveres, vende bebidas, confites, y víveres para el hogar. 

Hace 10 años tiene su tiene la tienda cuando comenzó a estudiar en la universidad, “tecnología medica”, para poder tener dinero para sus estudios invirtió sus ahorros en víveres y los vendía hasta que se iba a la universidad, poco a poco con esfuerzo surtió la tienda. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 01h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, confites y arroz para su tienda, en el futuro quiere tener su propio minimarket.
texts.en:
Klever, age 29, lives in the suburb of Guayaquil, an urban zone in which the majority of its inhabitants are storekeepers. He has a store in which he sells provisions, drinks, candy and home goods.

He started his business 10 years ago, when he started his medical technology degree at the university. In order to have money for his studies, he invested his savings in provisions and would sell them until he went to school. Little by little and after much effort, he was able to stock his store. He works from 7:00am until 1:00pm every day.

With this loan, he would like to purchase drinks, candy and rice for his store. In the future, he would like to open his own mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Drinks and candy

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor L. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Amor is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Amor owns & operates a business venture providing motor transportation services to local community members. Amor has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Amor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Amor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the third loan taken out by Amor from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Kayainktheke Group

texts.en:
Issa Banard T. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Issa was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Thirty-eight-year-old Issa is married to a businesswoman and they have four children. Two of Issa’s children are attending secondary school and two are in primary school. 

For seven years now, Issa has been selling medicines and cosmetics. With the help of this loan, he and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Issa will use his share of the loan (SLL 400,000) to buy more medicines and cosmetics to add to his pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy more medicines and cosmetics to add to his pharmacy

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a member and the treasurer of the Orogare Bogetorora Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 18 years and has employed six farmhands. Her farm produces maize, beans, milk, tea leaves and millet, which she sells to both the Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market.

Norah has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her cereals business. The proceeds from this loan will help her feed her family and educate her children. She faces the challenges of fluctuating prices and transportation problems.

Norah is 47 years old. She is married with six children who are between the ages of 10 and 26. Three of the children attend school.

In the future, she would like to expand her cereals business and venture into outside markets and also open a retail shop at her home area.

loans.use: To expand her cereals business

loans.name: Salustino

texts.es:
El señor Salustino vive en casa propia en la zona de Las Lomas, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero, es policía y además realiza trabajos varios como electricista, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene y ayuda a su familia. El crédito es para la construcción de una sala, el señor es cliente de Impro con un historial de 4 créditos. 
Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Salustino lives in his own home in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz. He is single and a police officer. He also works in other areas, for example as an electrician. With his income, he supports and helps his family. The loan is for the construction of a room. He is a client of Impro and has a 4 previous loans. His prior history qualifies him for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane G. is 52 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. She is from the village of Sampagar within the municipality of Damulog, a part of Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Maryjane runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Maryjane has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Maryjane joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria Vive en la localidad de el Torno, del departamento de Santa Cruz, es nacida en la Provincia Cordillera  del departamento, su actividad es la venta de pan, y también presta su servicio como limpieza y jardinería en  un restaurante, es viuda y tiene a su cargo un hijo, hace dos año que se dedica a esta actividad, el destino del crédito es para compra insumo para la preparación del pan de trigo, ya que cada día sube mas el precio y no tiene muchas ganancias, es por esta razón que desea comprar por cantidad azúcar, harina de trigo, levadura, etc.  tiene su propia casa la cual le dejo su difunto marido, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria lives in the area of El Torno, in the department of Santa Cruz. She was born in Cordillera province. Victoria earns her living by selling bread, and she also works as a cleaner and gardener in a restaurant. She is a widow and is raising a son. 

She has been working at her job for two years and plans to use the loan money to buy ingredients to make wheat bread. As prices are rising on a daily basis and as she doesn't earn a lot of money, Victoria wants to buy sugar, wheat flour, yeast etc. in bigger quantities.

Victoria lives in her own home which was left to her by her late husband. She is very grateful to the institution for the assistance given to her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago G. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin province. He is 60 years old. Santiago is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Santiago owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing karaoke services, for which customers pay 5 pesos per song to local community members. Santiago has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Santiago joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Santiago has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Santiago is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided and also for the maintenance of the karaoke machine. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Santiago from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided and for the maintenance of the karaoke machine

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two grown children. She is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka, which is a predominantly agricultural region of south-eastern Ukraine. Irina grows vegetables in greenhouses and then sells them in the markets wholesale or retail. She owns two spacious arch greenhouses and a smaller one for seedlings. Irina has rich experience working in this business. She has been growing vegetables for 32 years. She has invested 35,000 UAH in her venture.  

Irina is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase additional polyethylene film and seeds for the upcoming greenhouse farming season. She is hoping to generate additional income. Irina is planning to invest it by installing heating units in her greenhouses. It should be noted that farming businesses are very common for this region, which is predominantly agricultural.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and polyethylene film for greenhouse

loans.name: Jose Marlon

texts.es:
Jose Marlon tiene 36 años de edad , es soltero y no tiene hijos a  su cargo , vive en casa de su hermana en el caserio La Clake una zona rural que cuenta con una población reducida, cuentan con energía eléctrica y el agua la extraen de un pozo tubular. La principal actividad económica de la zona es la agricultura y ganadería. Pertenece al distrito de Reque y se encuentra situado aproximadamente a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo .

José se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el trabaja como obrero en los campos de cultivo ubicados cerca a la zona en donde reside, adicionalmente cuenta con dos vacas de las cuales comercializa la leche que producen diariamente.

José se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de  500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de herramientas agrícolas para realizar de mejor manera su labor y aves de corral , como gallinas ponedoras o patos para engorde , las cuales planea criar para empezar a comercializarlas, para ello cuenta con un ambiente bastante adecuado dentro de su vivienda.

José es una persona bastante responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien amable y respetuoso.
texts.en:
José  Marlon is 36, single, with no children. He lives with his sister in the village of La Clake, a rural area with a small population, electricity, and water from an irrigation well.  The main economic activity of the people is farming and cattle raising.  La Clake belongs to Reque district and is located about a half hour from the city of Chiclayo.

José has worked for more than ten years in farming as a farmhand in the fields near the area where he lives.  He also has two cows that give milk every day that he is able to sell.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 500 new sols that he plans to use to buy agricultural equipment to help improve his farmwork and to purchase poultry, such as laying hens or ducks to fatten.  He plans to raise and begin to sell them and he needs a good area for them to live inside his homestead.

José is a responsible person with desires to get ahead and he is considered friendly and respectful by the people who know him.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment so that he can work more efficiently as a farmhand

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa Emilia, es una señora laboriosa de 64 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su hija de 30 años de edad, tiene un negocio de venta de comida, naciendo este por iniciativa propia desde hace 14 años, trabaja todos los días de 5:00am a 6:00pm, con entusiasmo prepara cada día alimentos para ofrecer a los clientes.
Hoy doña Rosa solicita un préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijol, huevos, aceite entre otros que le son necesarios en la cocina, con este préstamo solventara la necesidad de inversión que atraviesa con el negocio, de igual manera podrá disponer de alimentos para seguir generando ingresos a su hogar.
Su objetivo es seguir en el negocio, atender de buena manera a los clientes y seguir viendo la forma de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia is a hard-working, 64 year-old woman who lives in El Transito, in San Miguel department.  She lives with her 30 year-old daughter and has a business selling food.  She set up her business 14 years ago on her own initiative.  She works every day from 5.00am to 6.00pm.  Every day she enthusiastically prepares food to offer her customers.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, eggs and oil, as well as other items which are necessary for her cooking.  This loan will solve her need for investment in her business.  She will also be able to have food available so that she can continue making income for her household.

Rosa's goal is to continue in her business, serve her customers well and continue getting ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, eggs and oil

loans.name: Charmalou

texts.en:
Charmalou U. is from the village of Miputak, Dipolog City. She is 29 years old. Charmalou is married and has 2 school-aged children. To earn a living, Charmalou owns & operates an agricultural business raising pigs for sale. Charmalou has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns an average of 6,000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2008, Charmalou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Charmalou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase pigs for sale. Charmalou is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Charmalou from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & supplies

loans.name: Enhdolgor

texts.en:
Enhdolgor N. is a 36-year-old single mother who lives with her son in Harhorin, Uvurhangai, Mongolia. They live in their own house with a fence. Her son is a 17-year-old student in a university. 

Enhdolgor began her cosmetics and accessories sales business in 2006 in the local market in a rented stall and has since built a stable and successful operation. She has been importing her goods from Ulaanbaatar, a capital of Mongolia.  

Enhdolgor  says, "I want to start saving money for my son's future education." 

She is requesting a  2,800,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to import more cosmetics items from Erlian, a border city of China.

loans.use: To import more cosmetics items from Erlian

loans.name: Ulziisaihan

texts.en:
Ulziisaihan is 40 years old and lives in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. He lives alone in his own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent inside his sister's fence. Ulziisaihan operates a mobile dairy retail trading business in his town. He started his business in 2008 with the help of his sister. He purchases his dairy products from local herders at wholesale price and sells those products to his permanent suppliers in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Ulziisaihan plans to expand his business in the future by signing with his business partners. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy supplies in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy supplies

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
Anacleta vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco las personas se dedican a diferentes tipos D. negocios y a brindar servicios. Anacleta se dedica a la venta granos secos pero por ser temporada baja no comprar ni venderá granos. Pero Anacleta tiene otra actividad que consiste en el alquiler D. carros para que puedan ser utilizados para brindar servicio D. transporte urbano, ella nos cuenta que por las tardes su hijo se dedica con el carro a brindar servicios D. transporte urbano y que por las noches alquila a cualquier persona que quiera trabajar brindando el servicio. Anacleta requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro ya que está presentando algunas fallas. 

Anacleta pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas D. María” D. la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año D. funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Anacleta lives in the historic city of Cusco, which is in the Department of Cusco, Peru. In the city of Cusco, the residents engage in different types of businesses and proviD. services. Anacleta sells dried grain, but she does not sell during the low season. She has another business that consists of renting out a car to be used for providing urban transportation services. Anacleta says that her son uses the car in the afternoons to proviD. urban transportation services and at night anyone is able to use the car for providing the same type of service. She needs a loan to maintain her car since it is experiencing a few problems.

Anacleta belongs to the Communal Bank “Hijas D. María” (Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Araiwa, in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is in its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well.

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of better manure

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Believe in God” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They run small businesses and have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to receive a second loan. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group is Umu J.. She is 33 years old and has three school-aged children. Umu has a small trading business where she sells milk, sugar, and cocoa. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of these goods in bulk to sell.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, and cocoa in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Christina B., who is in her mid-thirties, is married with three children.  She has been running a food vending stall for five years.  She works from 6:00am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Christina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She wants a loan to increase her food stock. Her business is a few kilometres from the city centre.  Her dream is to one day build her own house and also send her children to good schools.

Christina will share this loan with her group "Compressor", which has a total of 18 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Christina is 1st on the right front row, wearing a blue dress.

loans.use: To increase her food stock.

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en: Jargalsaikhan is 49 years old and the father of seven children. He lives with his wife and youngest daughter in Darkhan city. They live together in a small wooden house on their own plot of land. Jargalsaikhan's youngest daughter, Zoljargal, 13, attends a local secondary school. His wife worked at the railway station as a cashier for 30 years and is now retired. Since 2006, Jargalsaikhan has operated an auto repair business in his yard and has built a successful operation with a loyal customer base. Jargalsaikhan is a helpful person with a good personality. He is planning to expand his business by building a garage. He says, "My dream is one day to change my repair place into a large and warm auto repair service". He is requesting a loan to purchase some construction materials to fix his old house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix his old house

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío D. Carrasquillo, una localidad rural D. pobladores humildes y trabajadores que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito agrícola D. Morropón,que esta ubicado en la Región D. Piura que esta a más D. una cuatro D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un terreno agrícola en la zona donD. resiD.. Ella ya cuenta con más D. veinte  años dedicándose a esta actividad, la misma que aprendió D. su padre y debido a ello conoce mucho del manejo D. estos cultivos. Con los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad se encarga D. sacar adelante a la economía D. su familia.
 
Liliana desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder asegurarse una buena producción D. su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Liliana es una persona bastante hogareña y estimada por las personas D. su comunidad.
texts.en:
Liliana is 51 years old and married. She lives together with her husband and children in the settlement of Carrasquillo, a rural area of humble villagers and workers, located in the agricultural district of Morropón, in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a parcel of agricultural land in the area where she lives. She has done this work for more than twenty years; she learned it from her father, and thanks to this she knows a lot about managing these crops. With the income she receives from this activity, she is taking charge of helping her family get ahead economically. 

Liliana wants to buy fertilizers so that she can ensure a good harvest of her crops. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles, which will help her achieve her objective. Liliana is a person who is very devoted to her home and family, and she is respected by the people of her community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Maria Guillermina

texts.es:
María tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en casa propia. Vive en  el Caserío Fanupe Barrio Nuevo, el cual se ubica a 12 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope. Ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Clienta cría chanchos, pavos, cuyes, patos, etc, los cuales alimenta  con pastos naturales, polvillo, maíz, purina, etc. Quincenalmente los comercializa en el Mercado Moshoqueque o Mercado Modelo de Lambayeque.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para sus gastos personales y los de su familia

María actualmente desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para su ganado Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old, a single mother and lives in her own home. She lives in the village of Barrio Nuevo Fanupe, which is located 12 minutes from the city of Mórrope.  Mórrope is located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

María raises and sells animals, which she breeds in pens located outside of her home. She raises pigs, turkeys, guinea pigs, ducks, etc, which she feeds natural grains, feed, corn, purina, etc. Every two weeks she sells the animals at the Market Moshoqueque or Market Modelo de Lambayeque. The income that she earns from this activity is used for personal and family expenses.

María now wishes to buy more nutritious food for her livestock and is therefore requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles, which will allow her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy nutritious feed.

loans.name: 9 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Mrs.  Thuc is 47 years old. She is married and has two children. Thuc is the group leader of the 7.1.9 Nam Ngan solidarity group, which consists of five members. Thuc lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thuc operates a food stall/restaurant, selling meat. Thuc has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. This is Thuc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thuc hopes to maintain a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase pork

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 41 years old.  She is a widow and has 6 children who are between 7 and 20 years old.  Rose owns a bar in which she sells different kinds of beer. She has been running this business for 9 years and it has enabled her to improve her standard of living. Rose is requesting a loan to buy beer and fill her bar to make more profits. With the profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy beer for her bar

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
William, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, vive con su familia, y tiene un año de dedicarse al negocio, lo inicio después de trabajar como motorista de buses, decidió instalar el negocio que fuera más rentable que su anterior trabajo.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, maicillo, frijol y café, esta compra le ayudara a tener más inventario para mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Su objetivo es a través del negocio mejorar las ventas, ya que al contar con todo lo necesario espera estabilizarse, y así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
William's business is selling basic grains.  He lives with his family and has been in this business for one year.  He started in his business after having previously worked as a bus driver.  He decided to set up his business as it was more profitable than his previous job.  

William is requesting a loan to buy corn, millet, beans and coffee.  This purchase will help him to have more merchandise in stock so that he can improve his customer service.

William's goal is to improve his sales.  Through having everything he needs available to him, he hopes to stabilize his business and thereby improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn, millet, beans and coffee to sell

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en: Perpetua is 38 years old, and she has two children who are four and ten years old. They are both in school. Her husband is a builder. Perpetua sells foodstuffs and she has been selling foodstuffs for the past four years. She is proud of her business because it has enabled her to feed her family and sustain her business. She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs and make more profits. With the profits she plans to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Maju Jaya Group

texts.en: Acu is married and has two children. She is 31 years old. Her first business was selling t-shirts with credit. She had been doing this since 2005 but it wasn't running well and not profitable. Now she borrows money from VFI and sells many kinds of snacks, like chiki, for children in her new little shop (in her house)  The location of her business is in a good place to sell her products and she gets a better income from her hard work. With that income, she can pay for school for her children and take care of them if they are sick because medicine is expensive in Indonesia. She wants to say thanks to micro finance and borrow money again to expand her business. Acu hopes she can send her children to university and provide all the needs of her family to improve their future. She hopes she will succeed and continue the partnership with Vision Fund Indonesia and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy snacks like chiki to fill in her new little shop

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La Sra. Mónica, vive en el domicilio alquilado ubicado en la zona la guardia,  es nacida en Santa Ana de Yacuma - Beni, es soltera  es comerciante de ropa y cosméticos vende cosméticos por catalogo ofreciendo oficina por oficina,  trabaja como ambulante, hace unos dos años y medio se dedica a esta labor, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería de cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción y así ella obtener un poco mas de ganancia, es una persona joven con ganas de superación,  se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado.
texts.en:
Mónica lives in a rented house located in the La Guardia area.  She was born in Santa Ana de Yacuma - Beni.  She is single and she works selling clothing and cosmetics.  She sells cosmetics from catalogs, walking from office to office.  She has done this work for two and a half years.

She is asking for this loan to purchase cosmetics products that are on promotion, so that she can earn more income.  She is a young person with a desire to get ahead.  She is thankful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics products that are on promotion.

loans.name: Tiessiri Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe TIESSIRI III sont de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FATOUMATA la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  20.000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the TIESSIRI III group are married women with an average age of 29 and on average five children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Koula, a village in the rural community of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice and peanuts. This is their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan, FATOUMATA , the person in the middle in the seated row, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment, and pay for plowing to maintain about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The produce is sold at the markets of  Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, after harvesting, to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average profit of 20,000 F CFA, more or less, each crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 46 years old and married to Margaret. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a hotel for the past year with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET. He will use the loan to buy tables, wheat flour and use the rest to enroll his daughter in college. 

With the anticipated profits from the business he will pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy tables, wheat flour and use the rest to enroll his daughter in college.

loans.name: Stephany

texts.es: Stefhany de 19 años tiene un negocio de producción de bloques, persianas y calados en cemento, actividad que por tradición  ha pasado de su abuelo a su padre y ahora a ella, quien está empeñada en hacerla crecer, pues ha sido importante para el sostenimiento de toda su familia. Sus principales clientes son las ferreterías del sector y las construcciones que se encuentran alrededor de su barrio a quienes les vende a crédito a corto plazo  y también de contado. Su meta es la de llegar a ser la Numero 1 del sector, pero su capital de trabajo es su mayor desafío, y también  la razón para acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para hacer mejoras a la cubierta de la fábrica, la cual se encuentra en mal estado y necesita proteger su producción de la lluvia y en general de la humedad, e iniciar su camino hacia el desarrollo empresarial de su negocio.
texts.en: Stephany is 19 years old and has a business that makes cement blocks and also cement blinds and screens, which by tradition has passed from her grandfather, to her father, and now to her. She is determined to make it grow because it has been important for providing for the whole family. Her main clients are the hardware stores in the area and the construction sites around her neighborhood, who she sells to on short-term credit and also for cash. Her goal is to become number one in the sector, but working capital is her biggest challenge. It is also her reason for applying for a loan in cooperation with Kiva, which is her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy raw materials and inputs for making improvements to the roof of the workshop, which is in bad condition. She needs to protect her production from the rain and the humidity in general and start down the road toward development of her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and inputs for making improvements to the roof of her workshop

loans.name: Mariaj's Group

texts.es:
Mariaj's Group está conformado por 7 personas: 4 mujeres y 3 hombres grupo del cual María es la presidenta.

María tiene 47 años vive en Latacunga con su esposo y sus 4 hijos los cuales tienen 25, 22, 19 y 15 años de edad. María se describe como una persona responsable en el hogar y muy tranquila.

Trabaja con su familia en la crianza de animales (ganado) para su venta. Es  la primera vez que solicita créditos a Fodemi el mismo que será utilizado para la compra de ganado para su reproducción y crianza lo cual aumentará sus ventas e ingresos y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.

Su sueño es dar el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mariaj's Group has seven members: four women and three men.  María is the president of this group.

María is 47 years old and lives in Latacunga with her husband and four children who are 25, 22, 19 and 15.  She describes herself as a person who is responsible with her household duties and very calm.

María works together with her family raising animals (livestock) to sell.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Fodemi and she will use the money to buy livestock to breed and raise.  This will increase her sales and income and improve her family's quality of life.

María's dream is to provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to buy livestock to breed and raise

loans.name: Almasi Group

texts.en:
Victoria, who is in her late thirties, is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She has been working as a tailor and selling fabrics since 2006. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she wants to use it to buy more fabrics and materials for making more dresses. Her dream is to one day be able to open a big shop where she can put more sewing machines and good tailors.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Almasi" which has a total of 19 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and materials for making more dresses.

loans.name: Neris Orlando

texts.es:
Neris, vive con su padres, él se dedica desde hace diez años a la siembra de granos básicos: maíz y frijoles todos los días de la semana.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes como; herbicidas para las plagas,semilla y abono para que sus cosechas sean abundantes sin riesgos de plagas, ya que tiene una tierra muy fértil,  le dará mejores  cosechas.
El sueño de Neris es ayudarles a sus padres en los gastos de la casa para que ellos tengan lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Neris lives with his parents.  For ten years he has been sowing basic grains: corn and beans.  He works every day of the week.

Neris needs this loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, seeds and manure so that his harvests are abundant and aren't threatened by pests.  As he has very fertile land, he will enjoy better harvests.

Neris' dream is to help his parents with their household expenses so that they have what they need to survive.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, seed and manure

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El sr. Jesús nacido en la localidad de la  Florida de Santa Cruz el es soltero vive con su padre hace mas de 8 años, a quien ayuda con los gastos del hogar, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Puerto Rico, su actividad económica es un  taller de bujes de goma, que se encuentra ubicado en un avenida muy concurrida de la localidad de el Torno, el a pesar se su corta edad en la tiene experiencia de cinco años en rubro, el destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción para hacer terminar el techado y construcción de un cuarto, se siente muy agradecido con la institución por la confianza que le han brindado.
texts.en: Jesús was born in La Florida de Santa Cruz.  He’s single and has been living with his father for over 8 years and helps him with household expenses.  His home is located in the Puerto Rico neighborhood.  His economic activity is a rubber bushing shop located on one of Torno’s busiest avenues.  Despite his young age he has five years’ experience in this line of work.  The loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies to finish roofing and building a room.  He is very grateful to the institution for the trust it’s placed in him.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to install a roof.

loans.name: Patricia Helena

texts.es:
Patricia vive en el municipio de Amaga en el suroeste Antioqueño con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos, es propietaria de un almacén donde vende artículos para dama, caballeros y niños, además de vender utensilios y uniformes escolares en las temporadas. 

Patricia dice sentir ventaja, con su negocio por ser la única que vende los uniformes de las escuelas y colegios del municipio de Amaga,  y manifiesta que aunque en ocasiones se le dificulta cobrar su cartera por trabajar sola, esta es totalmente recuperable. 

Actualmente Patricia necesita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercancía y surtido para su negocio en especial para la época de navidad que ya se acerca, y con esto podrá amortiguar los pedidos con sus proveedores, mejorar sus ventas, sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Patricia lives in the Amaga, a town in southeastern Antioqueno.  She lives with her husband and their two children.  She owns a store where she sells clothing for men, women and children.  She also sells school uniforms and other school supplies at the time of year when they are most in demand.  

Patricia says that she is lucky because her business is the only one in town that sells school uniforms.  She adds that she always muddles through even though she sometimes finds it difficult to cover all of her expenses.  

Patricia needs a loan to buy new merchandise and stock her business for the coming Christmas season.  The loan will allow her to mollify her suppliers, increase her sales and, in turn, improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay her suppliers and stock her store for Christmas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various goods for resale such as body lotion, cooking oil, bottles of water, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
MAMA EGE DE 49 ANS HABITE DANS UN DEPARTEMENT DE LA REGION DU SUD SENEGAL. MARIE D'UNE FEMME,IL A 9 ENFANTS,5 ENFANTS SONT A L'ECOLE.MAMA A FAIT 6 ANS DANS LE COMMERCE ALIMENTAIRE.IL VENT PLUSIEURES TYPE D'ALIMENTS:LES LEGUMES,LE MIEL,LE SORGHO,LE MAIS,LA PATTE D'ARACHIDE ETC.
MAMA FAIT SES ACHAT A DIAOBE DANS UN MARCHE HEBDOMADAIRE. AVEC SON COMMERCE,IL SUPPORTE TOUTES LES CHARGE DE SA FAMILLE.MAMA A UN TERRAIN QU'IL VEUT CONSTRUIRE ET METTRE EN LOCATION POUR L'AVENIR DE SES ENFANTS.
texts.en:
Mama is 49 years old and lives in an area within the Region of South Senegal. He is married and has 9 children. 5 of his children attend school. Mama has been selling food for 6 years. He sells several different kinds of food:  legumes, honey, sorghum, corn, peanut butter, etc.
Mama buys his products in the town of Diaobé at the weekly market. Mama uses his business to provide support for all his family members. He also owns some land that he wants to build on so that he can rent out the land for his children's future.

loans.use: to strengthen his capital

loans.name: Raymundina

texts.es:
Raymundina nació en la comunidad de Pachar y vive en la comunidad de Paucarbamba, ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.

Raymundina desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Paucarbamba, ella trabaja en la municipalidad de Maras en el área de desarrollo económico como responsable de varios proyectos agrícolas, ella también se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura en la comunidad donde vive. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Raymundina requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas como por ejemplo de maíz.  

Raymundina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Raymundina pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Raymundina was born in the Pachar community and lives in the Paucarbamba community.  She’s 43 years old, married, and has two children.

She works in Maras and is in charge of various agricultural projects.  She also raises livestock and farms in her own community.  She’s been doing this for several years and things have been going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Raymundina needs this loan to buy more seeds, such as corn.
 
She is grateful for the opportunity given her through this medium and is committed to making her payments on time.  Raymundina is a member of the “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” communal bank of the Arariwa Association in Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Serafina is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Serafina has a rice field and sells rice grain during harvest season. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for her rice field.

Serafina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Serafina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Jojet

texts.en: Jojet is 37 years old and lives in Candanay Norte, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is separated from her husband and has one child. Jojet has operated a business selling food everyday for 20 years, earnsing PHP 5,000 monthly.  She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase assorted spices and meat to sell. Jojet has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than a year.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted spices and meat

loans.name: Faiva

texts.en:
Faiva is fifty-seven years of age and is married with one child. Faiva owns and operates a business venture, baking and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.

Faiva needs a loan of WST 1,500 to buy an additional oven to help increase her product output. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faiva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faiva's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy an additional oven to help increase product output.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is 24 years old, married and has a two-year-old child.  To earn a living, she runs a bookshop.  She started the business four years ago.  She has employed one person in the business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has gained a lot of knowledge on business. This is because she has been trained on business management skills. She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy more books.

loans.use: To buy more books

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 31-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 3 years old. She describes herself to be aggressive and a visionary. 

Josphine operates a cosmetics shop where she sells soap and other cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a local market and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transport costs. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy materials to make soap. Her business goal is to be a large distributor of cosmetics within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will make a difference in society by helping alleviate poverty. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy materials to make soap

loans.name: Gbenagnon Espoir Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENAGNON ESPOIR est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Virginie, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 47 ans est mariée à un certain Fremdez. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Virginie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Virginie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Virginie vend des tissus, des mèches et des chaussures par la technique de distribution depuis une dizaine d’année.  Virginie s’approvisionne à Lomé au TOGO. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Virginie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENAGNON ESPOIR, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus, des mèches et des chaussures.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Her name is Marites, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a carpenter, and has three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to meet the growing needs of her family.

Marites is in the buy and sell business. She buys several quantities of various dried fish at a wholesale price and sells them in retail. Filipinos love to eat dried fish for breakfast and it is eaten best with fried rice. On the side she also makes doormats for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her sustain and expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan which she will use to buy more quantities of dried fish. She is positive and thankful for the financial help that will be given to her since it will really boost her sales and thus her earnings. 

Marites aims to grow her business in the coming years. She also dreams to provide her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy several quantities of dried fish to sell for a profit.

loans.name: Fanjaniaina Marie Odette

texts.fr:
27 ans, Fanjaniaina est une femme très active,travailleuse et débrouillarde.  Sa petite famille habite dans un milieu rural. Son mari travaille comme magasinier dans une imprimerie. Le couple a 2 enfants âgés de 5 ans et de 6 mois. 
Elle tient un petit pavillon d'alimentation depuis novembre 2014. C'est elle même qui prépare et fabrique les produits de pâtisserie et yaourts qu'elle vend . Elle ne produisait que de petite quantité, car ses moyens ne lui permettaient pas de produire en gros surtout au niveau de fonds et du matériel. Et elle ne produisait que des brioches et madeleines pendant ces périodes. 
Son objectif est de devenir un producteur en pâtisserie et viennoiserie dans ses environs.

loans.use: acheter farines, oeufs, beurres, levures,sucre, crême fraîche, batteuse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Parinko would like to buy 3 steers for her project

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Mrs. Ann B. lives in the urban area of Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned her trade business for 6 years before she opened her own shop. She is happily married with a child (1). She needs the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Ms Primitiva A. de Tarqui (known by her friends as Ms Primi) has a vegetable stand in the Rodriguez Market in the city of La Paz. However, her principal business is the picking and selling of walnuts. She is one of the principal distributors of this product. A large range of important restaurants, sweetshops, and supermarkets of the city of La Paz purchase her product. Right now, Ms Primi is a member of Pro Mujer, and she asks for a loan to be able to strengthen her distribution of walnuts, including the export of this product. She already has necessary contacts to accomplish this. With this investment, she can further the life of her husband and her child.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Primitiva Álvarez de Tarqui (Doña Primi para sus amigos), tiene un puesto de verduras en el Mercado Rodríguez de la ciudad de La Paz, pero su principal negocio es la cosecha y venta de la nuez. Ella es una de las principales distribuidoras de este producto, ya que grandes cadenas de restaurantes, confiterías y supermercados muy importantes de la ciudad de La Paz compran este producto. En la actualidad Doña Primi, es socia de Pro Mujer, y precisa de una inversión de dinero para poder consolidar una distribuidora de nuez, e incluso incursionar a la exportación de este producto, puesto que ya cuenta con los contactos necesarios para este fin. De esta manera podrá salir adelante en compañía de su esposo y de su hija.

loans.use: To invest in the strengthening of her distribution of walnuts, including expanding the business to export

loans.name: Nuryanto

texts.id:
Nuryanto has a Show Room selling second vehicle and spare parts. As a husband he must be able to contribute to his household. He started this business since 1994 started selling spare part sine 1987 and later second hand vehicles later on. Nuryanto has to work hard because his two children are still schooling and he still has to pay in monthly rental for his shop.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Nuryanto mempunyai usaha Show Room sepeda motor dan mobil bekas, sebagai seorang suami dia harus mampu menghidupi istri dan anak-anaknya. Usaha ini sudah ditekuninya sejak tahun 1994, “awalnya sih sepeda motor pada tahun 1987”, katanya, kemudian berkembang sampai kepada mobil bekas. Usaha Nuryanto tersebut harus bias memenuhi kebutuhan pendidikan kedua anaknya, kontrak tanah dan tempat usaha serta biaya hidup setiap hari. Untuk itu Nuryanto bekerja ekstra keras untuk memenuhi semua kebutuhan itu.

loans.use: Modal untuk membeli sepeda motor dan mobil bekas - Buying spare parts and second hand vehicle.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. L. Sarum was married in 1995 and has three sons. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1992 and she started her silk production in the same year. She also continued training her husband to weave silk after she got married in mid 1995. He is now assisting to weave silk at home with his wife. In addition, he is currently also in the business of repairing bicycles since 2005, after learning form his father. With the existing businesses they have, all of their children can be sent to local school. They expect to support their children to continue studying in higher education as their living condition is getting better from day to day. 

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time of $150. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and as fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, and as fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Vaiauau

texts.en: Vaiauau is the eldest member of the Fata B Center and also the oldest member of the Center in the Programme. After four loans, she is still running and sustaining her sewing business and she is looking at improving her house  with this fifth loan. Her husband died years ago and she is still fighting with keeping up with everything in the family. Some of her children went overseas and she is not relying financially on them. She works everyday on catching up on her orders and earns $100 WST ($40 USD) a day. She is one of the oldest and most supportive members of her borrowing center.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, a new sewing machine, and other supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Blanca Lili

texts.es:
Blanca is a woman that has firmly resolved to provide for her 3 children, and to provide them with a University education so that they will have better opportunities than she has had. She is worried about being able to start paying the university tuition of her eldest son who is almost ready to graduate. This is why she started to sell products by catalogue in 2006, and she started selling second-hand clothing. She dedicates her time to selling the used clothing because she earns more money this way. Slowly Blanca has formed her clientele.

But Blanca does not have enough merchandise to offer her clients. This is why she is requesting a loan of US$475 which she is ready to repay in a 5-month term. With this money Blanca will be able to purchase merchandise and be able to offer her clients new products. With your help Blanca and her husband will be able to cover their children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca es una mujer que tiene el firme propósito de sacar a sus 3 hijos adelante, y brindarles estudios Universitarios para que éstos puedan tener mejores oportunidades que ella Actualmente está más preocupada por poder comenzar a pagar los gastos que genere la universidad de su hijo el mayor a quien le falta poco para que salga. Es por eso que comenzó a vender productos por catálogo en el 2006, sin embargo poco a poco fue ofreciendo ropa de segunda, la cuál se dedica más tiempo puesto que la venta de estos productos deja mayores ganancias. Poco a poco Blanca ha ido formando un grupo de clientela.

Sin embargo Blanca no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Blanca podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener productos nuevos que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Blanca y su esposo podrán pagarles los estudios a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: K. Malika has been an active client of  MicroInvest since 2002. She has improved her business thanks her ability to get business development loans. The stability of her business helped her to repay her previous loans on time. Mrs. K. currently sells socks, boots, and tights. She is very polite so she has a lot of customers. Now mrs.K. requests the loan of 3100 STJ for 6 months to buy children's shoes to add to her current inventory . The loan would permit her to improve her existing inventory and to increase the income from her business.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of children's shoes

loans.name: Cesar R.

texts.es:
Cesar lives in his in-laws' home with his wife and their son on "flores" street, in the Tacagua area in the city of La Paz. He has an auto body shop on Jaimes Freyre street for nine months now which generates the income to support his family. The loan he is seeking is to buy tools and some materials such as paint, grease, thinner, varnish, etc. This is his first loan request, but his business qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Cesar vive en casa de los suegros con su esposa e hijo en la calle flores de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un taller de chaperia (body shop) en la calle Jaimes Freyre desde hace nueve meses con el cual genera sus ingresos para mantener a su familia. El crédito que solicita es para comprar herramientas de trabajo y algo de material como ser pintura, grasa, tiner, barniz, etc. No tiene antecedente, es su primer credito, pero por la actividad que desempeña califica para obtener un préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials, such as paint, grease, varnish, etc. (Compra de herramientas y materiales como pintura, grasa, barniz, etc.)

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopahal S. and her husband married in 1999. They have two sons, one of whom is in school. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sophal has been a weaver for eleven years. It’s a skill she learned from her aunt. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who sells them in Phnom Penh. Apart from weaving, Sophal also sells pork in the village market in the mornings. She has been doing this business for eight years. Her husband is a silk weaver as well.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Jose Ángel is married and has a 13 year old girl, Alexia Yamilet who is studying in secundary school. He began his business as he did not have a fixed employment and had a hard time making ends meet after the birth of their daughter.

Twelve years ago he began selling clothing and started selling clothes to his work mates in a factory. Things were going well and he received requests for shoes as well. In May 2006, his wife saw an ad requesting catalogue shoe salespersons. Jose Ángel went to this well known shoe store and was accepted as a credit salesman. He is doing well and currently makes up to 40% commission on sales.

Now he is requesting a microcredit of $300 to be paid back in 3 months. He needs the money to cover his client´s liabilities since he receives a very high commission if client debts are paid back in time. With your support, José will keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Pay his client´s liabilities

loans.name: Elmikhan

texts.en: This young man is married and has a child. Elmikhan is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. Four years ago he started a sheep-breeding business. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 15 lambs for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy 15 lambs

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Married for nine years, Sajida baji is the second wife of G. M.. (Baji is the Urdu term of respect for 'elder sister'.) She owns a two-room brick house and has two children. G. M. also has five children from his first wife. But Sajida baji takes care of all seven children, and they are all getting educations. For example, her eldest daughter is in nursing school and the next elder daughter is in 10th standard. G. M. first sold garments on a bicycle. Sajida baji successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan), and from those loans her husband has been able to buy and run his own garment shop. Now his wife is applying for a loan to expand the same business.

She is joined in her loan group by four members. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. Sajida baji would like to expand her food business. Bashiran baji wants to buy and resell wood. Mumtaz baji's aim is to buy a cart for fruit selling.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: KH. K. H., 27, raises pigs in her home with her husband, Meang Sin, in Siem Reap. They typically make US$10 per day and they have three young children to support. One of their children is a student in the local public school system, while the other two are still too young to attend school. KH. K. H. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase 10 piglets to breed for additional income. She would also like to use some of the money to purchase feed for the pigs. Raising pigs is a profitable business in Cambodia and the family would like to see this business continue to grow in the future. After this loan is repaid, they will consider expanding the pig's barn to accommodate their growing business.

loans.use: Purchase 10 piglets to raise and breed

loans.name: Awali

texts.fr: Awali A. est un mécanicien à 2 roues, à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé la capitale togolaise. Agé de 32 ans, Awali est marié et père de 2 enfants. Par ce crédit, il souhaite acheter des outils de travail satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle, et aussi aménager son atelier. Monsieur Awali espère améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille par cette opportunité.
texts.en:
Awali A. is a bike mechanic in Kpalimé, a city located about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Awali is 32 years old, married, and the father of two children. With this loan, he would like to buy work tools to fully meet the expectations of his customers and also to fix up his shop. Mr. Awali hopes to improve the living conditions for his family by this opportunity.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and also to fix up his shop

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La señora Sofía S. vive en la aldea Suacité  ella tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, necesita el crédito para ampliar su tienda y surtirla con fideos, jabón, papel higiénico, golosinas, aguas, todo lo que se necesita para la gente  más demanda, ya que donde ella vive no hay muchas tiendas porque es una aldea, ella trabaja duro  ya que  enviudo hace 8 años y tiene que mantener 6 hijos, quiere sacarlos adelante y darles lo que necesitan.  También se dedica a criar marranos y luego venderlos. Logro conseguir una caseta para poder poner su tienda en la calle principal anteriormente la tenia el su casa que esta en un sector mas retirado, su sueño hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos que ayuden a su familia para poder seguir enviándolos a la escuela.
texts.en:
Ms. Sofia S. lives in the small village of Suacite. She has a store where she sells basic daily consumption items. She needs a loan to expand her store and stock it with noodles, soap, toilet paper, candy, and drinks. She needs all of this to meet her customers' demands, as there are not many stores where she lives because it is a small village. She works hard, since she was widowed 8 years ago and has had to care for her 6 children. She wants to see them move forward and give them what they need. She also raises pigs and later sells them. She was able to get a stall to be able to put her store on the main street. Previously, she had it in her house, which is in a more remote area. Her dream is to expand her business and increase her income to help her family and to be able to continue sending her children to school.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment in buying basic daily consumption items

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh K. is a 48-year-old trader who has been in business for more than ten years. He is married and has four sons who actively help him with his trading business. Taleh sells tea, candies, rice, and other foods. He wishes to provide his children with a good education and, for this reason, he works very hard. 

His working day begins at 8:00 in the morning and finishes at 10-11 at night. Taleh tries his best, because his shop is the only financial source for his family. Taleh would like to increase his business by diversifying and purchasing more inventory for his shop. Taleh and his family appreciate for your help very much.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en: Mrs. V.  lives in Nam Viem Commune, Phuc Yen District, Vinh Phuc Province.  She is 62 years old and has six children, all of whom are grown. Her husband is a worker. She has been a member of TYM since 2000. Her sources of income are raising fish, growing rice, and her husband's salary. She wants to borrow $600 USD to buy cows to raise.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Mrs. Kung Neang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
