Mrs. Kung N. is the village bank president of this 9-member group. All of the group's members live in the village of Srae Siem in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer; more specifically, she owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. On the plantation, she faces serious problems because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to maintain her field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy such seeds and fertilizers. Her husband, Mr. Kum Chea, is a fisherman. Mrs. Kung N. is 49 years old, and she is the mother of five children. One of her children is a shoemaker, two of her children are laborers, and the other two children are currently attending the local school.

One member of this village bank loan is seeking an end-of-term ("EoT") loan, while the other members are requesting loans whereby regular monthly payments are required. The EoT loan is AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor: it allows the borrower to repay portions of the principal whenever he or she is financially able to do so, meaning that the borrower is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. Even so, most of AMK's clients start making their loan payments many months before the loan's maturity date. Further, nearly all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time; to illustrate, AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva-related loans.

loans.use: To increase her crop yield by purchasing additional rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Chub

texts.en: Chub S., age 53, is a true entrepreneur who resides in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has been operating her grocery store since 2001 and is able to make about US $6 every day. Her husband sells used clothing in a busy market. On average, he makes US $6 per day. This couple has four children, three of who are employed as garment factory workers. Mrs Chub S. would like to use this loan to add to her grocery store inventory and to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To add to her grocery store inventory

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta L. lives in Barangay San Vicente Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Claro who serves as Barangay (township) Councilor in their village. They are blessed with a son named Tristan who is already 28 years old, an accounting graduate, and already married. Together with her husband and extended family, they live harmoniously in their home though they have no grandchildren yet.

Julieta runs a canteen stall located in Centro supermarket which is just walking distance from their house. According to Julieta, the loan amounting to PHP 8, 000 will be used to purchase additional stock for her business such as soft drinks, cooking oil, and other necessary ingredients for cooking traditional rice cakes and delicacies for her canteen. She wants to increase her products to meet the demands of her customers. She also hopes to expand her business into cooking soft noodles for her regular customers. She further said that it is good to generate income out of hard work.

loans.use: purchase of additional products to sell and ingredients for her canteen

loans.name: Siprose

texts.en: Siprose A. (pictured with her daughter Lucy) is an H.I.V. positive mother of four children. She is also a widow and has been raising her children by herself for the past three years. She sells chips (French fries) in Manyata slum where she lives. She uses the profits to pay for her children's school fees and to expand her business. She says she wants people to know that she sees goodness in being involved in her kind of business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes

loans.name: Nematillo

texts.ru: Нематилло занимается частным извозом на своей машине. Ему 44 года, женат, имеет 4 детей. Его жена безработная и чтобы занять ее Нематилло приспособил маленькое помещение у себя дома под магазинчик. Клиентами являются все его соседи. Его жена продает там разные мелкие товары и продукты питания, а Нематилло привозит ей товары. Прибыль от магазинчика покрывает разные мелкие расходы семьи. Нематилло собирается получить займ и вложив его в магазинчик расширить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Nematillo is a private driver with his own car. He is 44 years old, is married and has 4 children. His wife is unemployed and in order to employ her Nematillo converted a small space in his home into a store. The customers are all of his neighbors. His wife sells miscellaneous small products and food items there. Nematillo brings her products to sell. Profits from the store cover a variety of small family expenditures. Nematillo plans to take out a loan and by investing it into the business expand the product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
MARIA DE JESUS I. G. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en Av. Colonización c/16 de noviembre. del distrito de Calleria, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 32 años de edad, 1 hijo.
 
Ella se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró pescado y carne de pollo para vender  en las noches en la vereda de su casa, cuenta con clientes frecuentes.

Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fieles que siempre consumen sus alimentos, esto porque mantiene un secreto de cocina que hace que todo comensal salga satisfecho con lo que consume.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más mesas, manteles y platos.

“Mi gran sueño es tener un restaurant creo que puedo lograrlo porque cuento con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesus I. G. belongs to "Las Margaritas" Community Bank and lives on Av. Colonizacion in Calleria, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 32 years old and has one child. She is dedicated to selling food. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased fish and chicken to sell in the evenings from the sidewalk outside her home. She has regular customers. Today, she has faithful customers who always consume her dishes. This is because she keeps a cooking secret which makes all her guests leave happy with what they consume. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will purchase more tables, tablecloths and plates. "My great dream is to have a restaurant. I believe that I can achieve this because I have the support of Manuela Ramons."

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, tablecloths and plates.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina S. is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Christina is a baker who bakes and sells bread at Shama Junction near Cape Coast. She has operated her business since 1986. Her husband is a trader. Christina uses her income to assist her husband with the upkeep of their house. Christina will use the loan to purchase purchase flour and other ingredients for baking. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christina plans to purchase land.

loans.use: Christina will use the loan to purchase purchase flour and other ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Nusrat William Masih Group

texts.en:
Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy leather to sell.

Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Nusrat baji is the group leader of these above-mentioned ladies. They are all very hardworking ladies and they handle their own businesses to manage their financial expenses. They all belong to a city named Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines.

To earn income, Nusrat baji operates an embroidered-dress business. She prepares embroidered dresses on orders which she collects from the clothes shops. She saves her income for her rainy days. Her husband’s name is W. M. and he runs a leather-selling business. She is applying for a loan to buy leather to expand her husband’s leather-selling business.

loans.use: To buy leather for her husband's business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah runs two businesses at the same time. She prepares and sells rice porridge with bread that she hawks in the community where she lives. She says it is tiresome to hawk in the sun carrying hot porridge on your head. She balances that with a mini boutique selling items like shirts, skirts, underwear, etc. in a rented store at the market. Sarah has an employee who assists her with the running of the store. She pays her at the end of every month. She needs a loan to upgrade her inventory in the boutique. With this loan she wants to increase her stock of jeans, shirts, and underwear, etc.

Sarah is 42 years old, divorced and the mother of two children. All her children are currently in school in the community where they live. She wants to provide for the educational needs of her children through the profit from her business. She belongs to a village bank called Nyame Tease which means "God Lives."

loans.use: To buy clothing materials and bags of rice etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. All her children are still in school and her husband is a trader. She lives with her husband who is very supportive of her. She is very hardworking and supportive of her husband in providing food and shelter for her household. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits etc. and cosmetics in her neighborhood. It has been her dream to make an expansion by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and foodstuffs like tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices, groundnuts etc. to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 34 year old mother of four who lives and operates her small fish business in Kayole Nairobi. She is asking for a loan of Ksh. 20,000 to increase her stock of fish. She hopes that she will grow her business and diversify into hairdressing and selling clothes. She also hopes to build her own home and educate her children. She describes herself as friendly, thankful and faithful.

---------------------------------------
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Stela is a member of the Zizi la ngombe borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 50 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 32,30,28,26,24,22 years.

Stela started her own shop business selling rice,wheat etc 2 years ago.She works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Stela first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order o buy more commodities for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan  stela hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Vaoa

texts.en:
Vaoa F. works in a family member's business making and selling specialty food products for her community. She is a 28-year-old woman living in the town of Tafitoala. She is married and has three children. Vaoa has been in this business for over four years. From these activities, Vaoa earns approximately 550 WST a month.

In 2009, Vaoa (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Vaoa is requesting a loan of 1000 WST. The loan will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from SPBD. Vaoa plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Affi

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée dans la vente d’une bouillie très appréciée de la population dénommée « akloui zogbon ». C’est une bouillie faite à base de  farine de maïs fermenté.  Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 1998 dans le quartier d’Agoè Démakpoè à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de se prendre en charge et de subvenir à ses besoins. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Son commerce se situe au bord d’une rue très fréquentée ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de bonnes affaires. Elle se lève très tôt le matin et bien avant la fin de la matinée, elle finit de tout vendre. Elle a besoin en ce moment de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 sacs de maïs, 03 sacs de sucre et du bois de chauffage. Elle compte rembourser ce crédit dans les délais exigés.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, de sucre, de bois de chauffage

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
N. Annet is a very hardworking lady with a restaurant business. For Annet, her day begins at 5 a.m. when she starts preparing breakfast for her customers in Nabuti. She is able to make 15,000/= as daily income and she says that this would be more except that the food prices are now expensive.

Annet needs to expand her business further by being able to prepare more foodstuffs as well as expanding her house for more space and comfort. She is a single mother of three children who are all in school and this is the best reason why she works so hard. She needs a loan to be able to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.es:
Reymundo R. de 63 años se dedica desde hace treinta años a la crianza y destace de cerdo. Esta es una actividad común en la familia nicaragüense y una alternativa económica para ayudar a generar ingresos a la familia.

El tiene dieses años de estar trabajando con Adim en los cuales se ha sentido muy satisfechos por los logros que ha obtenido por la forma de operar de la micro financiera.
texts.en:
Raymundo is 63 years old and has raised pigs for the past 30 years. This is a common activity in Nicaraguan families and an alternative source of income for the family. He has worked with Adim for 16 years and has been very satisfied both with his accomplishments and with the way in which the micro financing company operates.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 36-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Mahmoud has owned a toy shop since 2005. In his toy shop he also sells candies. Mahmoud is unique in his work because he owns a big variety of toys, and children love coming to his shop. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for his store, especially because the holiday season is close. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

When Mahmoud first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. He decided to start his business because he wanted to have independent work, and he realized that there weren’t any gift shops in his neighborhood. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Mercedes Isabel

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 26 años,es madre soltera tiene una hija de 5 años. Mercedes vive en casa de su madre el  cual le ayuda en el cuidado de su hija. Mercedes inicio hace 1 año el negocio de venta de todo tipo de descartables plàsticos en el mercado de la ciudad de Ica, el negocio lo inicio con ahorros propios.El cual Mercedes brinda un buen trato a sus clientes que acuden a su puesto de ventas por tal motivo ha incrementado su clientela poco a poco. Mercedes desea implementar su negocio ya que en las fiestas navideñas se realizan pedidos de mayor cantidad y ella no posee el stop para cubrir el total de los pedidos, por tal motivo solicita el dinero para la compra de mayor mercaderia. Mercedes trabaja cada dia con el unico fin de brindarle a su pequeña lo necesario para que no sienta la ausencia del padre, y que asi su hija pueda disfrutar las comodidades que les dejara el negocio de su madre, brindandole una buena educacion lo cual le brindara el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 26 year old single mother with a 5 year old daughter. Mercedes lives with her mother who helps her take care of her daughter. Mercedes began her business one year ago and sells all kinds of disposable plastic containers in the city of Ica's market. She started this business with her personal savings. Mercedes offers good service and prices to the customers that come to her market stall. As a consequence, her clientele has slowly increased. She wishes to equip her business for the Christmas season so she can fulfill a greater number of customer orders, but she doesn't have the finances to cover the cost of all of the extra merchandise. For this reason, she is asking for a loan so she can buy more merchandise. Mercedes works every day with the primary goal of providing her young daughter with her basic living needs so that she doesn't feel the absence of her father and enjoy the comforts that her mother's business brings her like offering a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Al señor Francisco A. tiene ya más de un año dedicándose a la venta de artículos de piel (cintos, carteras bolsas etcétera).  El desea invertir en el negocio en comprar juguetes y artículos navideños, ya que sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga este tipo de cosa para la venta. 
Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá con está nueva inversión, los gastos familiares los cubrirá con el sueldo de su trabaja en una tienda de paleas en el departamento de elaboración.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco A. has been selling leather goods (belts, wallets, handbags, etc.) for more than a year. He wants to invest in his business by acquiring toys and Christmas items since his customers have been asking him to sell this type of merchandise. He does not have the funds at the moment to make this investment and he does not want to deplete his business of its existing capital.

He plans to repay this loan using the profits he will earn from this new investment. His family expenses are covered by the salary from his job working at a shop that manufactures shovels.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Yelman

texts.es: Yelman V. tiene 28 años, este hombre muy trabajador su actividad económica es una pulpería hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos y ciertas amistades. El inicio este negocio con mucho sacrificio propio pues tenía muchas ganas de salir delante y como todo padre y esposo responsable buscaba la manera de generar ingresos para su familia es así que él ha mantenido a su familia. El solicita este financiamiento con el fin de comprar productos para el hogar que son los que le solicitan. El desea tener una mejor estabilidad económica para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Yelman V., 28, is a very hard-working man. He has had a small grocery store for the last 7 years. Most of his customers are his neighbors and friends. He began the business with much sacrifice because he very much wanted to get ahead and, like any responsible father and husband, sought the way to earn income for his family. This is how he has supported his family. He asks for financing to buy products that his customers are requesting. He hopes to have better economic stability for himself and for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Estelbina

texts.es: La señora Estelbina B. A., tiene 48 años de edad vive en la comarca de San Ignacio un lugar donde sus habitantes son personas humildes y que en su mayoria se dedican al trabajo de la agricultura, la señora ens casada y us esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad apoyandole en los gastos de la casa,  ellos se dedican al cultivo de la pitahaya desde hace 12 años y el mayor problema que han tenido han sido la falta de apoyo de las financieras hacia el ramo de la agricultiura, ellos se iniciaron en este trabajo, gracias al apoyo que se han brindado mutuamente. Para el futuro tiene planeado realizar trabajos de conservacion de suelo debido a que han tenido problemas con la tierra para esto han pensado en la iyeccion de capital en la compra de materiales agricolas tales como fertilizante y fungicidas esto le garantizara una buena cosecha y les traera mayores insumos que le ayudaran a estabilizarse economicamente.
texts.en:
Estelbina B. A., 48, lives in the San Ignacio settlement. Her neighbors are, for the most part, humble people dedicated to farming. She is married and her husband is employed as a security guard thus helping her with household expenses. For the last 12 years they have farmed pitahaya (dragon fruit). The greatest difficulty they have faced in the past has been the unwillingness of financial institutions to help farmers. They started in this line of work thanks to the mutual help they gave each other. For the future, she is planning to undertake soil conservation projects because they have had trouble with the soil. For this, they need an injection of capital to buy agricultural supplies, like chemical fertilizers and fungicides, to guarantee a good crop and to bring better ingredients that will help them stabalize economically.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Catarina Manuela

texts.es: Doña Catarina Manuela García Y.  cuenta con 46 años de edad  casada vive con sus cuatro hijos y esposo  reside en el lugar conocido como Caserío Tzanjuyup, de la Aldea Chipuac   del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala actualmente ella se dedica a la Artesanía en la elaboración de cortes típicos como también en la amarrada de jaspe debido a la demanda de sus clientes y la exigencia de mas mercadería ella se asecho a las oficinas de la Asociación Asdir para adquirir un préstamo cubriendo así la demanda de sus clientes como también mejorando su trabajo en la compra de materia prima  mejorar sus ingresos mensuales para poder sufragar sus gastos mensuales.
texts.en:
Doña Catarina Manuela García Y. is 46 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children in a place known as Tzanjuyup Village, which is part of the Chipuac neighborhood in the City and Department of Totonicapán, Guatemala.

Catarina makes traditional skirts as well as dyed and woven fabrics that are in great demand among her customers. The pressing need to produce more goods is the reason why she came to the offices of Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. With the funding, Catarina will purchase the raw materials needed to keep up with the demand of her customers and improve her work. This will help her generate more income to cover her monthly expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials needed to make fabric

loans.name: Graciela De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Graciela de Jesús Moraga, ella tiene a su cargo dos hijos, y uno  de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casada, es el segundo crédito que Trabajado con CEPRODEL, este lo ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con el Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y pintura. Para terminar de cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación ya que este se encontraba en mal estado y en invierno el agua se pasaba.
Graciela dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgado por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación por lo que a hora cuenta con mejores condiciones  en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela de Jesus M.is married and has two children, one of whom is of school age. This is the second credit that she has requested through CEPRODEL, and this one will be invested in improving the conditions of her home. She will purchase construction materials such as zinc and paint. She needs to finish replacing the roof of her house, since it is in poor conditions and in the winter water leaks through it. Graciela said that thanks to the loans granted to her through Ceprodel, she has been able to improve her house and now lives in much better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand her home

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.es:
Fedelina García D. Páez,  tiene 61 años y 6 hijos, vive en el barrio villa gloria ubicado en el sur occidente D. la ciudad D. Barranquilla, que aunque algún día fue D. invasión hoy cuenta con servicios públicos y muchas líneas D. transporte.
DesD. hace un año ella misma diseña y confecciona y venD. calzado especialmente en la línea femenina, a clientes ubicados en las zona D. Urabá donD. ella entrega personalmente sus pedidos a vendedores  y tiene una colaboradora que cobra su cartera y le consigna los pagos que efectúan sus clientes y también  venD. en Barranquilla en su barrio y en zonas que lo circundan. En la actualidad solicita un crédito por valor D.  $ 1.500.000  para comprar materias primas e insumos para zapatería tales como cuero, pegantes suelas e hilos, pues necesita cumplir con pedidos que han hecho sus clientes.  
Este es su quinto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, entidad con la que participa hace mas D. tres años, con ellos ha construido   un capital D. trabajo adicional,  para desarrollar su microempresa lo que ha traído como consecuencia el mejoramiento en la infraestructura D. su vivienda.
Ella sueña con construir un local donD. pueda fabricar sus productos y otro donD. los pueda exhibir, con relación a su meta familiar desea  el bienestar económico D. sus hijos y nietos  a través D. su educación y con el aumento D. sus ingresos provenientes del negocio. Su reto más importante es separar los espacios domésticos y productivos, pues genera dificultades familiares, por que el negocio ocupa mucho espacio y no es bueno para los niños que allí residen
texts.en:
Fedelina García D. Páez is 61 years old and has six children. She lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Gloria which is located in the south west of the city of Barranquilla. It was once a shanty town but now has public services and many bus companies. A year ago Fedelina started designing, making, and selling footwear, specializing in shoes for women. She sells them to customers who live in the Urabá area and personally delivers the orders to the people who sell the footwear. A colleague looks after the payments and bank deposits. Fedelina also sells in Barranquilla, in her own neighbourhood, and in the surrounding areas. She is now asking for a loan of $1,500 to buy materials and supplies to make footwear, such as leather, stick-on soles, and thread because she needs complete her customers’ orders. This is Fedelina’s fifth loan with Kiva parter, the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to which she has belonged for more than three years. With the Foundation’s help, she built up working capital for developing the business, and as a result was able to make improvements to her house. Her dream is to build one place for making the products and another for displaying them. She also wishes for the financial wellbeing of her children and grandchildren through education, and for a greater income from her business. Her most important challenge is to separate the living quarters of the family from the workshop area because the business takes up a lot of space. This creates problems for the family and isn’t good for the children who live there.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her shoe-making business

loans.name: Trinidad 	Aleida

texts.es:
La Sra. Trinidad es Madre soltera tiene una pequeña hija, tiene como actividad la peluqueria atendiendo en su salon que tiene en la zona de sopocachi, es la segunda ves que  recibe un credito bajo este programa, ella esta muy agradecida con emprender ya que pudo crecer en su empresa ya que es un apoyo al ingreso de su familia, por que ella vive con su madre y su pequeña hija.
El destino del credito sera para la compra de dos lava cabezas y refaccionar su salon de belleza. es un apersona responsable y trabajadora nunca tobo problemas en el pago de sus cuotas, uno de sus deseos es de ver a su hija profesional y tambien formar pronto una familia y asi dar a su pequeña hija una estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Trinidad is the single mother of a young daughter, and her business is a beauty salon that she tends to in the Sopocachi zone. This is the second time she is receiving a loan through this program. She is very grateful for the assistance as it helped her grow her business, which helps provide towards the family’s income since she lives with her mother and daughter. The loan will be used to buy two hair-washing sinks and to refurbish her salon. She is a very responsible and hard-working person, who never had any problems with her loan payments. She hopes to see her daughter become a professional, and to soon have a complete family in order to provide more stability for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refurbish her beauty salon and buy hair-washing sinks.

loans.name: Akouèhoundé

texts.fr: Née en 1960, H. Akouèhoundé vit depuis 34 ans au quartier Gbèdjromédé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Akouèhoundé est mariée et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Akouèhoundé vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Akouèhoundé n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Depuis 16 ans, Akouèhoundé mène comme activité la vente d'acajou à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. C'est toujours à Dantokpa que Akouèhoundé s'approvisionne. Akouèhoundé avait obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. En vue de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire, Akouèhoundé sollicite un deuxième prêt pour mieux faire face à la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, Akouèhoundé H. has been living in the Gbèdjromédé district of Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital, for 34 years. Akouèhoundé is married and a mother of two children, who both attend school. She lives with her children and her husband. She never went to school. For 16 years, Akouèhoundé has been in the business of selling cashew nuts in Benin’s international market, Dantokpa. This business generates income, helping Akouèhoundé meet her own needs as well as those of her children. Akouèhoundé also buys her stock at Dantokpa. She has received one loan from ALIDé, which she successfully paid back. In order to strengthen her business and increase her sales, Akouèhoundé is asking for a second loan to better meet her clients’ demand.

Translated from French by Chelsea Rosendale, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cashew nuts

loans.name: Ndèye Sophie

texts.fr: Ndèye Sophie N. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter une dizaine de béliers de les engraisser afin de les revendre au bout de 5 mois. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Ndèye Sophie N. is a 48-year old woman, married and the mother of four dependent children. She has been a member of Dankh Sene Banc Villageois for seven and a half years. She raises sheep, and her new loan will allow her to purchase a dozen rams of in order to fatten them for resale in about five months. Her income allows her to help her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening and enlarging her sheep-raising business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Emilia G. D. I., cuenta con 48 años, apenas estudio hasta el nivel D. primario, tiene 3 hijos, la hija mayor ya se encuentra casada. Emilia vive sola con sus dos hijos. La señora Emilia vive en la zona D. Pucarita Chica D. la provincia Cercado del Departamento D. Cochabamba.

La señora Emilia se dedica exclusivamente a la producción D. leche cruda, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo lechero D. la zona, que a su vez recoge la empresa PIL ANDINA. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son muy modestas, tienen una casa con habitaciones normales hechas D. barro, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señora Emilia es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella y sus dos hijos se levantan muy temprano todos los días para orD.ñar las vacas. Y durante todo el día se dedican a pastear a las vacas, es una actividad ardua donD. ambos trabajan.   

La señora Emilia solicita el crédito para la compra D. alimento en general que en la época D. invierno este escasea bastante, D. esta manera pueda producir más leche, e incrementar  sus ingresos y tener una nivel D. vida estable.
texts.en:
Sra. Emilia G. D. I., 48, has little more than an elementary school education. She has 3 children including a recently marrid daughter. She lives with her two other children in Pucarita Chica, a region of the "departamento" of Cochabamba. Sra. Emilia makes a living by producing and selling raw milk, all of which is processed at a local dairy called PIL ANDINA. Sra. Emilia's living conditions are very modest. She has a house maD., like most in the area, of clay bricks and shares her roof with her cows. Sra. Emilia is a hard-working woman. She and her chidren get up very early every day to milk the cows. They spend their days pasturing the cows, a very arduous job that requires all their effort. Sra. Emilia is applying for a loan so that she buy feed for the cows, feed that is most scarce in winter, but which will allow her to increase her milk production and, in turn, her income and living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed for milk cows

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon N. is a hardworking businessman, forty-two years old, married with four children who are all going to school. His shop is located in Isaka Kijjungu Village. He has been in business for over one year. Simon is requesting a loan to purchase essential commodities for his retail shop. These are products that are used in homes, such as sugar, soap, salt, etc. Simon's hope is to expand his business and to make it more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase essential products for home use.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sabita M. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Sainbu-Bhaishipati, lalitpur. She opened her grocery store to raise the economic condition of her family. In her shop she sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, noodle, snacks etc. Now, due to the increasing demand of grocery goods she is requesting for Rs 20000.00 loan to buys grocery supplies for her shop.

Mrs. Sabita M. lives with her husband and two children. Her husband Mr. Nabraj M. is a laboror in house construction work. She has one daughter and one son. Her daughter is studying in grade 6 and her son is in primary school.

loans.use: to buy supplies fo grocery goods for resale

loans.name: Jose De Los Santos

texts.es:
el sr. Jose de los Santos D. C. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tambien cosecha y vende café, bananos y platanos desde hace mas de 12 años, durante todo este tiempo el ha ido adquiriendo experiencia en sus cocechas.
con su negocio atesora el bienestar para su familia.
El Sr D. esta casado tiene una hija de 4 años la cual esta en La preparatoria en un kinder de la ciudad de Danli,  
con los ingresos de su negocio suple sus gastos familiares y las obligaciones finanacieras.

a mejorado significativamente su negocio lo que le hace lucir mejor. El credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi tener mas surtida su pulperia.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose de los Santos is a businessman selling from his small store located in his home. He has been growing and selling coffee, bananas and plantains for more than 12 years and increasing his harvest. With his business he has improved the welfare of his family. Mr. D. is married, has one four year old daughter in preschool in the city of Danli. With the income from his business he provides for his family’s expenses and financial obligations. His business has improved significantly making him shine. The loan would be used to purchase merchandise in order to have a well stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy “churros” (long doughnuts), coffee, glue, butter, bananas, plantains, soft drinks, juice, lard, oil, rice, beans, bread, cookies, tortillas, and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase paint and pay the costs of labor

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita is a hardworking businesswoman who has a food vending business to earn a better living. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. Norita belongs to a group of young entrepreneurs of Riverside Center in Rizal West Branch (RWB). With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders of her previous loan, Norita appreciates that the loan has helped her improve own business, build her own house and support the education of her siblings, hence having better living standards. 

Currently in Norita’s increasing business, she would like to request a second kiva loan in a much larger loan amount to supplement her running capital. Specifically, the loan fund will be used to pay for more inventory for her business, including coconut jam, banana chips, peanut butter, barquillos (wafers), banana fritters, immature rice (pinipig), cashew nuts and other supplies. In the meantime, the profits she makes from her business are saved in preparation for the expense of educating her four children. She hopes that until their graduation from college, she will be able to give them her support financially. 

Norita dreams to have a store in the marketplace and to buy more inventory in the future for better output. She sees herself venturing into a full-fledged wholesale business in the next seven years. With the support of our Kiva supporters, Norita is optimistic that the family business will continue to grow, bring steady profits, and sustain improvements in her family’s quality of life. Her long term goals are to maintain the output of her business, and support the other family business of rental fees (apartment houses) in the local community, and to purchase a new tricycle (three-wheeled-vehicles) for added income. Norita also dreams of brighter future and to bring happiness and harmony into their home.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her business, including coconut jam, banana chips, peanut butter, wafers, banana fritters, cashew nuts, immature rice and other supplies

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en:
Siah G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Love. Siah is 32 years old, married, and has two children who range from 5 to 11 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. She cares for one sibling.

For 16 years, she has been selling soap, perfume, candles, door locks, body lotion, and other mixed goods in Rally Time Market in Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of soap, perfume, candles, door locks, body lotion, and other mixed goods.

 She describes herself as a respectful woman. Her dream is to grow her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Fagueye

texts.fr:
Madame Fagueye D. est une femme de 62 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Layenne a yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 10 et35 ans. 
Madame D. a fait une formation en couture, ensuite elle s’est orientée vers la teinture depuis 10 ans. Ce qui l’a le plus motivé a faire son choix sur ces activités c’est leur aspect lucratif. 
C’est une ancienne sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff car elle est membre depuis novembre 2002. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300000 frs pour réfectionner la dalle de sa maison qui est en mauvais état. Son souci est d’améliorer  le cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fagueye D. is a 62-year-old woman who lives in the neighborhood of Layenne, in Yoff. She is married and the mother of eight children whose ages range from 10 to 35 years old. Mrs. D. trained as a seamstress, then switched to dying for the past 10 years. She chose these activities primarily because of the earning potential. She is an early member of the credit union of Yoff, having joined in November 2002. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to repair a damaged slab in her house. Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a slab in her house

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Antonio tiene 41 años de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa para  caballeros, niños y damas y también una gran variedad  de ropa interior. Su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que así tiene la probabilidad de vender. El crecimiento de su negocio es notable gracias a la buena administración, la excelente atención a los clientes. Junto a su esposa tienen 2 hijos de los cuales dependen de ellos pues siempre se preocupan por mejorar su negocio. El crédito lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería y así surtir su negocio. Las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio is 41 years old, and he sells clothing for men, women, and children. He also sells a great variety of underwear. He sells in an itinerant manner because that is they way that he will most likely make sales. The growth of his business is notable thanks to his good administration and the excellent service he gives his customers. He and his wife have two dependent children. They are always thinking about improving his business. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise to stock his business. He needs the income to cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en:
Mateo D. is from Bonbonon, Iligan City. He is 51 years old, married, and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Mateo owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mateo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Mateo’s 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Bonbonon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Angela Ines

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, encontramos el Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo, que se reúnen cada quince días.
 
La señora Ángela esta casada y tiene tres hijos de esta relación que están estudiando  en el colegio.  Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella hace siete ciclos es socia del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta por eso, le gusta porque los pagos son muy fáciles de cumplir y los intereses son muy bajos.

Se dedica al comercio, venden ropa por catalogo, productos de Avon  (productos de belleza,  perfumería y accesorios), trabaja todos los días desde las 14h00 hasta las 17h00, deja a crédito y cobra todos los fines de semana, realiza los pedidos cada fin de mes, los pedidos de ropa los recibe en el centro en Portoviejo en una distribuidora.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más de su mercadería ya que tiene varios pedidos y no tiene capital propio para cancelar.
 
Su sueño es  tener su propia distribuidora.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, in a neighborhood known as "Las Piedras," we find the communal bank "Caminantes de Cristo," which meets every 15 days.

Angela is married, and she and her husband have 3 children who are studying in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has been a member of this communal bank for 7 loan cycles, and she is very pleased to be a member; she likes it because the payments are very easy to make and the interest charged is very low.

Angela works in retail trade, selling clothing and Avon products (beauty products, perfumes and accessories) through a catalog.  She works every day from 2pm until 5pm.  She extends credit to her customers and makes her collections during the weekends.  She takes orders at the end of every month, and she receives those orders from a distributor in central Portoviejo.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, since she has a number of orders and she does not have enough capital of her own to complete them.

Her dream is to have her own distribution business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, beauty products, perfumes and accessories

loans.name: Necty

texts.es:
Necty Hernández Z. es una señora de 62 años de edad y junto a su única nieta reside en el Barrio El Centro en el municipio de Guata, Olancho.

Necty tiene un negocio de servicio de fotocopiado y venta de útiles escolares e insumos para oficinas que opera bajo el nombre de “Papelería Luis Fernando”. Ella aprendió de este negocio por su hija, lamentablemente ésta falleció y Necty tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio. Desde entonces su nieta y ella se turnan de 7:00 am a 7:00 pm para atender a los clientes. Su ventaja es que tiene una muy buena clientela porque la competencia es poca, ya que en el pueblo solo existen dos negocios con ese servicio. Entre los desafíos que enfrenta se encuentran la pérdida irreparable de su hija, la crítica situación económica que está pasando ya que no tiene la ayuda de nadie y su estado de salud porque es diabética y necesita un tratamiento médico, pero a pesar de esas dificultades agradece a Dios porque hasta el momento humildemente no le ha faltado nada.

Ella solicita el préstamo para la reparación de una impresora y comprar útiles escolares. Con el apoyo de este financiamiento considera que tendrá un mejor ingreso económico.

Sus sueños son que su negocio crezca para obtener mejores ganancias y así seguir apoyando a su nieta para que continúe estudiando hasta graduarse. Es su segundo ciclo en FAMA y con los prestamos que ha obtenido su negocio siempre ha estado bien surtido.
texts.en:
Necty Hernández Z. is 62 years old and lives with her only granddaughter in the El Centro neighborhood in the municipality of Guata, Olancho.

Necty has a photocopying service business and sells school and office supplies which she operates under the name "Papeleria Luis Fernando". She learned this business from her daughter, unfortunately she died and Necty had to take over the business. Since then she and her granddaughter take turns from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm attending to customers. Her advantage is that she has a very good clientele because competition is limited since there are only two businesses in town that provide this service. Among the challenges she faces are the irreparable loss of her daughter, the critical economic situation since she does not have help from anyone and her health because she is diabetic and needs medical treatment. Despite these difficulties she thanks God because humbly, until this time she has not lacked anything.

She is requesting this loan to repair a printer and to buy school supplies. With the help of this loan she thinks she will have a better income.

Her dreams are that her business will grow so that she can have greater profits and thus continue to support her granddaughter so that she can continue studying until she graduates. This is her second loan cycle with field partner FAMA and with the loans she has obtained her business has always been well stocked.

loans.use: Repair a printer and buy school supplies.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora Sonia V. es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la  ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico el que fue nombrado en diciembre de 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy amable y cordial quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora. Sonia tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 5, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en donde se encarga de distribuir gaseosas, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Sonia se dedica a elaborar chuzos (carne en palito), actividad que le viene realizando hace 6 años, su producto lo vende recorriendo la ciudad de domingo a domingo sin descansar un solo día,  su horario de trabajo es de 4 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche.

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y ha sido invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa de la banca. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir como capital para su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Sonia V. is a member of the community bank Al Arenal.  She lives by the area called Feria Libre in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the beauty of its streets, its historic center was named in December 1999 as a cultural heritage site.  Its people are very nice and warm, and want to maintain their culture and traditions.

Señora Sonia is 24 years old.  She is married and has 3 children of 5, 4, and 2 years of age.  Her first son is studying in school.  Her husband works in a factory where his job is to distribute soft drinks.  They do not have their own home and so they rent.

Doña Sonia works making chuzos (meat on little sticks), work that she has been doing for 6 years.  She sells her product by walking around the city from Sunday to Sunday without resting one single day.  Her schedule is to work from 4 in the afternoon until 7 at night.

This is the second loan that she has taken with the community bank, and she has been invited by a friend who is an active member of the bank.  The money from her loan will be invested as working capital for her business.  Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: Working funds for Sonia's business

loans.name: Jorvin Antonio

texts.es:
Jorvin tiene 21 años de edad, estudia IV año de Ingeniería Agropecuaria, vive en Palacaguina, Quiso estudiar esta carrera, porque siempre le atrajo y le llama la atencion concer mas acerca de los clutivos que se cosechan en la Region.

Tambien dice tener mucho interes en mejorar a la sociedad del campo productivo.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Producción de Productos Lácteos.

Quiere terminar su carrera, trabajar la Alacaldia.
texts.en:
Jorvin is 21 years old.  He is in his fourth year of studying agricultural engineering. He lives in Palacaguina.  He wanted to study for this career because it has always attracted him.  He wants to know more about the crops that are grown in the region.

He also is very interested in improving the farming community.

He used this loan to buy supplies for a university project for the production of dairy products.   

He wants to finish his career education and work for the city.

loans.use: Agricultural industry student project for making dairy products

loans.name: Manzanitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “MANZANITAS” es uno grupo que inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro focal de Cascada, cuenta con ocho integrantes.  La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora Celsa,  como tesorera la señora Justina y como secretaria de actas a la señora Eustaquia. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de focos (cinco socias), artesanía elaboración de mantas, venta de comida

La señora Celsa, presidenta de la banca comunal “Manzanitas” tiene un hogar conformado por su pareja y siete hijos.  Es parte de la banca comunal debido a que una amiga le invitó a participar de la misma. Con respecto a su negocio  ella  lleva  10 años en el negocio de venta de comida, inició este emprendimiento por motivación personal.   Actualmente solicita Bs.1500.- para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de la comida.
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella dice “las reuniones”.
texts.en:
The “Manzanitas” community bank is a group which is beginning its first loan cycle with the Cascada regional office.  It has eight members.  The president of this cycle's executive committee is Celsa, the treasurer is Justina and the secretary is Eustaquia.  The ladies all have different businesses and these include: light bulb sales (five members), handicrafts, making blankets and food sales.

Celsa, the president of the “Manzanitas” community bank, lives with her partner and seven children.  She became a member of her community bank when her friend invited her to take part.  She has been selling food for 10 years.  She started in this business through her own initiative.  She is currently requesting 1,500 bolivianos to buy supplies for making food.

When we asked her what she most liked about Pro Mujer she said “the meetings”.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
This is Joy V., 37.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo V.. Together they have one child, who stays at home managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Joy has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at retail rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales everyday.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Joy dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen S. is a 58-year-old clothing vendor residing in Phnom Penh City. She currently sells clothing for both men and women in her community, and this business provides her with an income of approximately $2 a day. She is married with a son who is a fisherman. Pen S. is an energetic woman who never wastes time as she works to earn money to support her family. She has managed her investments carefully and has attracted a large number of clients due to her communication skills. In order to better meet her customers' demands, she would like a loan to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en: Baljinnyam is 60 years old and lives with her grandson in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She moved to her current town in 1992 after living in the countryside as a herder. Baljinnaym operates a clothes making business in which she not only sews the traditional Mongolian style clothing, but also sews ger covers, belt and rope etc. Baljinnyam is a hardworking woman and is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase wool and fuzz to make belts and ropes for gers.

loans.use: To purchase wool and fuzz

loans.name: Rosa Alegria

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por la comunidad de La Ramada que  pertenece al cantón Nabon, este sector es de clima frió su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.
 
Doña Rosa tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, tres de ellos son casados de los que solo dos viven independientes y uno vive en su casa y comparte los gastos, sus otros hijos de 16, 12, 8 y 6 años de edad, estudian en el colegio y en escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, han logrado construir su casa propia en unión conyugal.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas las que son para su consumo y las vende en su comunidad, también cría animales como: cerdos, cuyes y gallinas.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace un años y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas en el, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas y en su alimento. Su sueño es  mejorar su casita.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the Nuevo Bankito la Ramada Banco Comunal. She lives in the La Ramada  community in the Nabon canton, which has a cold climate.  Her people work in farming and raising cattle.

Señora Rosa is 49 years old. She is married and has seven children, three of whom are married and out of those three only two live independently and the other one lives in her house and shares the expenses. Her other children, aged 16, 12, 8 and 6, attend elementary school and high school in the community. Her husband works as a builder, and they have built their own family home themselves.

Señora Rosa works in farming, growing vegetables for their own consumption and to sell in the community. She also rears animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.

She has been a member of the Banco Comunal for one year and she likes the fact that she has good friends there. She will use the money from her loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. Her dream is to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Mauricio Javier

texts.es: Mauricio Javier tiene 42 años. Su actividad económica es la venta d plátanos. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica este negocio. Por lo que esta es la primera experiencia con créditos, se encuentra muy contento con aprender de esta experiencia. Inicio desde muy joven con este negocio pues su familia necesitaba de ingresos para mejorar su condición familiar. Mauricio siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable, y le ha gustado ganarse el dinero de una manera muy decente y trabajadora.  El sueña con aumentar su negocio. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria ya que tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Mauricio Javier is 42 years old.  His business is selling bananas.  He has been in this business for more than 2 years.  This is his first experience with loans.  He is very happy to learn from the experience.

Mauricio started in this business at a very young age because his family needed income to improve their status.  Mauricio has always been a very responsible man and he has enjoyed earning his money in a very honorable and hard-working way.  He dreams of increasing his business and will use this loan to buy the raw materials that he needs since he has a lot of orders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vajaida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MOSOQ ALLPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vajaida; la socia tiene 32 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia viaja hasta la ciudad de Lima para comprar mercadería y así poder tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes, ella trabaja conjuntamente con su mama hace ya un par de meses atrás, la socia es una persona bien alegre y de esta forma ella saca  a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vajaida is a member of the "MOSOQ ALLPA” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Vajaida is 32 years old, married, and has 1 child.  Her business is buying and selling clothes.  She travels to the city of Lima to buy her merchandise so that she has a better variety of products to offer her customers.  She has been working together with her mom for a couple of months now.  She is a very cheerful person and this is how she gets her family ahead in life.

Vajaida is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn G. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 51 years old, married and blessed with 6 children, 4 of adult age and 2 of school age. Marilyn is currently engaged in furniture making, with the help of her husband, and she also operates a food supplements business, selling to her neighbors and friends. Marilyn has been engaged in this business for 31 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC.

Marilyn is now requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more materials for furniture making. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living standards.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: to purchase materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Fede

texts.en:
Fede is 35 years old and married with one child.

Fede works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Fede has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from a videoke machine.

Fede aspires to expand her business and have her house repaired.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Ada

texts.es: Ada tiene 27 años, convive desde hace 4 años con Edwin. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, a los que educan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Casacoto. Desde hace 5 años comenzó su camino por la agricultura; sus principales sembríos constan de papa y avena; los cuales fertiliza constantemente para después vender su cosecha en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Pero afirma que la compra y venta de papa, es lo que más le gusta; pues viaja constantemente a la costa a comercializar un promedio de 10 kilos de semilla de papa por cada viaje. Además de tener el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como peón en diferentes cultivos, donde le pagan un jornal de S/. 23 soles al día, obteniendo así una ganancia extra para poder solventar los gastos familiares y de la educación de sus hijos, por los que está pensando sembrar en mayores cantidades para ahorrar y así abrir un negocio en la que estará más tranquila, asimismo desea incurisonar en la venta de animales para así aumentar sus ganancias y asegurar el futuro de sus familia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sembradoras de Casacoto”, y este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe por parte de los integrantes de su asociación. Ada, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 toros que cuestan un promedio de S/ 1500 soles; los cuales ensebará y venderá a un mayor precio, ya que tiene campos libres y llenos de pasto donde puede criarlos.
texts.en:
Ada is 27 years old and has been living with Edwin for 4 years. Together they have two children, whom they are bringing up in their own home located in the little village of Casacoto. 

Five years ago she began her path in agriculture. Her principal plantings consist of potatoes and oats, which she fertilizes regularly so that she can then sell her crops in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. But she confirms that the purchase and sale of potatoes is what she likes most. She travels regularly to the coast to sell an average of 10 kilos of seed potatoes each trip. In addition she has the support of her husband, who works as a laborer in different fields, where they pay him a daily rate of 23 PEN, thus obtaining extra earnings to pay for the family expenses and the education of their children. For this reason she is thinking of planting in larger quantities so that they can save and thus open a business in which her life could be more peaceful. 

She belongs to the community bank "Sembradoras de Casacoto" (Planters of Casacoto), and this is her third loan with MFP, where she feels grateful for the support that she receives from the members of her association. Ada will invest the money from the loan she is applying for in the purchase of two bulls, which cost an average of 1500 PEN and which she will fatten and sell at a better price, since she has some unused pastures where she can raise them.

loans.use: to buy two bulls

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 35 years old. Sheila is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sheila operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Sheila has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Sheila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sheila is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell like shampoo and soap. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Sheila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell, like shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Ульжаева Раъно проживает в районе Яван. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем, имеет 6 детей. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации на заработках, а дети живут отдельно. Сама Раъно занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже три года. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Rano U. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 46 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband works in the Russian Federation, and their children live on their own.  Rano is involved in animal husbandry.  She raises livestock for subsequent sale.  Rano has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 47 years old, married and his spouse contributes to the family income. They have four children who are 20, 15, 9, and 4 years old. He has been farming and raising rabbits for about six years with an income of 7,000 Kenya shillings per month.

He is taking his third loan from KADET after successfully repaying the previous one. He wants to use the loan to buy farm inputs and more rabbits. He hopes to establish a green house and raise the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and rabbits.

loans.name: Mariscal Sucre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARICAL SUCRE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Magaly. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, cultivo, venta de comida, venta de juegos didácticos y servicios.

La señora Magaly,  indica que hace un 13 años que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un como negocio venta de juegos didácticos, que inicio, hace unos meses atrás. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de mercadería (compra de juegos didácticos) que los comprará de la Ceja (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella tiene un hijo.
texts.en:
The “MARICAL SUCRE” community bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  It is managed by a board of directors, which is led by Magaly.  The group's members are engaged in a range of different business activities, including: commerce, production, farming, selling food, selling educational games, and services.

Magaly tells us that she joined the institution 13 years ago, through an invitation from a loan officer.  She currently has a business selling educational games that she set up a few months ago.

Magaly will use the loan that she is receiving to buy merchandise (educational games) which she will buy in La Ceja (a commercial area of the city of El Alto).  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She has one child.

loans.use: to buy educational games

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en: Anitha is the mother of two children who are two and four years old. She is 31 years old and has enrolled her older child in school. For the last four years, she has made a living by selling second-hand clothes, and has used her income to educate her children and set aside money to expand her business. She is applying for this loan to buy more clothing to sell and to expand her business. She plans to save the additional profit she earns as a result of this loan.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 42 year-old married father of three children, between five years and two months old. He runs a retail shop in Mariakani.  His business has been in operation for the last twelve years and has been a success. 

He  has been a KADET client, and this marks his second loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to install electricity and to add more stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea to his business.  The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business.  His dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to install electricity and add more stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves

loans.name: Lesfia María

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lesfia, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. El marido trabaja en una bananera. Está en el Grupo De Crédito por 8 ciclos, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque todas sus compañeras son muy ordenadas y cumplidas.

Ella se gana un dinero extra vendiendo comidas rápidas, para lo cual cuenta con una carreta que es donde vende los alimentos, ella vende hamburguesas, hot dog y también arroz con menestra y carne asada, esto lo realiza de lunes a jueves ya que el viernes muy de mañana se desplaza  a las playas de Manta con la finalidad de adquirir mariscos que luego lleva a entregar a otras ciudades, nos cuenta que cada semana se desplaza a ciudades distintas en el cual entrega sus productos y se queda en ella todo el fin de semana ya que entrega y después realiza los cobros respectivos. Lleva 9 años que se dedica a la venta de comida y 6 meses a la venta de mariscos y le está yendo muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pan, salchichas, carne, pescado, camarón, etc. tanto para preparar los alimentos como para la venta.

Sus sueños son tener un carro ya que hasta ahora se traslada en carros de cooperativa y esto es muy complicado.
texts.en:
The beautiful resort area of San Jacinto is surrounded by a beautiful beach, a place where the Portoviejo River converges with the sea.  It is visited by many national and foreign tourists.  “The Esperanza Para Superar” communal bank meets here every two weeks.

Here we meet Lesfia.  She is 40 years old, has three adult children, and her husband works for a banana plantation.  She is the president of her group and has been a member for eight loan cycles.  She likes the group because all of her fellow members are organized and keep their promises.

She earns extra money making fast food and has a cart from where she sells her foods, such as hamburgers, hot dogs, and stew with rice and grilled meat.  She does this Monday through Thursday and also goes to Manta beach early in the morning to buy seafood to deliver to other cities.  She tells us that each week she goes to different cities to deliver her products and stays there all weekend because she makes her deliveries and respective collections.  She’s been selling food for nine years and seafood for six months and things are going well.

She will use the money from this loan to buy bread, hot dogs, meat, fish, shrimp, etc., both for preparing her dishes and to sell.

She hopes to get a car of her own because she currently uses co-op cars and it make things more difficult.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has three children.

Kazem has been an owner of a store selling fish and chicken, fresh and grilled since 2010. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $1200 loan to purchase grilled chicken machinery. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase machinery for making grilled chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his cash reserves so that he can purchase a newer taxi.

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en:
Otgontsetseg is a 43-year-old woman who lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She operates a small clothing sales business, and her spouse works as a manager at a local company. Her daughter and son attend high school and kindergarten. During the summer months, grandparents babysit her children, allowing her to work at her small business. 

She graduated as a pharmacist from a local university. However, she started to operate her clothing business in 2008 to support her family.  She rents a small stall at the largest indoor market in the city.  Her long term goal is to have her own clothing store.

Otgontsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase more clothes for this fall and increase her product range and selection.  She is a Transcapital repeat client and is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for this fall and increase her product range and selection.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh est âgé de 32 ans. Il habite au Sénégal. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il évolue dan le secteur du transport depuis plus de 2ans et conduit un véhicule taxi brousse.Parallèlement  il exerce une activité de commerce de vente de pièces de véhicule en provenance de Dubaï. Il a opté pour ces activités par amour mais  aussi dans le souci de gagner sa vie et lutter contre l’oisiveté.  Les moments les plus favorables pour son activité  coïncident  avec l’année scolaire. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 4 ans. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de pièces  de véhicules a revendre. Il souhaite compléter  son fond de roulement et mieux développer son activité de commerce. Son  principal objectif est d’acquérir une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
