Monsieur Cheikh is 32 years old. He lives in Sénégal. He is married and the father of one child. He has been working in the transport sector for more than two years and drives a taxi. At the same time, he sells vehicle spare parts coming from Dubai. He chose these businesses because he enjoys them but also in order to earn his living and struggle against idleness. 

The most favorable moments for his line of work coincide with the school year. He has been a member of a branch of U-IMCEC for four years. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to use to buy vehicle spare parts for resale. He would like to add to his working capital and further develop his business. His primary objective is to attain financial autonomy.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is 46 years old and a businesswoman who runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for nine years. She has retained the business because of her hard work and determination. She also depends on her husband's financial support for the business. Previously, she operated a boutique. Miriam hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, bread, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, bread, and sugar.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta, Nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo, el cual lo utilizara para comprar los productos básicos como, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pastas y detergentes, así como materia prima para las pupusas (maíz, quesillo, chicharon) de esa forma podrá tener siempre lo necesario para mantener el negocio y continuar vendiendo productos de primera necesidad, tambien pupusas.
Despues del primer prestamo ella ha cambiado, pues su negocio crecio y tiene mejores opciones para incrementar las ventas, tambien por cada venta tiene un margen de ganancia para acumular el pago de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Once again Marta is asking for a loan to buy basic products like rice, sugar, beans, pasta and detergents as well as ingredients to make pupusas (corn, cheese and pork) so that she can have everything she needs to keep the business going selling basic use items and also pupusas.

After the first loan, she changed because the business grew and now she has better options for increasing sales and she also has a profit margin on each sale to save and make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy pasta, detergent and ingredients to make pupusas (cheese and pork).

loans.name: Kory Tawaco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY TAWACO” iniciará su decimo septimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Ibone. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cosméticos, venta de láminas educativas, cotillon e internet, comercio de mantas, comercio de productos YAMBAL, venta de clinex y cosméticos, tienda, venta de comida, pasteleria, distribuidora de láminas. 

La señora Ibone  indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de sus vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de láminas educativas que viene trabajando hace cinco años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de laminas), que adquirirá de la Ceja y lo comercializa en su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones, la capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Kory Tawaco” is starting its 17th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. The group consists of 11 members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Ibone. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as selling cosmetics, selling laminated educational posters, selling party supplies, providing Internet services, selling blankets, selling Yanbal products, selling tissue paper and toiletries, selling food, managing a pastry shop, and distributing laminated posters.

Sra. Ibone says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago after being invited by her neighbors. She currently has a business of selling laminated educational posters that she has managed for five years. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her inventory of laminated posters that she will acquire in La Ceja and then sell from her home. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Ibone is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Ibone said that she enjoys the meetings, the training classes, and the health services.

loans.use: to buy laminated educational posters for resale.

loans.name: Amie Rose

texts.en:
Amie Rose is married with 4 children. She is 34 years old, residing in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Amie Rose operates a retail business, home products sales, to earn a living and has had this business for more than 6 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

Amie Rose has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. She will use the returns from her business to sustain the needs of her family and for the educational plan of her 4 kids. She is hoping that her business will help them so much. In the future, Amie Rose wishes that her business will progress.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tatasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Tatasuthekeh” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone.  They are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 SLL  for each (totaling 4,000,000 SLL) to enable them to further improve the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured in the right is Sallay, who is the leader of this group. Sallay was born in a small town called Mile-Ninety-One. She is married to a trader.  The couple has five children – three in primary school and two in secondary school.

Sallay sells ready-to-wear-clothes and has been doing business for 20 years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying a larger quantity of clothes to add to her current supply.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to her current supply.

loans.name: Daycis Del Socorro

texts.es: Daycis, originaria de Estelí , esta muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida atravez del préstamo  Kiva  pues lo invirtió en su venta de pollo , negocio  que le h ido muy bien , las ventas mejoraron al invertir mas , hizo mejoras en su casa ,  llegaron nuevos clientes , esta actividad ha sido muy positiva según nos expresa ella. Tiene una meta que le gustaría alcanzar la cual es poner otro puesto de venta de pollo y ampliar su negocio es por ello que esta solicitando un segundo préstamo en Kiva para comprar pollo y vender al por mayor y al detalle. Ya que su principal fuente de inspiración y esfuerzo son sus hijos para que ellos tengan un mejor futuros y sean profesionales.
texts.en: Deycis is from Estelí. She is very grateful for the help she received through the other Kiva loan. She invested it in her chicken selling, a business that has gone very well for her. Her sales improved when she invested more. She made improvements on her house, and gained more customers. This activity has been very positive, according to her. She has a goal that she would like to reach, and that is opening another stall to sell chicken and expand her business. That is why she is asking for a second Kiva loan to buy chicken to sell wholesale and retail. Her main source of inspiration and strength are her children, so that they can have a better future and learn a profession.

loans.use: to buy 750 pounds of chicken

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia ha sido cliente de CREDITUYO y el crédito fue para la construcción de unos cuartos no término de ampliar su casa, solo logro terminar una parte de las paredes y ahora le falta una pequeña parte para terminar los cuartos.
Con la señora Anastacia viven dos hijos mayores de edad, quienes desean tener su privacidad, y quienes le ayudan con los gastos de la casa. 
Doña Anastacia trabaja como empleada domestica y su esposo en albañil entre los dos han logrado un patrimonio seguro para su familia. Solicitan el préstamo para comprar el materia que es block, cemento, varilla y arena ya que el esposo de la señora Anatacia se encargara de terminar la mejora.
texts.en:
Sra. Anastacia has been a client of Credituyo and used her loan to build a few rooms, but she was not able to finish the expansion of her house. She was only able to finish part of the walls and now is missing a few small details in order to complete the rooms.

Sra. Anastacia lives with two grown children who want to have their privacy. They help with the household expenses. Doña Anastacia works as a housekeeper and her husband is a bricklayer. Between the two of them, they have built up a secure inheritance for their family. This loan will be used to buy materials such as blocks, cement, lumber, and sand. Sra. Anastacia’s husband will be responsible for completing these improvements.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for finishing the upper level of her house.

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Yeng, 24, is married and has two young children. 

She is a local farmer from Prey Chor district. She grows rice crops on her own farm land that she inherited from her grandparents. It is located near the path of the river that provides enough water to cover her corps both in rainy season and dry season. She generates around $2.00 per day from this business. 

Yeng would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a trailer to connect with her husband’s motorcycle that can be used to provide transportation services in the commune. In particular, he transports rice for local villagers during the harvesting season. 

Yeng plans to use her additional income generated from her business to better her living conditions and improve her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a trailer for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Grap Go Fenam Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the "Grap Go Fenam" group, meaning: "Get up go find it." They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a fast-growing town in western Sierra Leone, near Freetown, Sierra Leone's capital city. Together, they are requesting a loan of 2,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase their profits and consequently improve their standard of living.

The featured leader of this group is Fatmata. Fatmata is thirty-four years old; she was born in Lunsar town, northern Sierra Leone, but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children attend primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells clothes. With her share of this loan (500,000 SLL), she is going to buy a large quantity and a wide variety of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity and a wide variety of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Lawrence. Lawrence is a smallholder farmer based in Eldoret which is a fast-growing agricultural town in North Rift Valley, Kenya. He owns a small piece of land where he stays with his family of two children. On this farm, he keeps poultry and dairy cattle and grows various types of food crops as well. For the last seven years, Lawrence has been selling milk, eggs and crops from his farm to make a decent living. 

Lawrence is seeking a loan to purchase a piece of farm transportation equipment locally known as bodaboda. A bodaboda is an Indian motorcycle that has gained so much popularity in all rural areas of Kenya due to its affordable price and low maintenance requirements. Farmers in inaccessible areas rely on bodabodas to transport their produce to the market as well as ferry passengers at a small price. 

Your loan will help Lawrence acquire a means of transport suited for the poor road networks in Sosiani village. He will be able to offer shuttle services which are the only way of getting around and transporting goods in the area. Your lending towards this loan will help Lawrence cut down transportation costs that has been his highest expense for a very long time. Coming from a village where many roads are impassable by vehicles, the bodaboda will provide a cheap, versatile, quick, and reliable form of transportation over short and medium distances.

Acquisition of this asset will enable him to increase his income, save more, and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm transportation motorcycle

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Carmel, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 28 ans est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Cosme. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Carmel et son mari. Carmel n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour y arriver, Carmel vend du charbon de bois dans sa région depuis quinze ans environ. Carmel s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Carmel sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: St. David Horticultural Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Rose. She is 59 years, a widow blessed with two children. She is a member of St. David horticultural group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training. 
She is a dairy farmer. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds. This will help her increase her milk production hence increase her income. She will use the anticipated income to cater for her family’s basic needs such as food and clothing.
She appreciates Kiva and its lenders for the support and promises to pay without fail.

loans.use: to buy dairy feeds and increase in milk production hence more income to cater for  her family's basic needs such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma is 33 years old ,married with three children.She lives in Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam.She runs a food vending business to mostly fishermen along the shores of Indian Ocean in Kigamboni area.She has been in this business over 12 years.The profit earned from her business is very small.She has experienced minimal improvement over years.Last year she attended business and entrepreneurship training offered by Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO).From lessons she learned ,she noticed the non-improvement over the years were caused by her ignorance of how to handle her business effectively.She now want to improve the business by adding food supplying vessels,food wrapping materials for take-aways,hygienical food display cages and plastic sitting chairs and tables.Fatma has high credibility with lending institutions.She promised to repay in fully the amount to be loaned to her.She is in need of USD 550 to implement her plan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmita has 2 years of experience with this business, which first belonged to her sister, who at first hired Carmita to run it, and later sold it to her. She started out making "encebollado" (a kind of fish soup), but she found that activity tiring. Then she began selling articles of clothing. At present she combines the two activities. When she has to leave to deliver merchandise, she leaves her daughters in charge of the store. She works every day of the week from 6:30 AM until 10 PM.

Carmita wants this loan in order to be able to invest in her little store, which is a bit lacking in capital. She would like to be able to include other products.

Carmita is married. She is 40 years old and has 4 children, one of whom is still in school and also works. He helps a lot with the household income. Carmita's husband works driving a three-wheeler at the local outdoor market. He makes a daily income. Carmita hopes to be able to improve her house with the income that her business will generate.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her little store.

loans.name: Musili

texts.en: Mrs. Musili O. A., a 47-year-old woman living in a semi-rural area in Jattu, Edo State of Nigeria, sells female wrappers for a living. She is married with six (6) children. She hopes for the above amount for the expansion of her clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more wrappers for sale

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en: Maria Luisa P., 50, is a single mother of four children, ages 28, 25, 18, and 12. Two of her children still live with her and the other two children are professors. She started her business over 20 years ago, and is the owner of a restaurant known for its chicken. In addition to dishes of chicken, she also serves salads. She works every day starting early in the morning and working until she finishes selling her chickens which usually last until 11 pm. She purchases her chickens twice a week from a factory nearby and it takes her an entire day to marinate her chicken. She sells on average about ten chickens per day, but usually more on Saturdays and Sundays when more people eat out. Maria does not sell other kinds of meat because it is more expensive to buy and she runs the restaurant by herself with the occasional help of her children. She is seeking a loan to purchase beer and chickens to operate her business.

loans.use: Purchase beer and chicken.

loans.name: Muminadjhon

texts.ru:
Muminadjhon V. is married and has 3 children. She has high school education. Muminadjhon sells household goods. Her children attend school and her husband drives a taxi and helps his wife to deliver the goods. Muminadjhon used to borrow the goods from the suppliers. When she became a MicroInvest borrower, Muminadjhon’s business assets amounted to $500. Since taking the loan, Muminadjhon started to pay cash to purchase her goods. She opened a store in center of Kayrakkum. Muminadjhon acquired a number of clients-wholesalers. In the future, she plans to open another location.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вахобова Муминаджон мать 3 детей, замужем, образование среднее. Занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров. Дети учатся в школе, муж работает таксистом, также помогает жене в торговле, он привозит товар. Раньше брала товар у поставщиков в долг. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2005году, тогда её активы составляли 500$. После получения займа она стала покупать товар за наличные, открыла магазин в центре городка Кайраккума, приобрела много клиентов оптовиков. В будущем планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: To open another place of business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary N. is  49 years old, married with 3 children. She comes from in Abule, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and foodstuffs and she has been in business since 2004. She needs the loan $550 to buy more crates of drinks and more foodstuffs to sell to increase the profit in her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & foodstuffs  for sale.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise O. is a 32-year-old, dynamic woman. She lives with her cohabitant and their two children in Sassandra, a rural city on the south-west Atlantic coast of Cote d'Ivoire. Ms. O. has been selling vegetables such as onions, eggplant, okra, and tomatoes in the Sassandra market for years. She is a member of the cooperative of tradeswoman of Sassandra.

Ms. O. significantly contributes to household expenses and is proud to have been able to send her 2 children to school. Her cohabitant is a truck driver. Ms. O. has been in AE&I microcredit program since 2005 and has been a good performer.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for re-sale at the market

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana I. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 30 years old, married and has two children.

She and her husband (Her husband is pictured) sell perfumes, and other items in the Beylagan city bazaar. They're requesting a loan in the amount of $1200 to diversify they're inventory.

loans.use: To diversify  the inventory

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
S. Rustam is 21 years old. He is not married. He is living with his parents and supporting them and he has already become the main bread-winner.

Rustam sells sporting accessories like training suits and sneakers, training equipment, footballs, tennis balls and others. The business is stable and generates the main income for the family. Now Rustam is planning to enlarge the range of goods he sells. For this purpose he requests 1000.00 US dollars for the term of 6 months.

This is the second loan of Rustam and the previous one was managed with accuracy. Rustam thanks everyone supporting him and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of sporting accessories for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.es:
Eulalia, Lidia and Bertha have belonged to the Obreras community bank for 4, 3 and 4 years respectively.

Eulalia lives with her partner, is 51 years old and has 6 children, 2 of whom live with her. Eulalia sells watches as an ambulatory vendor along Grau street, the products are purchased in Lima. In addition, Eulalia runs a small general store from her home.

Lidia, on the other hand, is married, 35 years old and has 2 children. Lidia has a general store in a rented commercial space. When she started off she had very little capital but currently the business is well-stocked.

Bertha is a single mother, 27 years old and has a daughter. Bertha initially sold fruit but left that business because it did not generate enough income. She currently works in a restaurant. Bertha plans to build her house so that she can open a general store.

Eulalia, Lidia and Bertha need loans in order to buy different types of watches, rice, oil and in Bertha´s case, buy materials to build her house.

Eulalia and Lidia dream of buying homes and that their children become professionals and Bertha dreams of building her house and having her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Eulalia, Lidia y Bertha pertenecen al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 4, 3, 4 años respectivamente.

Eulalia es conviviente, tiene 51 años y 6 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella, Eulalia vende relojes de manera ambulatoria en la calle Grau, productos que son comprados en Lima. Además Eulalia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Lidia es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Lidia tiene una tienda de abarrotes, en un local alquilado, al iniciar tenía muy poco capital, actualmente su negocio es surtido.

Mientras que Bertha es madre soltera, tiene 27 años e hija, Bertha inicialmente vendía frutas, negocio que dejo de realizar porque no le generaba ganancias. Actualmente Bertha trabaja en un restaurante. Bertha tiene proyectado construir su casa para abrir una tienda de abarrotes.

Eulalia, Lidia y Bertha necesitan dinero que será invertido en la compra de relojes de diferentes modelos, arroz, aceite y Bertha comprará materiales para la construcción de su casa.

Los sueños de Eulalia y Lidia son comprar una casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales, y de Bertha construir su casa y tener una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of different types of watches, rice, oil and construction materials.

loans.name: Mohammad Ashraf

texts.en: Mohammad Ashraf lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a photo shop and he has good experience in his business. He has already successfully completed his first cycle loan and expanded his stock. Still, he wants to further expand his business with full success, so now he has requested his second cycle loan to enlarge his shop so as to attract more customers and make good income to help his family. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand his shop

loans.name: Maria Patrocinio

texts.es:
Maria is married. Her husband works in a mine and they have two children who are 12 and eight years of age and who both study. She decided to start a business in order to help her husband with the family’s expenses and to have a productive activity. She began in 2005 when a friend commented that the sale of catalog lingerie was a good business.

She is requesting a loan of US $400, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise and fulfill the orders that she has. With your help, she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

María es casada, su esposo trabaja en una mina y tienen 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años, ambos estudiando. Ella decidió emprender un negocio para apoyar en los gastos familiares a su esposo y tener una actividad productiva. Empezó en el 2006, cuando una amiga le comento que la venta de lencería por catalogo era un buen negocio, y así fue como empezó.

Solicita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir los pedidos que tiene. Con tu ayuda ella podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en: Nargiz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region. She is a mother of 3 children. This woman has been in the dairy business for 6 years. Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy a cow for improving her dairy business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Thi Thuan

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Thuan, 45 years old, has 2 school-going children. In 1998, she joined TYM Fund to improve her family's economy. She borrowed 500,000VND in the first loan to invest in raising cattle. After 10 years, her family's economy has improved significantly and she is able to send her children to school. Currently, she is raising cattle extensively, thus in the next loan she would like to borrow 6,000,000VND (375USD) to purchase more cows. Her average monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 188USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuận năm nay 45 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 2 con đang đi học. Năm 1998 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn đầu chị vay 500.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, đến nay qua 10 năm sử dụng vốn kinh tế gia đình chị đã có sự phát triển rõ rệt. Các con của chị đều được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi theo mô hình trang trại. . Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000đ để đầu tư vào mua bò về nuôi. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising cows

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Ms. Salimata Samaké is 34 years old, has five children, and lives in the Hérémakono Nord district of the city of Bougouni (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali) in a polygamous family with her two co-wives, their children, and their husband.

From a young age, she started earning an income, which she was obliged to set aside for reasons of marriage (immigration to the Republic of Cote d’Ivoire). Back in Mali, she started working again, specializing for ten years in the sale of Wax pagnes (highly prized cloth in West Africa), beauty products, and children’s clothing.

She has been associated with Soro Yiriwaso for three years now. After having completed three group loans (solidarity loans) with an association in her district, she is on her second individual loan. And all of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

She intends to use this loan to buy 20 dozen items of children’s clothing, 15 dozen bed sheets, and 30 lengths of Wax pages (cloth that is highly prized by women in West Africa). She gets her supplies exclusively from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers recognized in her specialization. Her sales outlet is located in the grand marketplace of the city of Bougouni.

She makes retail sales, by cash and on credit payable monthly, especially for salaried workers. Her customers are composed of women for the most part. She hopes to realize a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will serve to cover the loan interest and to begin construction on her house, in order to get away from the trials and tribulations of renting.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Madame Salimata Samaké a 34 ans, 5 enfants et vit dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (Région de Sikasso République du Mali ) dans une famille polygame avec ses 2 coépouses leurs enfants et leur époux.

Dès son jeune âge elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus qu’elle fut obligée de mettre en veilleuse pour des raisons de mariage (immigration vers la République de la Côte d’ivoire). De retour au Mali, elle reprend les activités économiques en se spécialisant dans la vente des pagnes wax (tissu très prisé en Afrique de l’ouest), des produits de beauté et des vêtements pour enfants, il y ’a de cela 10 ans.

Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir bouclé trois prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) avec une association de son quartier elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.

Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 20 douzaines de vêtements pour enfants, 15 douzaines de draps de lits, 30 pièces de pagnes wax (tissu très prisé par les femmes en Afrique de l’Ouest) Elle s’approvisionne exclusivement à partir de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès de grossistes reconnus du domaine de sa spécialisation. Son lieu de vente est situé au grand marché de la ville de Bougouni.

Elle vend en détail au comptant et à crédit payable mensuellement surtout aux salariés. Sa clientèle est composée en grande majorité de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et à commencer la construction de sa maison pour se défaire des péripéties de la location.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing and Wax pagnes cloth

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đỗ Thị Hải năm nay 37 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có 3 con đang tuổi đến trường. Năm 2000 chị Hải xin tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị xin vay để chăn nuôi,  sau đó chị nhận thấy nhu cầu tiêu dùng hoa quả của người dân địa phương ngày càng cao nên các vòng vốn sau chị đều dành một phần vốn vay để kinh  doanh hoa quả. Hàng ngày ngoài thời gian đi bán hoa quả  chị còn tranh thủ nấu thêm rượu để tạo thêm nguồn thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi. Chồng chị ngoài thời gian đi làm thợ xây cũng hỗ trợ thêm cho chị trong công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình. Vì thế tuy còn trẻ tuổi nhưng gia đình chị là một trong những gia đình có kinh tế ổn định trong thôn xóm. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000 để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và thêm vốn để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh hoa quả.
texts.en:
Mrs Đỗ Thị Hải is 37 years old. She has 3 children who are still attending school. In 2002, she became a TYM fund member to get a loan to invest in animal raising to increase her income. She got her first loan and invested it in animal raising. Later on she noticed that the demand for flowers and fruits was increasing so she invested part of her loan to buy fruits and flowers to resell. Everyday she sells flowers & fruits. She also brews wine and uses the waste from brewing as feed for her animals. Her husband is a construction worker. He helps her out in tending the animals. Despite her young age , she and her family have a steady income and considered as successful by the villagers. This time she is seeking a loan of 15.000.000 VND to invest in her animal raising and selling flower & fruits.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business fruits

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta L., 50, is married with 3 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the taxi business. She sells to the public 6 days a week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Ruta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy a door handle for the taxi, car lights, paint and tires to replace the old ones. Her husband is helping her operating the business.

loans.use: Purchasing a door handle, car lights, paint and tires

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es: hola nosotras somos el grupo San Marcos estammos ubicados en el municipio de Danli, nosotras nos conocemos muy bien y siempre hemos trabajado juntas, somos vecinas de nuestra comunidad, nnuestro grupo se integra de esta forma:nElsa del Carmen S.: soy la coordinadora del grupo me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de comida, venta de refrescos, mi especialidad son las golosinas y los almuerzos, tengos varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad.nAda Linda M. R.: ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de comidas, refrescos. sus clientes son el personal que trabaja en la tabacalera Plasencia, tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y atraves de ella ha logrado adquirir parte de lo que hoy posee en su casa, tambien le ayuda a su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar.nEvelyn T.: la actividad de ella es la elaboracion y venta de comidas, este negocio le permite ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa.nTodas nosotras hemos salido adelente durante varios años, esto se debe a la buena administracion que tenemos en nuestos negocios.
texts.en:
Hello, we are from the group San Marcos. We are located in the municipality of Danli. We know each other very well and we have always worked together. We are neighbours in our community and our group is made up as follows: Elsa del Carmen S.: I am the coordinator of the group and I prepare and sell foods, and soft drinks, although my specialty is snacks and breakfasts. I have many years of running this business. Ana Linda M. R.: her occupation is the preparation and the sales of foods and soft drinks. Her clients are the employees of the Plasencia tabacco compnay. She has more than 5 years at this activity and throughout she has managed to acquire part of what is in her home. She also helps her husband to cover the household expenses. Evelyn T.: she prepares and sells foods. This business allows her to help her husband cover the household expenses. All of us have been able to make it past many difficult years, and this is thanks to the sound administration of our businesses.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase foods.
